story:
The first 800 Argos Tag orders will receive BOTH the beta Argos Tag and the new and improved Argos Tag! These 800 people will have a direct impact on our new Argos Tag!


**************************************************************

 

Lilly: The Beginning of TagaPet

My family has owned dogs my entire life, but it was not until two years ago that I adopted my first dog. I had a co-worker who was giving away puppies and I couldn't resist. Against my parents better judgement, I decided to adopt Lilly.  I quickly felt those new parent feelings of love, attachment, and anxiety. 

After a couple months of having Lilly I began to wonder what I would do if she were ever lost. Where would I go? Who would I call? But most importantly, would I ever see her again? It was these fears that led me to a new idea.

As pet owners, we still rely on the archaic metal engraved pet tag that has been around for centuries. What if I was able to make an affordable tag that was more than a name and phone number? Lilly's tag should do more than just dangle; it should ACTIVELY help guide her home.


A "Ruff" Problem

My new idea caused me to wonder about other lost pets. After doing some research, I realized that lost pets are a much bigger problem than I thought. Here are a few of the stats that really stood out to me. 

  • 1 in 3 pets will be lost in their lifetime. 
  • 5-7 million pets are lost each year in the United States.
  • Less than 15% of dogs and 2% of cats are returned to their owners!

I knew I had stumbled upon a large problem that affected millions of people. With the amount of technology we have today, isn't there more we can do? 


TagaPet is Born

Then it hit me, nowadays basically everyone has a smartphone, so what if there was a pet tag that could be scanned by a smartphone to access more information? I decided to run the idea by my two pet loving friends Mac and Ben. They shared my enthusiasm, so after college we formed the company TagaPet.

It has been a little over a year now since we formed TagaPet. We have spent our time learning about the industry, studying pet behavior, building prototypes, and developing our system. We have sold our prototype Argos Tags in 19 different states, tagged over 115 pets, and had pets returned using our system! Here is a short video explaining what TagaPet is today:


Here are pictures of the two prototype Argos Tags we have developed:


What does the TagaPet Argos Tag Do?

  • When the tag is scanned, the GPS location is immediately e-mailed to the owner.
  • Upon scan, the user will be taken to a pet profile like the one below. This profile contains pet picture, pet information, and owner information.

  • This pet tag can be scanned by any smartphone using a QR code scanner or NFC (Near Field Communication). If you aren't familiar with NFC click here and learn about the history and multiple uses of NFC.
  • In the event a TagaPet pet is lost, the owner can get on the pet profile and click "Report Lost". Once the button is pressed, lost pet alerts are sent through Twitter, Facebook, local animal shelters/rescues, and to local veterinarians. Now everyone in your area is on the lookout for your pet!

Why We Need Money

The TagaPet team was recently accepted into an international business accelerator called StartupBootcamp (Click here to find out more about the program). To be accepted into this program is a huge honor and brings us one step closer to solving the problem of lost pets. In a nutshell, StartupBootcamp will help us set up our company so we can efficiently scale, help us perfect our product and system, give us even more tech help, introduce us to some of the world's top business leaders, and much more.

 

The money that you give us will do more than buy a pet tag that actively protects your pet. Your money will allow us to make the most of StartupBootcamp. If we reach our fundraising goal we will be able to not only perfect our current system, but develop NEW innovative tags that will have even more capabilities! One of these new products will be an affordable real-time tracker, with exceptional battery life, called the Cavall Tag.


The TagaPet Team


Ben Wilson, Co-founder and CTO

A native of Danville, KY, Ben is a 2012 graduate of Furman University with a B.S. in IT. As CTO, Ben develops and manages TagaPet's online assets. In his spare time Ben enjoys relaxing with his dog Yogi and exploring new pet protection options.

                                       Mac Glidewell, Co-founder and COO

Mac hopes to one day say that he helped create the solution to the problem of lost pets. While living with Michael and Lilly in college, Mac helped further develop the idea of TagaPet. In his free time, Mac enjoys sports and the outdoors.

Michael Ward, Co-founder and CEO

Michael's dog, Lilly, has changed his life and was the inspiration for starting TagaPet. Michael graduated from UK with a degree in Business Administration. He is the CEO of TagaPet and in his free time he enjoys being outside.

story:
The People's Dress

On September 21, 2014 people from all over the world will march the streets of New York City to show world leaders the kind of future we want while confronting climate change.

I will be marching with them! Want to go but can't? Show your solidarity and come with me in spirit!

I am creating "The People's Climate Dress" to carry the presence of all the people around the world who want to attend the march but can't make it. So I need you! Purchase ribbons, cloth flowers, or a design of your choice that I can wear on the dress in your solidarity. Buy one for yourself, a friend, or as a blessing you want to be carried to New York.

How will the proceeds be used?

I will be using all funds towards the dress and the journey. I will be boarding The People's Climate Train on September 15 from Sacramento in time for the march in New York.

Budget:

(Airfare pending fluctuation)

Bus ticket, Eugene, OR - Sacramento, CA: $60
Train ticket, Sacramento - NYC:     $200
Airfare, NYC - PDX: $190
Dress, ribbons, fabric, supplies: $150

Monday - Food/Miscellaneous: $45
Tuesday - Food/Misc: $45
Wednesday -  Food/Misc: $45
Thursday - Food/Lodging/Transportation/Misc (FLTM):: $80
Friday - FLTM: $80
Saturday - FLTM: $80
Sunday -   FLTM: $80
Monday - FLTM: $80
Tuesday - FLTM: $80

Total: $1,350

The mission of The People's Climate March:

"A world with an economy that works for people and the planet; a world safe from the ravages of climate change; a world with good jobs, clean air and water, and healthy communities."

For more information read: www.peoplesclimate.org

Who am I?

A small town girl gone international. An Oregonian. An alumni of the University of Oregon. A lover of languages. An inquirer of how the world works. An initiator. A dancer. An antevasin. A daughter. A sister. A human being.


I left my small rural town for Ecuador my junior year of high school. The world was not what I thought. I dedicated the next chapter of my life to the two things I love; language and understanding this planet we call home. I focused on development studies in West Africa for my International Studies major and Spanish and French in my Romance Language major. My passions are wide and many of them shine through this project. The ones that are prominent are inclusiveness, creativity, and action. Thanks for taking the time to join me in this journey.

I march for my family. I march for my friends. I march for our future.

story:
We have now built nine new homes with the money raised. I have just updated the latest photos, you can see your money. This is an unusual project in that you have the chance to see the exact home your money builds and the family it gives a better future to. Thank you for believing in this campaign, please continue to do so as we help more families that receive no aid from elsewhere. 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Nepal. We all know of the earthquake. Many will have read of the funding issues with the government interfering with aid and dictating where it can be allocated. Many areas have no help at all. It is almost monsoon season. People have no waterproof shelter, they get wet when it rains. Their belongings get wet. The cycle repeats. There is no assistance for many. They need shelter that can withstand seismic activity and water. That can be customised by re-cycling windows and doors from ruined houses. 

One person from UK with a wealth of experience of working on world aid projects in Bangladesh and Nepal with award winning design shelters. For £95 they can make a waterproof basic home, in addition they teach the skills and leave the tools for the community to keep building homes. The more we raise, the more they build.

This is not a charity so fundraising is not so easy. This is just one person on the ground who want to keep building a future for those who desperately need it with the help of local people. In Nepal, not being a charity helps as the government does not interfere. There are pros and cons. What is promised is documented updates on the work and accounts on request. This is why we have turned to Indigogo. He is a builder not administrators. (I am merely the fundraiser on a mission)

He just come home from one visit but are fundraising to get back there as soon as possible.  Please see the Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Nepal-Emergency-Shelter-Home-Appeal/720832181373102

Our twitter account is https://twitter.com/BuildinNepal

We are asking that people who feel that they are able to contribute to building a future for this area of the world do so. Solidarity means a lot to those out there. Just knowing that someone, somewhere cared enough to keep them dry and support their life makes a difference. Please read the story on the picture and you can see that evidence. 

Thank you. £95 is one home and then we have flights and visas. Nobody stays in lavish facilities, again, please see the Facebook page and you can see how it works. This is simply real people helping real people in the fastest, most practical no-nonsense way possible.  Honesty is crucial and this campaign is not expected to be easily achieved but we hope that people support and while we cannot make a difference to everyone in need, we can help as many as possible and so can you. :)

This campaign has no political or religious bias, this is purely humans helping humans. Any questions welcomed. Thanks again.

story:
Hola!

My name is Monica Reyes and I own and operate a surf camp situated on the mouth of the Mendihuaca River, on the spectacular Caribbean coast of Colombia. I myself began surfing here 15 years ago and after travelling all around the world, learning different skills and immersing myself in a number of other surf cultures, I found myself returning to this very same spot to open Mendihuaca Surf School. It really is the most ideal place to surf; practicing what you already know or learning from the very beginning.

WHY DONATE?

I opened the school in 2016 and currently operate with 5 boards and one surf teacher; myself. With limited resources, I am only able to run 2 classes per day with 4 students per class max. At present, in the high season, classes are almost always full, leaving only 2 other boards to be rented. As one of the most rapidly growing tourist industries in the world, the current demand is high and ever increasing. I would obviously love to be able to expand the school, showing this uniquely remarkable culture to visitors from all over the world and sharing my passion for surfing with others. The surf school is situated halfway between Santa Marta and Palomino in Casagrande Surf. In recent years, as Colombia has begun to increasingly generate tourist interest, this strip of coast is being ever affected. Mendihuaca Surf and small businesses alike, help to provide jobs and more working opportunities to locals and generally bringing more business to the area.

MY PLAN...

I am looking to raise $12000 to aid the expansion of the surf school, including the purchase of 20 new boards. I want to be able to have enough foam boards to rent and run classes at the same time. I would also like to be able to get in other surf teachers in the area and perhaps from further afield, which would also open up employment opportunities for local surfers. In return for your generous support I am offering all sorts of perks from Mendihuaca merchandise to complimentary surf lessons and board rentals.

Please feel free to browse the page or look at our website, Facebook, Instagram and Youtube pages for more info!

www.mendihuacasurf.com/en/

Hola!

Mi nombre es Monica Reyes, soy propietaria y opero un campamento de surf situado en la desembocadura del río Mendihuaca, en la espectacular costa caribeña de Colombia. Yo mismo comencé a surfear aquí hace 15 años y después de viajar por todo el mundo, aprender diferentes habilidades y sumergirme en otras culturas del surf, me encontré volviendo a este mismo lugar para abrir Mendihuaca Surf. Realmente es el lugar más ideal para surfear; practicar lo que ya sabes o aprender desde el principio.

¿POR QUÉ DONAR?

Abrí la escuela en 2016 y actualmente trabajo con 5 tablas y un profesor de surf; yo misma. Con recursos limitados, solo puedo dirigir 2 clases por día con 4 estudiantes por clase máximo. En la actualidad, en temporada alta, las clases casi siempre están llenas, y solo se alquilan otras 2 juntas. Como una de las industrias turísticas de más rápido crecimiento en el mundo, la demanda actual es alta y está en aumento. Obviamente, me encantaría poder expandir la escuela, mostrar esta cultura extraordinaria a visitantes de todo el mundo y compartir mi pasión por el surf con otros. La escuela de surf se encuentra a medio camino entre Santa Marta y Palomino en Casagrande Surf. En los últimos años, a medida que Colombia ha comenzado a generar cada vez más interés turístico, esta franja costera se ve cada vez más influenciada. Mendihuaca Surf y las pequeñas empresas por igual, ayudan a proporcionar empleos y más oportunidades de trabajo a los lugareños y, en general, traen más negocios a la zona.

MI PLAN...

Estoy buscando recaudar US$ 12,000 para ayudar a la expansión de la escuela de surf que incluye la compra de 20 nuevas tablas de surf. Quiero poder tener suficientes tablas de espuma para alquilar y ejecutar clases al mismo tiempo. También me gustaría brindar el espacio de trabajo a otros profesores de surf del área y quizás de otras partes, lo que también abriría oportunidades de empleo para los surfistas locales. A cambio de su generoso apoyo, estoy ofreciendo todo tipo de beneficios de mercadería de Mendihuaca Surf, clases de surf y alquiler de tablas.

Por favor, siéntase libre de navegar por la página o mirar nuestro sitio web, Facebook, Instagram y páginas de Youtube para más información.

www.mendihuacasurf.com

story:
BIKI is the world's first bionic underwater drone that is also the only underwater robot featuring automated balance, obstacle avoidance, and return to base. By supporting a 4K camera, BIKI presents you with the best view from underwater. BIKI, the smallest but strongest. Through this intelligent robot fish, you can visualize the underwater world from a completely new perspective. BIKI is not only an almighty underwater drone but also a robot pet full of emotions. Now, just tell BIKI what you want to do!

                     

Enjoy diving? What about swimming with BIKI to see the underwater wonderland. BIKI can be suspended in the water to swim with you.

The underwater world contains unlimited mystery. By swimming at 1.12mph, BIKI can accompany you freely to enjoy in the underwater world. 

Curious about how deep BIKI can get into the water? Try it out. BIKI can accompany you to 196 feet maximum depth underwater. You will find a new underwater world beyond your expectations. 

What about a quiet but interesting underwater environment? BIKI can help. Swim with BIKI, you will be able to achieve the ultimate enjoyment under the water.

Even during high-speed motion or in darkness, BIKI is capable of stabilizing the camera for smooth videos and sharp photos by using a HD movement camera and an anti-shake camera platform that is based on an eccentric pan & tilt head.

 

 

You got an iPhone to take a selfie. Do you also want to capture your underwater moment? Now here is BIKI. You will be able to capture the most beautiful moments in your life by shooting with BIKI’s powerful 4K camera.

You might find the tiny BIKI is shaking and shaking. Are you worried about the camera’s stabilization? No worry. BIKI’s stabilization is improved by using an unprecedented HD movement camera set and anti-shake camera platform which is based on an eccentric pan & tilt head.

Swimming with BIKI, you will never lose any details since it can capture every moment with 150° wide-angle lenses under the water.

Thinking about darkness in deep water? Do you know BIKI is equipped with 2x114 lumens lights? Now, take a BIKI and find a deep underwater world you never knew before.

No worry about power off. The battery of BIKI allows you to keep shooting for 90 to 120 minutes at one time.

BIKI can save up to 32GB of 2.2 hours of video with 1080 pix, or 5243 photographs with 8 mega-pixel, or 4000 photographs.

Like a dolphin, BIKI uses a bionic sonar echo-location process to locate objects in the environment. In this way, BIKI can be wireless. At the same time, you will be getting BIKI at the most affordable price.

BIKI is more than a technical robot. Driven by the tail fin, it can moderate and control the direction of movement.The tail fin driven technology is based on reverse Von Kármán vortex street theory from fluid dynamics, which is a repeating pattern of swirling vortices caused by the unsteady separation of the flow of a fluid around blunt bodies.

We capture the underwater world. But we also hope the mysterious world can be kept as peaceful and wonderful as it is before. By applying the technology of bionics and 55dB ultra-silent, BIKI can swim like a real fish and never disturb the underwater biosphere.

More than a cold machine, BIKI can work more intimately with your family. Different from the traditional propeller underwater drone which has potential danger, BIKI can accompany your children into the pool and help monitor their safety with its unique bionic design.

BIKI is not only an underwater drone, but also a family member full of emotions. It will attend to your whole life, witnessing your happiness and maturing. Now, what about playing underwater Quidditch with BIKI? Just tell it what you want to do.

 

BIKI is the most agile water fairy. No matter how complex the underwater environment is, BIKI can swiftly shuttle back and forth in the coral reef with automated obstacle avoidance via infrared ray.

 

The Inertial Measurement Unit (IMU) and exclusive Autonomous Control Algorithm ROBOSEA™ allow BIKI to keep balance in the water, which helps BIKI be prepared to detect the boundless water world at every moment.

You know what? The powerful BIKI is totally beyond your expectation. You are able to customize its route and let it swim as you set up. Free yourself with this smart robot fish, as well as protecting your buddy from getting too far.

Anxious about losing your wireless buddy in the infinite sea world? The built-in GPS module makes BIKI automatically return to base and send a real-time location to your mobile devices.

Wire control not only limits swimming space, but also disturbs the underwater ecological environment. By connecting Wi-Fi and sonic waves, you can operate BIKI easily with controller or apps on your mobile devices wirelessly and arrive anywhere without limitation.

The little BIKI can shuttle back and forth in the coral reef and a lot of unknown places. BIKI, your best buddy accompanying you to everywhere in your underwater journey.

Different from the traditional propeller-propelled underwater drone, BIKI can get into swimming pools and help you ensure children’s safety by adopting the technology of bionics.

Want to take a selfie and keep the happiest moment under the water? Take a BIKI. You will be able to capture the most beautiful moments in your life.

Now you have the most unprecedented experience under the water. What about sharing your unique story to the world? With BIKI, you can share your underwater moments anytime, anywhere on all sorts of social media platforms.

By swimming with BIKI, you will achieve the enjoyment you’ve never had under the water. It is also a connection between you and your destiny. BIKI, the smallest but strongest; tiniest but the most important. Travel with your new buddy and establish your new friendship.

In the past, traditional unmanned underwater drones made use of a propeller, which fills the underwater territory with noise – making it impossible for a drone to operate quietly in a swimming pool and accompany children.

Propeller-propelled Unmanned Underwater Vehicle

  • Noisy
  • Unsafe
  • Controlled by a wire and difficult to use
  • Large size and low efficiency
  • Costly
  • Short battery life

The idea of BIKI has arrived!

What should an underwater robot fish look like? We see fish, the freest creatures enjoying the 80 percent of the secrets on this planet. To truly bring human beings into the underwater world, we were driven to create BIKI.

Streamlined and fishtail design

The BIKI’s fishtail uses a super-firm, natural rubber and a high elasticity alloy to mimic the tail bone of a fish.

Bionic Snorkeling Movement

Based on the IMU, Autonomous Control Algorithm ROBOSEA ™, and Kalman Filter Attitude Algorithm from fluid dynamics, BIKI is able to keep its balance in the water.

Unprecedented Underwater Communication

Similar to a dolphin, BIKI uses biological sonar echo-location to find objects in the environment. In this way, BIKI can code and modulate operational orders through its power amplifier (PA) to propel an acoustic transducer, thus converting an electronic signal to an ultrasonic signal. Through any water medium, the transducer receives the sonic wave signal and transfers it to an electronic signal. Then, a digital signal processor decodes the signals and restores operational orders via digital signal processing. Thus, by adopting the different frequencies of sonic waves to control the trajectory, we do not need to use wires to control the underwater robot fish anymore.

Chicken Head Tracking (Resource from the internet)

  • Chickens’ heads have always been uniquely stable. No matter how you shake their body, chickens’ heads can keep stability at all times. So this was adopted to demonstrate stabilization technology as a camera stabilizer in BIKI.
  • By using a HD movement camera set and anti-shake camera platform which is based on an eccentric pan & tilt head, BIKI’s stabilization is improved.

                

Controlled by controller (under the water)

BIKI can launch sonic waves of different bandwidths through the internal transducer, which allows you to operate the camera in any water-medium, from the pool to the ocean, by using a controller.

Controlled by app: Route customization (in the air)

Control by app, BIKI can show you the underwater scenes at real-time in shallow water - or you can make BIKI dive into deep water by customizing the route and setting the depth.

BIKI applies the technology of ABS crashworthiness and resistance-to-weathering glass fiber. Thus no matter what difference in temperature from 0 to 70°C (32-158°F), corrosive offshore environment, or under long-term sunlight, BIKI will always be kept in perfect condition.

 

Bionic Robot Fish Arrives In Antarctica

As the CEO of Robosea, Dr.Xiong Minglei was the major researcher in the intelligent control room of the engineering institute of Peking University. Dr. Minglei invented and developed the first underwater robot with dual reconfigurable tail fins, which was sailing in the Antarctic regions. The underwater robot played a significant role in the exploration into unknown territory. It achieved the smoothest underwater operation and gathered the water data via live transmission with the lowest cost and at the highest efficiency of underwater movement. The Antarctic adventure tour was a success, thanks to the underwater robot created by Dr. Minglei .

We not only exceed the traditional unmanned underwater vehicles on the market today, but also hope to exceed ourselves. In the development of BIKI, we continuously debug the functional prototype. Finally, we are proud to announce we achieved the best and most powerful BIKI.

 

BIKI x1, Waterproof Bag x1, Controller x1, Charging Cable x1, Charger x1

story:
***Please note*** Delivery dates have not been decided.

We are still working hard for you. It looks like we will start shipping out in October. Please contact - info@comprest.ca - before ordering, if the timing is a concern.

Thank you for very much for your interest and for your patience.

You can currently secure your order at  -  www.comprest.ca

 

Do you remember your last air mattress experience? Oh boy, do I remember mine.

It took forever to inflate. I missed the sunset and had to make dinner in the dark. Before crawling into bed around midnight I had to re-inflate because of air chill and science, but still woke up at 5 am in an air-mattress-taco with the full weight of my slumbering girlfriend against me. Cold. Sore. Grumpy. I'm an avid camper and, like most campers, I've clearly developed a deep hatred for air mattresses.

The alternatives? One option is the self-inflatable – typically for back-country hikers and not very comfortable.

The other choice is foam. Foam is good! It’s reliable, never pops… your bed at home is likely made of foam. 

It's a bummer foam is just too big for camping...

UNLESS, of course, you vacuum-pack it.

We're here to give you the most reliable sleep you’ll find in a camping bed. CompREST is designed for the Outdoor Bed Marketplace targeted at car, music festival, and base campers.

CompREST is NOT ideal for backpacking or hiking trips, but most hikers still practice car camping for more comfortable weekend trips.

Perfect for:

                                                            

Here's how it all goes down.

 

Compression time-lapse. Actual time: 2-3 minutes

You wake up well rested on your last day at camp and take down is a breeze. Fold it, seal it in your vacuum bag, and CompREST packs your bed up for you at the touch of a button, to 20% of its original size.

As for set up time... What set up time?

Setting up your nap nest has never been easier! Simply remove the bag and your bed is made.

 

This is NOT a time lapse.

Step 1: Remove from bag. 

Step 2: Adventure time! 

Luxurious foam made convenient for the first time ever.

It all starts with the right foam. We knew we needed foam that was guaranteed comfortable, but we also needed to ensure our foam could pack up small yet still maintain integrity and shape when out of the bag.

After a lot of lying around (on foam, of course) we landed on one with the perfect density: a cross between supreme comfort, give, and resiliency. We’re especially stoked that this perfect foam is formed only a province away in beautiful Vancouver! Not only are we supporting local Canadian business, we also get faster delivery times.

How comfy is it?

 

We have more reward details and instructions at the bottom of this page. Make sure to take a look at our Add On Menu.

What about the pump?

It sucks, trust me.

1st of it's kind. The CompREST Vacuum Pump.

The true innovation (and the muscle) behind the CompREST system is our rechargeable vacuum pump.

Vacuum pack your bed, pillows, clothes, bedding, and even food. You’ll end up with extra room in your car for more important things! Like a friend, your dog, or another flat of beer…

The power of a shop-vac in the palm of your hand.

 7 ½ x 3 ¼ x 5 ½ inches. This little thing is a featherweight champion, weighing only 2.6 lbs.   

CompREST’s RECHARGEABLE lithium-ion batteries will do 20 compressions on a single charge, and can be recharged using a 110V American (2-prong) wall charger (included). A simple LED indicator demonstrates charging status. Red means charging, green means good-to-go!

Did we mention it can charge your phone?

"These Li-ion batteries ARE GREAT! How else can we make use of this excess energy?"   

Bingo! Your CompREST pump also acts as a portable power bank for your phone or other USB device, offering 5V and 1A of power. The pump is capable of fully charging a Samsung Galaxy, from dead, at least twice. 

Friction Fit, press on nozzle.

The CompREST nozzle is specially designed to fit securely on the valve - you don’t have to babysit. Set it and forget it (for a few minutes, at least)! Use this precious time to do other camp take-down tasks – like packing up your bag or enjoying that second cup of coffee. 

The design doesn't stop there. 

So far, almost 100 people have slept on CompREST and we've had hundreds of people lay on the product at trade shows. The response is always overwhelmingly positive, AKA "Ahhhhhhh, ya. That's nice."

Our testers have provided us with valuable input regarding appearance, functionality, necessity, and ease of use. We have used this input to develop the whole CompREST experience into something that is enjoyable, intuitive, and aesthetically pleasing – an experience that will have you wondering how you ever managed before CompREST.

This ain’t your mama’s camping mattress! 

Throwback to those huge, yellowing, fragile foam mattresses that used to embody camping in the 1970s. Kinda gross, right?

Well we’ve experimented with fabrics to create the ideal protective, machine-washable cover for CompREST.

The top of the CompREST cover had to be breathable, comfortable, functional, and offer some traction for your sleeping bag. Most importantly, it had to allow airflow for vacuum packing.

We chose Lycra for its feel, its ability to be one with the foam, and its resistance to dirt and dust. Wipe away the small stuff or throw in the washer for a heavier duty clean – no worries!

Protective machine washable cover.

 Zip-on. Zip-off.

Waterproof bottom.

For the bottom we chose coated nylon with ripstop, rated to 15 psi to prevent your bed from absorbing tent spills and sneaky puddles. 

Infinite Velcro design.

CompREST is a proud supporter of “the more the merrier”. We designed CompREST to Velcro together infinitely to accommodate your significant other, your child’s slumber party squad, or your whole extended family! From a single serving to the California king, it’s your pick. 

And CompREST is almost as good a floor as it is a bed. Putting on pants in your tent has never been a simple task, until now. 

Helping couples stay couples with undisturbed sleeps.

Don’t worry about disturbing your tent-mate’s sleep! Remember, you are sleeping on foam, not a giant balloon. Air displacement is nothing to worry about! 

When she moves, you sleep. When he snores, well.... 

1-way valve for those of you who suck at the quick-draw. 

Vacuum bags have a 1- way valve.

 No more rushing to get the cap on!


CompREST pump ran out of juice? Plug it in and use your vacuum cleaner instead! 

Keep your hands free for the important things in life.

This guy is a hero! The CompREST carry bag functions as a protective barrier between your vacuum-packed bed and the outside world. It keeps your bed compressed even on the off chance your vacuum bag seal isn't as tight as it could be. The entire vacuum-packed bed weighs 4.5 lbs and the shoulder strap makes it a cloud-like carry. 

CompREST over board? A vacuum-packed CompREST stays dry until bed time.

CompREST on a Nautical Adventure! Photo cred: Sir Jack W.

CompREST has been a labour of love for over 2 years and we are proud to say that, in this time, we have avoided the great misfortune of a weekend away with an unreliable inflatable. The only logical next step is to bring this high-quality reliability to you, you weekend warrior, you outdoor adventurer, you hospitable homebody, you! If you have or will ever use an air mattress, CompREST was made for you. 

We’re stoked to be showcasing CompREST through the power of Indiegogo. 

By launching now, our mission is to have the first production run delivered to all backers for June 2017.

Every backer helps. 

We hope you'll join us for some comfy adventures!

To pre-order CompREST, click the button below and pick a reward that fits. Simple as that. If you want more stuff that isn't included in your reward, please follow the instructions in our Add-On Menu below the rewards section. Once you have pledged, sit back and relax. We'll collect your shipping/fulfillment info when this project is closer to shipping. 

Want to add additional items to your reward like an extra CompREST bed or vacuum pump? Maybe you want to add on extra vacuum bags so that you can compress your pillows and clothes! Either way, adding stuff to your reward is easy:

1. Choose a reward level. 

Everybody must choose one (and only one) reward level to back this project. You cannot choose 2 reward levels. Just one. You will get all items in that reward—you cannot swap things that you don't want for things that you do want. 

2. To add something extra, check out the Add-On Menu. 

If (and only if) you want to include something additional to your reward, check out the Add-On Menu above. If it's in the Add-On Menu, you can add it to your reward by increasing your pledge by the amount specified in the menu. You can only add things to your reward that are in the Add-On Menu. Make sure to choose the price that corresponds to where you live. Please note that the prices on the Add-On menu are in Canadian dollars. 

3. You're done for now! 

All details like shipping information and add-on specifics will be collected via survey after this campaign has ended in mid-November. 

Thanks for checking us out and don't forget to share this Indiegogo page to help us bring CompREST to reality!  

Thank you 1000 times!

Sleep Well. Live Well.

 

 

 

 

 

Risks and challenges

This is our second run at crowdfunding after learning some very valuable lessons from the first time around. We thoroughly expect to succeed this time. We have plotted and planned to the best of our abilities. We have an excellent team assembled. Nevertheless, we've learned to expect the unexpected and have budgeted extra time accordingly.

(YES, that includes accounting for manufacturing and shipping slowdowns over Chinese New Year!)

Some potential challenges we could face...:

1. We've 3D printed a few handfuls of components and are happy with the look and functionality of the pump so far. In our situation, 3D printing has its up and downs. The disadvantage (when compared to injection molding) is that it's much slower to produce each part. However, we are putting in time designing for faster print cycles.

There are 3 advantages working with 3D printers:

(a) 3D printers are the main reason we could lower our funding goal. 
(b) The design can be improved at any point throughout the production run. 
(c) We are able to scale up by buying or leasing 3D printers as we need.

2. International shipping can always prove to be a challenge. There can be delays of two to three weeks if shipments are tagged for customs exams. We promise to always keep you up to speed! Communication is key!

3. Our vacuum bag supplier recently switched their valve design so that they can make it cheaper. This recent change doesn't meet our design standards and we need to find a new supplier. The good news is there are many to choose from and therefore it shouldn't be a problem that affects our backers.

Aside from all that...

We’ve teamed up with a supply chain management company who has helped 3 other Kickstarter projects: Fortifiedbike, OMC and Supermechanical. They will be helping us with logistics and quality control. They’ve visited 4 factories for us so far, and will continue to do so during production.

We have planned to go to China personally to perfect the build process, as well as implement quality inspection points. We are prepared to visit China several times before our estimated delivery time to ensure the process is running smoothly and our quality targets are being met.

Our prototypes are ROCK SOLID and it’s important that all of the CompREST products follow suit.

We will be posting videos, pictures and more to keep you updated regularly. You can definitely expect to be notified of any significant changes.

We can’t wait to get started!

Use this precious time to do other camp take-down tasks – like packing up your bag or enjoying that second cup of coffee. The design doesn't stop there. So far, almost 100 people have slept on CompREST and we've had hundreds of people lay on the product at trade shows. The response is always overwhelmingly positive, AKA "Ahhhhhhh, ya. That's nice."Our testers have provided us with valuable input regarding appearance, functionality, necessity, and ease of use. We have used this input to develop the whole CompREST experience into something that is enjoyable, intuitive, and aesthetically pleasing – an experience that will have you wondering how you ever managed before CompREST.This ain’t your mama’s camping mattress! Throwback to those huge, yellowing, fragile foam mattresses that used to embody camping in the 1970s. Kinda gross, right?Well we’ve experimented with fabrics to create the ideal protective, machine-washable cover for CompREST.The top of the CompREST cover had to be breathable, comfortable, functional, and offer some traction for your sleeping bag. Most importantly, it had to allow airflow for vacuum packing.We chose Lycra for its feel, its ability to be one with the foam, and its resistance to dirt and dust. Wipe away the small stuff or throw in the washer for a heavier duty clean – no worries!Protective machine washable cover. Zip-on. Zip-off.Waterproof bottom.For the bottom we chose coated nylon with ripstop, rated to 15 psi to prevent your bed from absorbing tent spills and sneaky puddles. Infinite Velcro design.CompREST is a proud supporter of “the more the merrier”. We designed CompREST to Velcro together infinitely to accommodate your significant other, your child’s slumber party squad, or your whole extended family! From a single serving to the California king, it’s your pick. And CompREST is almost as good a floor as it is a bed. Putting on pants in your tent has never been a simple task, until now. Helping couples stay couples with undisturbed sleeps.Don’t worry about disturbing your tent-mate’s sleep! Remember, you are sleeping on foam, not a giant balloon. Air displacement is nothing to worry about! When she moves, you sleep. When he snores, well.... 1-way valve for those of you who suck at the quick-draw. Vacuum bags have a 1- way valve. No more rushing to get the cap on!CompREST pump ran out of juice? Plug it in and use your vacuum cleaner instead! Keep your hands free for the important things in life.This guy is a hero! The CompREST carry bag functions as a protective barrier between your vacuum-packed bed and the outside world. It keeps your bed compressed even on the off chance your vacuum bag seal isn't as tight as it could be. The entire vacuum-packed bed weighs 4.5 lbs and the shoulder strap makes it a cloud-like carry. CompREST over board? A vacuum-packed CompREST stays dry until bed time.CompREST on a Nautical Adventure! Photo cred: Sir Jack W.CompREST has been a labour of love for over 2 years and we are proud to say that, in this time, we have avoided the great misfortune of a weekend away with an unreliable inflatable. The only logical next step is to bring this high-quality reliability to you, you weekend warrior, you outdoor adventurer, you hospitable homebody, you! If you have or will ever use an air mattress, CompREST was made for you. We’re stoked to be showcasing CompREST through the power of Indiegogo. By launching now, our mission is to have the first production run delivered to all backers for June 2017.Every backer helps. We hope you'll join us for some comfy adventures!To pre-order CompREST, click the button below and pick a reward that fits. Simple as that. If you want more stuff that isn't included in your reward, please follow the instructions in our Add-On Menu below the rewards section. Once you have pledged, sit back and relax. We'll collect your shipping/fulfillment info when this project is closer to shipping. Want to add additional items to your reward like an extra CompREST bed or vacuum pump? Maybe you want to add on extra vacuum bags so that you can compress your pillows and clothes! Either way, adding stuff to your reward is easy:1. Choose a reward level. Everybody must choose one (and only one) reward level to back this project. You cannot choose 2 reward levels. Just one. You will get all items in that reward—you cannot swap things that you don't want for things that you do want. 2. To add something extra, check out the Add-On Menu. If (and only if) you want to include something additional to your reward, check out the Add-On Menu above. If it's in the Add-On Menu, you can add it to your reward by increasing your pledge by the amount specified in the menu. You can only add things to your reward that are in the Add-On Menu. Make sure to choose the price that corresponds to where you live. Please note that the prices on the Add-On menu are in Canadian dollars. 3. You're done for now! All details like shipping information and add-on specifics will be collected via survey after this campaign has ended in mid-November. Thanks for checking us out and don't forget to share this Indiegogo page to help us bring CompREST to reality!  Thank you 1000 times!Sleep Well. Live Well.     Risks and challengesThis is our second run at crowdfunding after learning some very valuable lessons from the first time around. We thoroughly expect to succeed this time. We have plotted and planned to the best of our abilities. We have an excellent team assembled. Nevertheless, we've learned to expect the unexpected and have budgeted extra time accordingly.(YES, that includes accounting for manufacturing and shipping slowdowns over Chinese New Year!)Some potential challenges we could face...:1. We've 3D printed a few handfuls of components and are happy with the look and functionality of the pump so far. In our situation, 3D printing has its up and downs. The disadvantage (when compared to injection molding) is that it's much slower to produce each part. However, we are putting in time designing for faster print cycles.There are 3 advantages working with 3D printers:(a) 3D printers are the main reason we could lower our funding goal. (b) The design can be improved at any point throughout the production run. (c) We are able to scale up by buying or leasing 3D printers as we need.2. International shipping can always prove to be a challenge. There can be delays of two to three weeks if shipments are tagged for customs exams. We promise to always keep you up to speed! Communication is key!3. Our vacuum bag supplier recently switched their valve design so that they can make it cheaper. This recent change doesn't meet our design standards and we need to find a new supplier. The good news is there are many to choose from and therefore it shouldn't be a problem that affects our backers.Aside from all that...We’ve teamed up with a supply chain management company who has helped 3 other Kickstarter projects: Fortifiedbike, OMC and Supermechanical. They will be helping us with logistics and quality control. They’ve visited 4 factories for us so far, and will continue to do so during production.We have planned to go to China personally to perfect the build process, as well as implement quality inspection points. We are prepared to visit China several times before our estimated delivery time to ensure the process is running smoothly and our quality targets are being met.Our prototypes are ROCK SOLID and it’s important that all of the CompREST products follow suit.We will be posting videos, pictures and more to keep you updated regularly. You can definitely expect to be notified of any significant changes.We can’t wait to get started!

story:
Hi!  We’re Uncharted Supply Company from Park City, UT.  We build the world’s best preparedness products and have $7 million + in sales to over 150 countries.  Our customers include FBI, Uber, AirBnB, Canadian Border Patrol, Warner Brothers and many more.  

You may have seen us on Season 9 of Shark Tank where we struck a deal with Robert Herjavec. We got our start right here, on Indiegogo, with our first product The Seventy2 Survival System.  

Designed to fulfill a military request for rapid deployment and re-packing for fluid transition to the water, the Rapid Raft from Uncharted Supply Co is the lightest and most packable raft to ever be made available to the public.  

 

Adapted for civilian use :

  • 3 lbs
  • Holds 400 lbs
  • Specs - 5' x 5' x 15'
  • Inflates in under 30 seconds

 

This patent and ground-breaking design allows for quick movement across water with no other tools necessary.  In less than 60 seconds, you can take the Rapid Raft from packed to ready for use.


Large rear volume and rockered front guarantees a stable, balanced ride, even under load.

 

We get it - things happen.  It's why we developed the rapid raft with several replaceable pieces designed to help you keep on adventuring.

The Rapid Raft made its debut at the Outdoor Retailer Show in Denver, Colorado.  It quickly became one of the big hits of the entire show. Here's a few highlights:

Risks & Challenges

The Rapid Raft has been tested, reviewed, and is currently close to beginning production.  Because we are an established company with a long history of product development and timely deliveries, we feel the risk in this campaign is very small.  There is always a potential for small delays in delivery of product, or slight changes to materials or design, but other than that, you can feel comfortable knowing our team is here every day to answer any and all questions.  

Please reach out at info@unchartedsupplyco.com or call us at 435-631-1113 with any questions or concerns. 

 

Excited about the Rapid Raft but just not in the market? No problem! Here are a variety of ways you can help us:

  • Share this campaign to your social media channels. 
  • Text a link to our page to someone who you think would enjoy the Rapid Raft.
  • Follow us on Instagram or Facebook for a chance to win your own! ( @unchartedsupplyco )

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Our Story

The purpose of this campaign is to raise funding to produce a Dynasphere to be located somewhere in Europe where it can be readily accessed. The final location is yet to be determined and contributors will be informed. We have constructed and delivered five Dynaspheres in the US. Now it is time to send Dynaspheres all over the world beginning in Europe. These amazing devices encourage personal Awakening to Cosmic Consciousness of who and what they really are. You are a flow of Love. See more Dynasphere details here. 


The Impact


Being exposed over time to a Dynasphere has changed many people's lives. These are real changes at the heart (deep consciousness) level. Some have reported healings on all levels (physical, emotional, mental and spiritual) and nearly always a change in expanding consciousness. These phenomena have been repeated over years and have occurred with all five units already distributed across America. Ultimately our goal is to build and distribute 100 Dynaspheres around the globe such that the 100th Monkey Effect kicks in and people all over the world wake up to who and what they are: powerful spiritual beings having an amazing physical experience. This campaign is only the beginning. A new campaign may be established for each Dynasphere going globally (Africa, Russia, Australia, Japan, etc.) so stay tuned for those campaigns. Let us know you are interested in a Dynasphere for your part of the world and we'll work with you to make it happen.

See the location map of American Dynaspheres. Click to read Testimonials.

What We Need & What You Get

The Dynaspheres are expensive to build. Each is hand made of specific and sometimes special materials and craftsmanship is high quality. It normally takes several months to construct one in our shop. We make all the parts except the brass sphere which is fabricated elsewhere then shipped to us where we complete work on it with extensive sanding and polishing to bring it to its bright shiny finish. The raised funds will cover material acquisition, tools, equipment and shop time expenses during construction which include modest wages, utilities and the like. The first Dynasphere for Europe has already raised $1,575 from diverse countries. We will periodically post construction photos and progress reports on the project page so you can follow the construction and development. In essence the Dynasphere will be delivered at or near cost and any excess funds will go to the next Dynasphere. We are not doing this for profit but to bring these amazing devices to humanity that the Consciousness of Humanity is raised. You can become a part of this grand adventure that will directly affect the entire global consciousness. Homepage for this project.

Other Ways You Can Help

Unlike the American Dynaspheres which were made for well-to-do persons the Dynaspheres going out to the world are to be developed by many people for many people - a true cooperative and collaborative effort. This global effort shares heart-felt energies to and from all those choosing to be involved. Your involvement can be a cash donation or simply telling your friends and sharing this story, its intentions and purposes. Involvement in this campaign can be an exciting and awareness expanding adventure. Your life will never be the same. Wouldn't it be great if your friends could join you in the journey?

See the Atlin story.

story:
Important notes.

We will deliver the products also if we don't reach the target - We've found investors

The project appeared to be so successful that we got many term sheets from venture capital. This refers to millions of USD. Currently we conduct negotiations with investors who contacted us.

In this way, people who would like to place a pre-order for $1500 but are afraid that we will not raise the required amount of money at IndieGoGo, should not worry, expences will be covered by venture capital. I’s not the time to be afraid but to buy it for $ 1500, with a discount, we will roll-up the production, there is no doubt.

 

Unique hi-tech motorbike helmet with built-in navigation system and voice controlled interface.

The Challenge

Motorcyclists still need an effective navigation tool except the usual paper maps or touch-screen navigators. Using maps requires frequent stops, navigators distract the biker’s attention and are not safe to be operated on the go.

There is a device that would perfectly meet the bikers’ requirements but up to the present day only fighter pilots could enjoy its advantages. Yes, we mean helmet-mounted displays.

 

The Solution

We worked a lot and now have a solution:

  • augmented reality for easy and user-friendly navigation
  • clearly visible collimated image i.e. it is always in focus, just like that in scope sights
  • full-color, translucent picture is projected right on the visor like in a F-35 fighter helmet, it's safe, provides unobstructed view, doesn't distract attention and eliminates the need for a separate display
  • supposed size of the system fits a motorcycle helmet - our helmet is going to be just a bit bigger than usual
  • two 3000 mAh batteries for a long operation time
  • microphone for voice control that keeps both hands free for driving
  • two earphones
  • light sensor for adjusting the image brightness according to external light conditions
  • G-sensor, gyroscope, digital compass for head movement tracking  (the picture changes according to the view direction)
  • our own minimalistic interface that will be used instead of standard Android interface. Thus you will not be able to play games or watch video on the go, sorry!

Despite sophisticated modern technologies being at the heart of product it is going to be easy to use. In fact, its future owners are going to touch the futuristic technology formerly seen only in sci-fi movies.

 

Pay attention to the above schema. It tells you why we place the image in the center of view field. That's because this is the area where you see best. At the same time there are areas (on the left or on the right for example) where your vision is not so sharp.  

 

 

User Interface

The user interface is going to be minimalistic and simple. The list of of voice commands will be short, all commands natural and understandable by context. For the case the user is in trouble formulating a suitable command the help option is just a command ("Help!") away.
 
 
Overview map can be viewed anytime your speed is near zero (showing map at high speed is prohibited due to safety reasons).
 
 
POI search and display is not forgotten either.

 

Current State

The project got support of Moscow Department of Science, Industrial Policy and Enterprise; State Foundation for Assistance to Small Innovative Enterprises in Science and Technology of Russian Federation; Skolkovo Foundation.Currently with their financial support we made prototypes for:

  • outer shell
  • electronic board
  • optics
  • software

Why Crowd Funding?

Our project origins from Russia. Russian venture funds are not disposed to invest into hardware startups. They prefer to back up clones of successful services like Groupon, Airnb, Zappos, Yelp, Booking, etc. They are not interested in producing hardware either. Thus we got some grants from the Government, but this seed capital is not unlimited, and is intended for making prototypes. We, like Paul Graham, believe that the time of hardware startups is coming and they can begin a new era by crowd funding, i.e. fundraising and pre-selling.

 

How We will Use Raised Funds

Money will be payed for making pressmolds for the helmet capsule. It's a rather expensive tooling and is vitally important for the whole project.

Please learn more about injection molding.

 

Our Goals

We went a long and hard way. Our next, the most important and the most challenging step is to put all parts together and to start industrial production: 
  • complete engineering of optics and electronics for industrial production
  • finish the software development
  • conduct final tests and certification procedures
  • start serial production of the helmet
 
2013, 4Q: Engineering and making press moulds.
2014, 1Q: Certification according to FCC and DOT industrial standards.
2014, 2Q: Producing a pilot batch of helmets.
2014, 3Q: Market launch in USA and Canada.2014, 4Q: Market launch in Australia and UK.
We have a dream and want it to come true. It's a chance to create some thing nobody created yet. We'll do all our best.
 

Stretched Goals

300 000$

Bluetooth with headset profile (for using the helmet as a headset).

500 000$

Built-in high-resolution 13Mpix photo&video camera.

 

Certification

The helmet will be certificated according to the following standards:

  • USA DOT
  • European ECE 22.05
  • Japanese JIS T 8133 
  • FCC

 

Thanks to:

 

Skolkovo Innovation Center

 

State Foundation for Assistance to Small Innovative Enterprises in Science and Technology of Russian Federation

 

Moscow Department of Science, Industrial Policy and Enterprise

 

Mercator Group

 

Special Thanks to:

Aleksey Komissarov, Sergey Zhukov, Sergey Polyakov, Andrey Skvortsov

 

Risks and Challenges 

We can face problems when making press-molds, interacting with ODM contractors. 
Possible problems with certification.
 
 

FAQ

Why is the price $2.000? Isn't it too high?

If you make a comparison with the price of a good helmet (whatever that means, it's a matter of personal taste), then add the price of a communication unit (for Internet connection and downloading of essential info like traffic, POI, weather etc. - supposed hardware specifications are going to be as good as of current high-end Android smartphones), and a price of a good GPS along with its mounting kit, the price adds up.

This is all integral, all for one price and the helmet will be made out of carbon fiber, as opposed to polycarbonate.

When the products are compared like-for-like, the price isn't quite as daunting. It seems steep at first glance.

Do not forget that we are planning to add Bluetooth headset functionality and a high-resolution camera if we raise enough money. Then add a price of a headset and an action camera (with projection optics like that used in reflex cameras and with 13 mpx resolution) and compare the result with just $2000 for an integrated device.

We think, it's a good deal!

What size will the helmet be?

The overall dimensions of the helmet will be slightly bigger than those of an average helmet (you know, we need some extra space for electronics and optics inside).

As for antropometry - we will make helmets of standard S, M, L and XL sizes, just as usual.

What color will the helmet be?

The prototype shown in the video is used for showing the overall dimensions and approximata shape of the helmet. Final color as well as shape details may vary. Yes, we know about industrial design and its importance.

How much will the helmet weight?

It will weight about 1.4 kg, as said in the video.

How do you load the map?

Maps are going to be pre-loaded, no need for downloading the maps on the go. You will be able to update maps on a regular basis.

How well does the head-up display work on a clear visor in daylight? How bright is the maps image at night

The image is going to be bright enough to be well visible at daytime (it's a very important point for us, be sure).

The image brightness will be automatically adjusted (dimmed) according to light conditions at night or at cloudy weather (we have foreseen a light sensor for it). Thus the image will remain well wisible but will not dazzle your eyes. 

Will your navigation system be online or offline (i.e. will I need Internet connection to make routes)?

You will not need Internet connection for making routes. We use our own engine to do it. Internet will be required for downloading updates, traffic information, POIs and weather forecast.

Press 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

PR

Are you a journalist or want to ask a private question or need high quality illustrations for print? Please contact us  pr@livemap.info

Special for TV-channels.

Are you TV-reporter & need video for tv-news?

1) Please contact us pr@livemap.info from your corporate TV-channel email and we will send you direct link to our video reel (FULL HD, high quality video & sound, 2GB file). You can use it anywhere.

2) You can buy news-reel about our project at RUPTLY tv-news agency.

PS BIG THANKS all journalists & tv-reporters in the world, who made and will make news about Livemap motohelmet.

We can face problems when making press-molds, interacting with ODM contractors. Possible problems with certification.
 
 

FAQ
Why is the price $2.000? Isn't it too high?
If you make a comparison with the price of a good helmet (whatever that means, it's a matter of personal taste), then add the price of a communication unit (for Internet connection and downloading of essential info like traffic, POI, weather etc. - supposed hardware specifications are going to be as good as of current high-end Android smartphones), and a price of a good GPS along with its mounting kit, the price adds up.
This is all integral, all for one price and the helmet will be made out of carbon fiber, as opposed to polycarbonate.When the products are compared like-for-like, the price isn't quite as daunting. It seems steep at first glance.
Do not forget that we are planning to add Bluetooth headset functionality and a high-resolution camera if we raise enough money. Then add a price of a headset and an action camera (with projection optics like that used in reflex cameras and with 13 mpx resolution) and compare the result with just $2000 for an integrated device.
We think, it's a good deal!
What size will the helmet be?
The overall dimensions of the helmet will be slightly bigger than those of an average helmet (you know, we need some extra space for electronics and optics inside).
As for antropometry - we will make helmets of standard S, M, L and XL sizes, just as usual.
What color will the helmet be?
The prototype shown in the video is used for showing the overall dimensions and approximata shape of the helmet. Final color as well as shape details may vary. Yes, we know about industrial design and its importance.
How much will the helmet weight?
It will weight about 1.4 kg, as said in the video.
How do you load the map?
Maps are going to be pre-loaded, no need for downloading the maps on the go. You will be able to update maps on a regular basis.
How well does the head-up display work on a clear visor in daylight? How bright is the maps image at night
The image is going to be bright enough to be well visible at daytime (it's a very important point for us, be sure).
The image brightness will be automatically adjusted (dimmed) according to light conditions at night or at cloudy weather (we have foreseen a light sensor for it). Thus the image will remain well wisible but will not dazzle your eyes. 
Will your navigation system be online or offline (i.e. will I need Internet connection to make routes)?
You will not need Internet connection for making routes. We use our own engine to do it. Internet will be required for downloading updates, traffic information, POIs and weather forecast.

Press 

 

 
 

 
 

 

 

PR
Are you a journalist or want to ask a private question or need high quality illustrations for print? Please contact us  pr@livemap.info
Special for TV-channels.
Are you TV-reporter & need video for tv-news?
1) Please contact us pr@livemap.info from your corporate TV-channel email and we will send you direct link to our video reel (FULL HD, high quality video & sound, 2GB file). You can use it anywhere.
2) You can buy news-reel about our project at RUPTLY tv-news agency.
PS BIG THANKS all journalists & tv-reporters in the world, who made and will make news about Livemap motohelmet.

story:
Conventional everyday backpacks are uncomfortable. The main reason for this is that they direct the weight away from your body. JOEY is different!

A full contact, super ergonomic back suspension system directs the weight towards your hips and lays JOEY right against your back. A contoured hip pad absorbs the weight and reduces horizontal movements when walking or running. Load lifter straps and stowable hip and strenum straps provide maximum comfort. Multi-directional air flow tunnels provide pleasant ventilation and keep your back dry at all times.

 

 

The sternum strap with a Nifco® buckle and a Duraflex® slider is stowable to prevent it from dangling when not used. That's right, enough is enough: no more dangling straps!

The hip strap can also be stowed (correct, NO MORE dangling straps!) and features a Fidlock® SNAP fastener, which combines the convenience of a magnetic fastener with the stability of a mechanical snap fastener.

 

 

JOEY has a pair of easy to use side pockets. Actually, they feel like additional pants pockets because they are so accessible. You can take out your smart phone, wallet, or keys, on the go, and stow them safely to have the hands free again.

There is also one-handed access to full length side mesh pockets that can carry larger things such as a water bottle.

 

 

Don't worry about your valuables, they are safe! By teaming up with Fidlock®, a German fastener manufacturer, JOEY is the pick-pockets’ new nightmare. Strong magnets makes the Fidlock® fastener easy to close but the secure snap functionality ensures a continuously high locking force. You have to feel it to believe it!

Another cool thing? Your passport has its own hidden pocket facing towards your back, which can be accessed without taking off JOEY – perfect while traveling.

 

 

We get it: you carry around a lot, from laptops to water bottles and you really stuff your backpack. What if you need additional space? Check this out!

There is lots of space. In fact, there is additional capacity of 15 liters so you are prepared for the unexpected. JOEY expands in a very unique way but always retains its balance. And its style.

 

 

JOEY is made to carry your life and offers ample pockets for organizing the small things in the most intuitive locations. Things you frequently take out throughout the day like your charger or sunglasses can be packed conveniently in the big pocket in the top lid.

By gently pulling down the top lid, the Fidlock® SNAP unfastens and you will first find a large, integrated laptop compartment.

When opening the YKK® zippers, you access the interior offering countless ways to stow things like your power-bank, notebook, or pens.

With the super lightweight, stowable rain cover you are good to go in all wheathers. If it is not raining, it fits nicely into a separate pocket located outside at the bottom.

 

 

JOEY stands for uncompromising quality and visionary design. While designing this masterpiece, we placed great importance on durability and only used water-repellent fabrics as well as multi-award winning components from Fidlock®, YKK®, Nifco®, and Duraflex®. JOEY is a true premium everyday backpack. Let us convince you why:

  • Weight: 1.2 kg (2.65 lbs)
  • Volume: 25-40 l (1525.59-2440.95 cu in)
  • Load capacity: up to 15kg (33.07 lbs)
  • Dimensions: 51 H x 33 W x 20 D cm (20" H x 13" W x 7.75" D)
  • Size: one size fits all, i.e. for heights 160-190 cm (5'3"-6'3")
  • Color: black, red, or blue

 

  • Top-loading opening with anti pick-pocket fastener (Fastener: Fidlock® SNAP screw)
  • Separate, padded laptop compartment that does not reach all the way to the bottom (Capacity: 40 H x 27 W x 4 D cm (16" H x 10.75" W x 1.5" D), i.e. up to a 15 inch Macbook Pro, 2009 and later models)
  • Side zipper access (Zippers: YKK® RC PU coated)
  • One-handed access to side pockets to stow your smart phone, wallet, or keys.
  • One-handed access to full length side mesh pockets that can carry larger things such as a water bottle. (Fabric: power mesh)
  • Internal organizer panel (Fabric: polyester ["peach" finish]  lining / Color: blue)
  • Hidden passport pocket (Zippers: YKK® WR treatment)
  • Extendable top lid for additional capacity
  • Durable shell (Fabric: PU-coated, water-resistant woven polyester / 3mm open cell foam)
  • Three-dimensional suspension system (Material: 0.8mm Polypropylene board / 3mm open cell foam / PU-coated, water-resistant woven polyester / metallic frame)
  • Anatomically shaped, one-piece shoulder straps (Outside: durable polyester twill / Inside: high-density EVA foam [layer A], breathable open cell foam [layer B])
  • Load lifter straps
  • Stowable hip and sternum straps (Hip strap: Fidlock® / Sternum strap: Nifco® and Duraflex®)
  • Contoured, one-piece hip pad (Outside: durable polyester twill / Inside: high-density EVA foam [layer A], breathable open cell foam [layer B])
  • Multi-directional air flow tunnels
  • Stowable rain cover

 

 

We are a group of people who try to see the world from a slightly different angle. Together we founded Koala-Gear to challenge the way backpacks are used. Thank you for supporting our passion and bringing JOEY to life!

A big thank you goes out to all those who helped us on our journey to the release of JOEY on Kickstarter: Adi Aldouby, Adi Na’amat, Adli Nassar A-Din, Alex Klein, Alona Komsky, Aminadav Glueckshtein, Amit Adini, Amir Hershkovitz, Amit Zilberstein, Assaf Arviv, Avi Ilani, Beita Jerusalem, Bruria Michman, Clay Alderman, Daniel David Shalibo, Daniel Douek, Daniel Gindis, Daniella Resnick, Dan Michman, Eco-fun, Ehud Michman, Elad Barami, Eyal Zur, Gal Treger, Gal Rosenberg, Gedeon Gatari, Guy Sprukt, Guy Malca, Haim Ezra Ani, Jeff Swartz, Josh Logue, Made in JLM, Michal Berdugo, Moshe Cochavi, Odelia Avneri Yatzkan, Ohad Cohen, Ori Or, Sapir Bluzer, Shalem College, Yoel Yoli Dorot, Yona Schnitzer, Yoni Herzbrun.

For press inquiries please contact: info@koala-gear.com

 

 

We are shipping! We’ve already selected fabrics, sourced our component suppliers (including YKK® for zippers as well as Fidlock®, Nifco®, and Duraflex® for fasteners), and flew to meet our production partners to guarantee timely shipment and also to meet in person the makers of your product in China, to promote socially responsible production. Out of many manufacturers, only few were able to meet our high standards and with one of them we started to produce samples and to perfect JOEY over many iterations.

Highest quality, no compromises! We spared no expense creating a beautiful backpack that is well balanced and perfectly tailored to your body. From PU coated, water-repellent fabrics for the shell through to anti pick-pocket fastener from Fidlock®, JOEY is a true premium everyday backpack.

Intensive R&D. Approved by the best! In spring 2016, Heather Larsen teamed up with Koala-Gear in Israel to test JOEY’s balance – by walking across a 20-meter-long line situated 30 meters (almost 100 feet) above the ancient stones of Jerusalem’s medieval Tower of David Museum. It wasn’t the first time a highliner performed a stunt in Jerusalem’s Old City. The last time was in 1987, when Philippe Petit, whose Twin Tower act in New York was chronicled in the 2015 film "The Walk", rigged a highline between buildings situated in the Arab and Jewish Quarters.

In Jerusalem’s Old City, Larsen literally walked between layers of history as the highline reached from one tower built by King Herod some 2000 years ago to another tower built by Suleiman the Great. Despite a few minor wobbles, Larsen completed the highline with expert ease and even took time to perform few stunts for the crowds. This historical event attracted media from all around the world, including AP, EPA, and Reuters.

 

 

 

 

For press inquiries please contact: info@koala-gear.com

story:
Nowadays society lives from and with energy on a daily basis and the demand continues to rise.
 
Communication devices such as mobiles, tablets or iPads have become an indispensable item for everyone.The users of these devices expect an increasing performance and effectiveness in its use and operation. But, this means that the battery has a limited lifespan. 

  


OUR GOAL

Our idea is to develop and manufacture these practical, lightweight, functional and sporty solar backpacks, so that anyone in any part of the world at any time can charge their electrical device and always be connected.

You will find that there are a variety of solar charging products on the market, which are not only expensive, heavy and uncomfortable to carry or use but are designed with solar panels which will never offer a efficient performance.


HOW DOES OUR SOLAR BACKPACK WORK?

The solar backpack is designed with a flexible, removable solar panel and a variety of power adapters which enable you to charge directly your electrical device no matter where you may be. The most important points of our solar panels are; lightweight, flexibility and power production.. incorporated within the USB connection on the panel, is a  voltage regulating microchip which regulates the power output,  maintaining 100% the power flow always at 5V.

It also gives you the option to charge a lithium-ion battery or any kind of rechargable battery with a USB connection, which can be used in moments when it is not possible to connect up directly to the sun. 

 

INVESTIGATION

After collaborating with one of the top solar energy companies in the development of a variety of solar farms in Spain, our research has shown that the flexible panels, in comparison to the majority of rigid panels, are much more effective , meaning our devices are charged much more efficiently.  

 

 

FEATURES

The initial backpack is a blue/grey colour, but we shall be offering them in other fashionable colours to capture clients of all ages and tastes.

 

 

 

The backpack is designed to hold all the new technological portable electronic devices and contains a sleeve in its interior to store laptops of up to 17” and to charge a tablet, ipad, GPS etc., and a variety of extra pockets which are ideal for holding accessories or mobile phones etc. 

It is a perfect option for travelling or spending time outdoors, maybe on the beach, a picnic in the mountain, a day cycling or camping.

Always have your batteries fully charged.

With the solar panel being removable it gives you the possibility to leave your device charging in the sun while you can dedicate your time to other things.


OUR OBJECTIVE

We have been working on the idea of this product for many months. We have travelled the world, meeting with designers and manufacturers and have choosen the materials to make this product the most efficient and productive.

The product has been tested and is now ready for large scale production.

Where the funds are destined:

  • flexible panel order
  • Backpack manufacturing order
  • Marketing
  • Continue with the investigation and development of solar energy products

We have the best suppliers and manufactures ready and just need to raise this money to meet the initial order quantity of 300 units. If we are able to raise more than this initial amount we will be able to  produce a greater quantity which shall reduce the production costs, meaning we can reduce the retail price, thus making this product the best value on the market and also making the solar backpack accessible to everyone, but always maintaining the quality.

We already have meetings organised to hold enviromental awareness conferences in schools, explaining the importance of renewable energy now and for the future. Your collaboration will give us the chance to produce this innovative product giving our future generations the chance to step forward into a healthier, greener enviroment. Enabling people to always be connected, no matter what the circumstances. Never again will they be in a difficult situation with not enough battery power to make that important call or connect with the ones they love.



The sun is free, now is the time to benefit from it    

WE WOULD LIKE TO THANK YOU ALL FOR TAKING THE TIME TO LOOK AT OUR CAMPAIGN, WETHER YOU CONTRIBUTE, LIKE OR SHARE, THANK YOU FOR HELPING TO MAKE THIS PROJECT A REALITY - Thomas & Amy


If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us:

Thomas:   tpirzl@olasolar.com

 Amy:         ahollis@olasolar.com

story:
We plan on creating the premier guided backpacking company in the Lake Tahoe area. At Lake Tahoe Backcountry Guides we will provide you with the best lightweight gear, delicious food, and fun, knowledgeable, experienced guides. Our guides have professional medical training and even some military experience. We will show you some of the most amazing sights you have ever seen. Most people never get to see the remarkable side of the Lake Tahoe wilderness, but we will show you all of the coolest spots. We will set up your tents once we get to camp and even cook you fantastic meals so your vacation can be spent relaxing. The spectacular views that we will guide you to along our tours are simply breathtaking so make sure you bring your camera. After one of our trips you will be dying to get back out into the wilderness. Your love of the outdoors will grow exponentially after you experience the beauty of the Lake Tahoe wilderness. You will feel so accomplished after you finish your trek that you will want to book your next adventure right away. The money raised here will go to purchasing the items necessary to start guiding tours. We have to buy good items like backpacks, sleeping bags, sleeping pads, pillows, tents, headlamps, and trekking pokes. We also need to purchase all of the elements for the snacks and meals that we'll make and provide. We will need things like a vacuum sealer, food dehydrator, and ingredients. We love the outdoors and this would be the perfect opportunity to share the wilderness with others and through teaching "leave no trace" principals to those we explore with we can ensure the wilderness will stay that way for others to enjoy as well. Check out our website at mrrowley11.wix.com/mysite. 

Help Lake Tahoe Backcountry Guides create memories and stories that you will love to share with friends and family for years to come.

Risks and challenges

One of the risks and challenges that we could face after my project is funded is not having any customers. We feel that through targeted advertising we will be able to reach new customers. Social media will be great advertising for Lake Tahoe Backcountry Guides. Everyone who goes on a tour with us will have so many pictures and stories to share the buzz will be fantastic. We will have print ads in high end publications like Forbes, Travel and Leisure, Martha Stewart Living, Afar, Global Living Magazine, and Sunset magazines. 
After the project is funded we can start fulfilling the rewards shortly after as most of them are guided tours. All we need to do is purchase the equipment needed to lead these amazing tours. 
Another risk and challenge that we could face after the project is funded is competition. By paying attention to the little details that make all the difference, we will set ourselves apart from any other companies that are trying to compete. Our guides will be the best around and our gear will be even better! Our team has decades of local knowledge about the Tahoe backcountry and years of wilderness medicine experience. We pride ourselves in taking care of the details that our guests will absolutely love. We first focused on the weight of the packs overall. At just under 15 pounds, you will be blown away knowing all of your gear is packed away in there. We have also focused on the best, most photogenic routes in the area. We have spent tons of time hiking around in the wilderness of Tahoe and we have put together a list of the perfect treks that will leave you in awe.
