story:
PICTURE IF YOU WILL....

HAVING TO DEPEND ON SOMEONE TO ASSIST YOU WITH EVERY DAY TASKS LIKE COOKING...BATHING...SHOPPING ...DRIVING???

HOW WOULD YOU FEEL IF....

YOU HAD SOMEONE WHO WOULD LOVINGLY OFFER TO TAKE YOU WHEREVER YOU NEEDED TO GO, BUT YOUR WHEELCHAIR WOULD NOT FIT????....

TRAPPPED?...LONELY?....INSECURE?...HELPLESS?....

HOW COULD YOU KNOW...

UNLESS YOU WERE IN THAT PERSON'S SHOES.

THERE ARE TOO MANY ENTHUSIASTIC, READY TO GET OUT AND GO SENIOR CITIZENS WHO HAVE UNIQUE TRANSPORTATION NEEDS THAT ARE UNABLE TO DO WHAT THEY WANT, WHEN THEY WANT DUE TO VEHICLES THAT CANNOT ACCOMMODATE THEM.....

 

INTRO(sort of)

I must admit, I was going to start out introducing myself and my husband and give our backgrounds and yada yada and so forth. But I believe since what we are doing is NOT about us, why start with formalities. Why not get right into what we are here for in the first place. By the time I am done you will get a real good feel for who we are and where our hearts reside.

 

THE WAKE UP CALL.....

WE HAVE AN AGING POPULATION THAT IS ONLY GOING TO INCREASE IN SIZE AS TIME GOES ON. THE PROVISIONS WE HAVE MADE AS A PEOPLE OF THIS COUNTRY FOR OUR AGING CITIZENS HAS NOT BEEN SUFFIECIENT.

THERE IS AN UNMET NEED IN OUR SOCIETY THAT HAS GONE OVERLOOKED FOR TOO LONG. WHY? THE ANSWER IS NOT FOUND IN ONE RESPONSE. FOR YOU SEE TO ANSWER THE QUESTION WOULD REQUIRE ONE TO LOOK WITHIN THEMSELVES FOR THE REALIZATION OF AN ANSWER.


OUR SENIORS, ELDERLY, RETIREES, VESSELS OF WISDOM, SEASONED FOLKS, EXPERIENCED EMPLOYEES, GRANDPARENTS, FAMILY BURDEN , SLOW POKES, UNDERVALUED, THE LONELY ONES……

HHHHMMMMMM....WHICH NAME DO YOU USE?


HERE IN LIES YOUR ANSWER TO WHY SOCIETY HAS FORGOTTEN THESE PRECIOUS JEWELS, THESE PEARLS OF WISDOM.

HOW WE VIEW THE 55 AND UP CITIZENS OF OUR COUNTRY IS WHERE THE TRANSITION WILL TAKE PLACE, IN OUR HEARTS AND MINDS.


                           enter…V.E.G.A.S. TRANSPORTATION...(that's us)

THE POINT....


V.E.G.A.S. Transportation stands for

Visibly Establishing Giving And Serving

Our mission is to provide affordable, reliable, easily accessible shuttle van services to the Central Ohio area. We are and will remain the only shuttle service whose first priority is assisting senior citizens by paying attention to their personal needs for transportation while shifting the mindset of our culture to embrace

                                                ELDERLY RESPECT!

www.weserveushuttle.com

WE ARE CAMPAIGNING TO RAISE MONEY FOR A HANDICAP ACCESSIBLE VAN

and the bigger message which is FREE, is to

SHIFT THE MINDSET OF OUR CULTURE TO HONOR OUR SENIORS BY EMBRACING

                                                ELDERLY RESPECT!

www.weserveushuttle.com

 

THE MINDSET SHIFT....


Once we as a society take the stance that we love and will support our senior citizens, then and only then will we begin to see them take their rightful place in society. V.E.G.A.S. TRANSPORTATION sees an opportunity to accommodate by providing accessible, affordable and professional shuttle van services while

                         VISIBLY ESTABLISHING GIVING AND SERVING.

There are so many reasons people will need to utilize our services. My 91 year old grandmother just stopped driving recently, YES, as in a few months ago. Unfortunately, with age comes less ability to get around and more dependence on other people.

Be it physical restrictions, lack of companionship or the inability to find a ride, depression and a sense of helplessness can set in. What if our transportation service could answer the call and provide accommodating transportation that caters to the individual's needs?

What if our perks that you receive with your donations HELP IN SPREADING AND DECLARING OUR MESSAGE to the world?

  • Would you wear a T-shirt with "Seasoned Citizens ----Without them our lives would have no flavor…

 

  • or use a key chain with Elderly Respect --That which we cherish, multiplies in significance with AGE

 

  • or like our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/gotmomentum?ref=hl

 

  • or repin an image from my Elderly Respect board on Pinterest http://pinterest.com/getnmotion4god/elderly-res...

 

  • or when you visit http://www.weserveushuttle.com/index.html Tweet the home page or blog posts so that others will visit the site.

THE JIST OF IT ALL....

PLEASE ASSIST US BY CONTRIBUTING TO THE PURCHASE OF A HANDICAP ACCESSIBLE VAN. MANY ARE IN NEED AND WAITING PATIENTLY FOR HELP.

LET US NOT MAKE THEM WAIT ANY LONGER.

JOIN US AS WE MAKE A DIFFERENCE IN THE LIVES OF OUR SENIOR CITIZENS WHILE PROMOTING

ELDERLY RESPECT.......

story:
Mattia's glance finds roots in the documentary but goes beyond. He depicts an emotional landscape, of the absence of what was, of the tension of what is left.   You can see the presence of history in each image

Arianna Rinaldo

6th Continent is an impressive body of documentary work, that brings a real world context to an almost mythical subject. Mattia's work enmeshes the viewer in the complex and tangled world that is life in the everyday Mediterranean. 6th Continent offers an unflinching and disabusing look of what really goes on in "paradise"

Marc Asnin

THE PROJECT / IL PROGETTO / EL PROJECTO

The origins of the project date back to the year 2007. Mattia Insolera, internationally awarded documentary photographer, sailed away from Italy with a friend who wanted to cross the Atlantic Ocean on a sailboat. After two weeks of navigation he realised he was more interested in life on the shore rather than the mere task of sailing. He dropped down in the Strait of Gibraltar and there he had a first glimpse of a truly Mediterranean environment, a world inhabited by seamen and dockers, smugglers and migrants. He decided to devote the next years of his life to a comprehensive photographic project about Mediterranean culture. Soon after he moved to Barcelona to be in a place well connected to its shores. From there he was able to reach 13 Mediterranean countries, traveling on any kind of boat, from sailing to cargo, and covering 25.000 Km with his motorbike. Throughout the years the project has been funded by public and private institutions and showcased in festivals and exhibitions throughout Europe. The time has come to enclose it in its ultimate form: a photo book.

Le origini del progetto rimontano al 2007. Mattia Insolera, fotografo documentarista premiato a livello internazionale, partì dall'Italia in barca a vela con un amico che voleva compiere la traversata dell'Oceano Atlantico. Dopo 2 settimane di navigazione si rese conto che era più interessato dalla vita sulla costa piuttosto che dalla mera impresa velica. Fu così che sbarcò nella zona dello stretto di Gibilterra ed ebbe un primo assaggio di un ambiente autenticamente mediterraneo, un mondo abitato da marinai e portuali, migranti e trafficanti. Decise di consacrare gli anni a venire ad un lavoro su quest'area geografica. Poco dopo si trasferí a Barcellona per essere in un luogo da cui poteva raggiungere in nave le coste mediterranee. Da allora ha visitato 13 paesi Mediterranei, viaggiando su ogni tipo di imbarcazione, dalla barca a vela al cargo.

Los orígenes del proyecto remontan al año 2007. Mattia Insolera, fotógrafo documental premiado a nivel internacional, zarpó de Italia con un amigo que quería cruzar el atlántico en un velero. Después de dos semanas navegando se dio cuenta que estaba mas interesado en la vida de la costa que en las tareas de un velero. Se bajó en el estrecho de Gibraltar y allí tuvo su primera mirada de un ambiente verdaderamente Mediterráneo, un mundo habitado por marineros y estibadores, traficantes y migrantes. Decidió dedicar los próximos años de su vida a un proyecto fotográfico detallado sobre la cultura Mediterránea. Poco después decidió mudarse a Barcelona para estar en un sitio cercano y bien conectado a sus costas. Desde allí fue capaz de alcanzar 13 países Mediterráneos, viajando en cualquier tipo de barco, desde velero hasta carguero, y cubriendo 25.000 kilómetros con su moto. A lo largo de los años el proyecto ha sido financiado por instituciones publicas, privadas, mostrado en festivales y exhibiciones por toda Europa. Ha llegado el momento de concluirlo en su forma definitiva: un libro fotográfico.

THE FOCUS / IL PUNTO DI VISTA / EL ENFOQUE

Nowadays most of the people know the Mediterranean for being a paradise of sea, sun and blue sky. Belonging to this area Mattia felt the urge to scratch the surface of this touristic cliché and try to capture the real essence of this space. The Mediterranean of the XXI Century has become divisive: a barbed wired fence between the North and the South of the world. It is also the basin where the major conflicts of the world are taking place, a dangerous passage for those who flee from misery and war and even a cemetery for 20.000 migrants that sunk in its waters in the last 20 years. It wasn't always like this. In the past this inner sea was inclusive: a bridge connecting shores and different cultures, a fertile soil for the very first civilisations. According to the Turkish writer known as the Fisherman of Halikarnassos, it was a Sixth Continent, distinct from the arbitrary five continents of geographers, assimilating people coming from the antipodes of the earth, turning them into Mediterraneans. Mattia wanted to find out if something remained of that time so he focused his camera on people who still use the sea as a surface for transportation, a working place, an area of exchange, in other words, people who still experience the sea as a Sixth continent.

Oggi la maggior parte delle persone conosce il Mediterraneo come un paradiso di sole, mare e cielo blu. Appartenendo a questa regione Mattia ha sentito l'urgenza di andare oltre il cliché turistico e provare a catturare la vera essenza di questo spazio. Il Mediterraneo del XXI secolo è diventato una frontiera di filo spinato tra il nord e il sud del mondo. È anche il bacino in cui la maggior parte dei conflitti si stanno svolgendo, un passaggio pieno di insidie per chi fugge dalla miseria e dalla guerra, e un cimitero per i 20.000 migranti naufragati nelle sue acque negli ultimi 20 anni. Non è stato sempre così. Nel passato il mare interno è stato un ponte che metteva in comunicazione differenti culture, terreno fertile per la nascita delle prime civiltà. Secondo lo scrittore turco conosciuto come il Pescatore di Alicarnasso il Mediterraneo era un Sesto Continente, distinto dagli arbitrari 5 continenti dei geografi, uno spazio che assimilava genti venute dagli antipodi della terra, trasformando tutti in mediterranei. Mattia ha voluto scoprire se rimaneva qualcosa di quel tempo, per questo ha rivolto il suo obbiettivo su chi ancora usa il mare come superficie di trasporto, ambiente di lavoro, spazio di scambio; in altre parole, su chi ancora vive il mare come un Sesto Continente.

Hoy en día la mayoría de la gente conoce el Mediterráneo como un paraíso de mar, sol y cielo azul. Perteneciendo a esta zona Mattia sintió el impulso de rascar la superficie de ese cliché turístico e intentar capturar la esencia autentica de este espacio. El Mediterráneo del siglo XXI se ha convertido en una valla de alambre de púas entre el norte y el sur del mundo. También es la cuenca donde los conflictos principales del mundo están ocurriendo, un paso peligroso para aquellos que huyen de guerras e incluso un cementerio para los 20.000 migrantes que hundieron en sus aguas los últimos 20 años. No siempre ha sido así. En el pasado este mar interior fue inclusivo: un puente que conectaba costas y diferentes culturas, una tierra fértil para las primeras civilizaciones. Según el escritor turco conocido como el Pescador de Halicarnaso, el Mediterráneo era un Sexto Continente distinto de los cinco continentes arbitrarios de los geógrafos, un espacio que asimilaba gentes procedentes de las antípodas de la tierra, convertiéndolas en Mediterráneos. Mattia quería averiguar si quedaba algo de aquellos tiempos, de manera que enfocó su cámara en las personas que todavía utilizan el mar como superficie de transporte, lugar de trabajo, espacio de intercambio, es decir, en la gente que aun vive la mar como un Sexto Continente.

THE BOOK / IL LIBRO / EL LIBRO

Hardback, 186 x 273 mm (7.3 x 10.7 in), 270 pp, fold-out map

102 photographs by Mattia Insolera

Foreword by Arianna Rinaldo

This is going to be a poetic travelog that takes you through a journey into space and time, a guide for travelers willing to discover the other side of the Mediterranean. Designed by de.MO, it will feature quotes taken from a rich literary tradition, stories and anecdotes from people encountered along the way and a beautifully hand drawn map. This work appeals to a very broad audience: those who are keen on maritime culture, social and environmental issues, anthropological and historical studies. It can help to understand the past and present of this region and to spread its message of cultural inclusion, a useful lesson to manage our troubled times. There are many good reasons to publish this book, but there's only one way to do it: through your support. If you would like to back up the project you have a selection of rewards to choose from, including posters, shopper bags, signed copies of the book, as well as limited edition archival prints.

See gallery below. You can tell Mattia which print you would like to purchase (mattiainsolera@gmail.com)

Questo sarà un poetico diario di bordo che vi condurrà in un viaggio nello spazio e nel tempo, una guida per viaggiatori che vogliono scoprire l'altra faccia del Mediterraneo. Ne faranno parte citazioni prese da una ricca tradizione culturale, storie ed aneddoti raccolti lungo il cammino e una bellissima mappa disegnata a mano. Questo lavoro incontra l'interesse di una audience molto ampia: gli appassionati di cultura marittima, coloro a cui interessano le questioni sociali e ambientali, gli studi storici e antropologici. Può essere utile per comprendere il passato e il presente di questa regione e per diffondere un messaggio di inclusione della diversità culturale, così importante in questo tempo segnato dai conflitti. Ci sono molte ragioni per pubblicare questo libro, ma c'è un solo modo per far si che succeda: attraverso il tuo aiuto. Se vuoi contribuire a questo progetto troverai una serie di ricompense tra cui scegliere: dalle copie del libro alle stampe fine-art in edizione limitata.

Vedi galleria in basso. Potete comunicare a Mattia la stampa che vorreste acquistare (mattiainsolera@gmail.com)

Esto va a ser un cuaderno de bitácora poético que te lleva a través de un viaje dentro el espacio y el tiempo, una guía para viajeros dispuestos a descubrir el otro lado del Mediterráneo. Diseñado por de.MO, contendrá citaciones tomadas de una rica tradición literaria, historias y anécdotas de personas encontradas en el camino y un precioso mapa dibujado a mano. Este trabajo atrae a una amplia audiencia: aquellos que estén interesados en cultura marítima, temas sociales y ambientales, estudios antropológicos e históricos. Puede ayudar a entender el pasado y el presente de esta región y difundir su mensaje de inclusión cultural, una lección útil para manejar estos tiempos difíciles. Hay muchas buenas razones para publicar este libro, pero hay una sola forma de hacerlo: a través de tu ayuda. Si te gustaría contribuir a este proyecto puede encontrar una selección de recompensas para elegir, incluyendo posters, bolsas de algodón, copias firmadas del libro, ademas de copias fine-art en edición limitada.

Ver galería abajo. Le puedes comunicar a Mattia la impresión que le gustaría comprar (mattiainsolera@gmail.com)


OTHER PERKS / ALTRE RICOMPENSE / OTRAS RECOMPENSAS

SHOPPER BAG

POSTER 50x70 cm

CHALLENGES / SFIDE / RETOS

The production of the book alone will be about US $20,000 and the rest of the money is needed for the graphic design, the distribution and the production of the rewards. The book has to be ready in early 2015, in coincidence with already planned exhibitions in Madrid, Barcelona, Milan and with the photographic festival of Cortona, art directed by Arianna Rinaldo.

La sola produzione del libro costerà US $20,000 e il resto del denaro è necessario per il disegno grafico, la distribuzione e la produzione delle ricompense. Il libro deve essere pronto per l'inizio del 2015, in coincidenza con varie esposizioni già previste a Madrid, Barcellona, Milano e con il festival di fotografia di Cortona, diretto da Arianna Rinaldo.

La sola producción del libro será de $20,000, el resto del dinero se necesita para el diseño gráfico, la distribución y la producción de las recompensas. El libro tiene que estar listo a principio del 2015, en coincidencia con varias exhibiciones en Madrid, Barcelona, Milan y con el festival fotográfico de Crotona, dirigido por Arianna Rinaldo.

THE UKNOWN / L'IMPREVISTO / LO DESCONOCIDO

As with all projects, set-backs occur every now and then. We will do our best to send the rewards to you at the estimated time, if there are delays in production I will promptly inform you. If we will not reach the full amount needed to finalize the project we will utilize the money toward the printing of the book in a smaller amount of copies and we will do the impossible to deliver all the rewards.

Come in tutti i progetti gli imprevisti possono accadere. Faremo del nostro meglio per inviare le ricompense nel tempo stabilito, se ci saranno ritardi nella produzione vi informeremo prontamente. Se non raggiungeremo l'obbiettivo utilizzeremo il denaro per stampare il libro in un numero minore di copie e faremo l'impossibile per inviare tutte le ricompense.

Como con todos los proyectos, retrocesos ocurren de vez en cuando. Haremos nuestros mejores esfuerzos para mandaros las recompensas en el tiempo indicado, si hay alguna demora en producción les informaremos puntualmente. Si no alcanzamos el importe total necesario para finalizar el proyecto utilizaremos el dinero hacia la producción del libro en un menor número de copias y haremos lo imposible para enviar todas las recompensas.

You can also follow the projects progress on http://www.facebook.com/6thcontinentphotobook

Potete seguire l'evoluzione del progetto su http://www.facebook.com/6thcontinentphotobook

También puedes seguir el avance del proyecto en

http://www.facebook.com/6thcontinentphotobook

If you can't contribute, please, help me in spreading the news!

Se non puoi contribuire, per favore, spargi la voce!

Si no puede contribuir por favor corra la voz !
story_txt:
Mattia's glance finds roots in the documentary but goes beyond. He depicts an emotional landscape, of the absence of what was, of the tension of what is left.   You can see the presence of history in each imageArianna Rinaldo6th Continent is an impressive body of documentary work, that brings a real world context to an almost mythical subject. Mattia's work enmeshes the viewer in the complex and tangled world that is life in the everyday Mediterranean. 6th Continent offers an unflinching and disabusing look of what really goes on in "paradise"Marc AsninTHE
PROJECT
/ IL PROGETTO / EL
PROJECTO

The
origins of the project date back to the year 2007. Mattia Insolera,
internationally awarded documentary photographer, sailed away from
Italy with a friend who wanted to cross the Atlantic Ocean on a
sailboat. After two weeks of navigation he realised he was more
interested in life on the shore rather than the mere task of sailing.
He dropped down in the Strait of Gibraltar and there he had a first
glimpse of a truly Mediterranean environment, a world inhabited by
seamen and dockers, smugglers and migrants. He decided to devote the
next years of his life to a comprehensive photographic project about
Mediterranean culture. Soon after he moved to Barcelona to be in a
place well connected to its shores. From there he was able to reach
13 Mediterranean countries, traveling on any kind of boat, from
sailing to cargo, and covering 25.000 Km with his motorbike.
Throughout the years the project has been funded by public and
private institutions and showcased in festivals and exhibitions
throughout Europe. The time has come to enclose it in its ultimate
form: a photo book.

Le
origini del progetto rimontano al 2007. Mattia Insolera, fotografo
documentarista premiato a livello internazionale, partì dall'Italia
in barca a vela con un amico che voleva compiere la traversata
dell'Oceano Atlantico. Dopo 2 settimane di navigazione si rese conto
che era più interessato dalla vita sulla costa piuttosto che dalla
mera impresa velica. Fu così che sbarcò nella zona dello stretto di
Gibilterra ed ebbe un primo assaggio di un ambiente autenticamente
mediterraneo, un mondo abitato da marinai e portuali, migranti e
trafficanti. Decise di consacrare gli anni a venire ad un lavoro su
quest'area geografica. Poco dopo si trasferí a Barcellona per essere
in un luogo da cui poteva raggiungere in nave le coste mediterranee.
Da allora ha visitato 13 paesi Mediterranei, viaggiando su ogni tipo
di imbarcazione, dalla barca a vela al cargo.

Los
orígenes del proyecto remontan al año 2007. Mattia Insolera,
fotógrafo documental premiado a nivel internacional, zarpó de
Italia con un amigo que quería cruzar el atlántico en un velero.
Después de dos semanas navegando se dio cuenta que estaba mas
interesado en la vida de la costa que en las tareas de un velero. Se
bajó en el estrecho de Gibraltar y allí tuvo su primera mirada de
un ambiente verdaderamente Mediterráneo, un mundo habitado por
marineros y estibadores, traficantes y migrantes. Decidió dedicar
los próximos años de su vida a un proyecto fotográfico detallado
sobre la cultura Mediterránea. Poco después decidió mudarse a
Barcelona para estar en un sitio cercano y bien conectado a sus
costas. Desde allí fue capaz de alcanzar 13 países Mediterráneos,
viajando en cualquier tipo de barco, desde velero hasta carguero, y
cubriendo 25.000 kilómetros con su moto. A lo largo de los años el
proyecto ha sido financiado por instituciones publicas, privadas,
mostrado en festivales y exhibiciones por toda Europa. Ha llegado el
momento de concluirlo en su forma definitiva: un libro fotográfico.

THE
FOCUS
/ IL PUNTO DI VISTA / EL
ENFOQUE

Nowadays
most of the people know the Mediterranean for being a paradise of
sea, sun and blue sky. Belonging to this area Mattia felt the urge to
scratch the surface of this touristic cliché and try to capture the
real essence of this space. The Mediterranean of the XXI Century has
become divisive: a barbed wired fence between the North and the South
of the world. It is also the basin where the major conflicts of the
world are taking place, a dangerous passage for those who flee from
misery and war and even a cemetery for 20.000 migrants that sunk in
its waters in the last 20 years. It wasn't always like this. In the
past this inner sea was inclusive: a bridge connecting shores and
different cultures, a fertile soil for the very first civilisations.
According to the Turkish writer known as the Fisherman of
Halikarnassos, it was a Sixth
Continent, distinct
from the arbitrary five continents of geographers, assimilating
people coming from the antipodes of the earth, turning them into
Mediterraneans. Mattia wanted to find out if something remained of that time so he
focused his camera on people who still use the sea as a surface for
transportation, a working place, an area of exchange, in other words,
people who still experience the sea as a Sixth continent.

Oggi
la maggior parte delle persone conosce il Mediterraneo come un
paradiso di sole, mare e cielo blu. Appartenendo a questa regione
Mattia ha sentito l'urgenza di andare oltre il cliché turistico e
provare a catturare la vera essenza di questo spazio. Il Mediterraneo
del XXI secolo è diventato una frontiera di filo spinato tra il nord
e il sud del mondo. È anche il bacino in cui la maggior parte dei
conflitti si stanno svolgendo, un passaggio pieno di insidie per chi
fugge dalla miseria e dalla guerra, e un cimitero per i 20.000
migranti naufragati nelle sue acque negli ultimi 20 anni. Non è
stato sempre così. Nel passato il mare interno è stato un ponte che
metteva in comunicazione differenti culture,  terreno fertile per la
nascita delle prime civiltà. Secondo lo scrittore turco conosciuto
come il Pescatore di Alicarnasso il Mediterraneo era un Sesto
Continente,
distinto dagli arbitrari 5 continenti dei geografi, uno spazio che
assimilava genti venute dagli antipodi della terra, trasformando
tutti in mediterranei. Mattia ha voluto scoprire se rimaneva qualcosa
di quel tempo, per questo ha rivolto il suo obbiettivo su chi ancora
usa il mare come superficie di trasporto, ambiente di lavoro, spazio
di scambio; in altre parole, su chi ancora vive il mare come un Sesto
Continente.


Hoy
en día la mayoría de la gente conoce el Mediterráneo como un
paraíso de mar, sol y cielo azul. Perteneciendo a esta zona Mattia
sintió el impulso de rascar la superficie de ese cliché turístico
e intentar capturar la esencia autentica de este espacio. El
Mediterráneo del siglo XXI se ha convertido en una valla de
alambre de púas entre el norte y el sur del mundo. También es la
cuenca donde los conflictos principales del mundo están ocurriendo,
un paso peligroso para aquellos que huyen de guerras e incluso un
cementerio para los 20.000 migrantes que hundieron en sus aguas los
últimos 20 años. No siempre ha sido así. En el pasado este mar
interior fue inclusivo: un puente que conectaba costas y diferentes
culturas, una tierra fértil para las primeras civilizaciones. Según
el escritor turco conocido como el Pescador de Halicarnaso, el
Mediterráneo era un Sexto
Continente
distinto de los cinco continentes arbitrarios de los geógrafos, un
espacio que asimilaba gentes procedentes de las antípodas de la
tierra, convertiéndolas en Mediterráneos. Mattia quería averiguar
si quedaba algo de aquellos tiempos, de manera que enfocó su cámara
en las personas que todavía utilizan el mar como superficie de
transporte,  lugar de trabajo, espacio de intercambio, es decir, en
la gente que aun vive la mar como un Sexto Continente.THE
BOOK / IL LIBRO / EL LIBRO

Hardback,
186 x 273 mm (7.3 x 10.7 in), 270 pp, fold-out map

102
photographs by Mattia Insolera

story:
My Story:

I began racing bicycles in 1972 at the ripe age of 16. Living in Lubbock, Texas might seem an unlikely spot to begin a career in cycling spanning 5 decades but the challenge has actually helped to fan the flames of passion for the sport. In 1984, after moderate successes racing, I started on my current path of helping to develop the "next generation" of champions. The experiences gained by these young athletes may not always lead to professional cycling careers but the benefits are paid out in dividends lasting a lifetime.

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking your involvement to help broaden and improve the experience. We attempt to keep pricing affordable for these trips which puts us constantly near the break even point. Your participation will help to ensure the continuation of this effort. You also can help us bring greater attention to this effort and help build the popularity of the sport.

Included as a major part of this campaign will be a Podium Rewards program which will help athletes who have had outstanding results to secure a spot on future trips.

We are setting a goal of $20,000 for this campaign. This amount will provide:

  • A buffer zone to the USD/Euro exchange rate
  • The ability to offer subsidies and scholarships to deserving athletes
  • The expansion of the program and training of additional personnel
  • Additional camp offerings 

For minimum contributions, we are offering a thank you gift at several levels. 

  • At $50, you will receive a custom Vertex Cycling cap
  • At $100 you will receive a custom Vertex Cycling tee-shirt
  • At $500 you will receive a custom Vertex Cycling Jersey
  • At $1000 you will receive the cap, tee-shirt and Jersey

We are offering a Super VIP Sponsor package at the $20,000 full funding level. This will include:

  • Full year naming rights of the camps
  • Logo placement on team clothing and Vertex Cycling website
  • One round trip airfare to Brussels and one week's room and board during a selected camp
  • Each of the contribution gifts listed above
  • A lot more! Contact us for details.

The Impact

Cycling is in a new era and is looking at a bright future. We are in the business to help dreams of that future come true.This program has already had the involvement of 70 athletes since 2010. 

No matter who you are or what your cycling interest are, you can make a difference!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are not able to contribute financially, we want you to be involved. 

Let others know what's going on. 

Get out to a race and cheer some kids on.

Get out and ride your bike.

Mainly, have fun!

story:
PERKS • SHIPPING RATES • FAQS • MEDIA BUZZ • UPDATES

>>> NOTICE 9/5/17 <<<

At long last, we Have FINALLY fulfilled all our perks!

GoBQ Grills are shipping NOW, and available on our Indiegogo Marketplace page at https://www.indiegogo.com/products/gobq-grill

To stay in touch and receive news about new products, events and promotions, be sure to register for our mailing list at www.gobqgrills.com/signup. Thank You!

>>> UPDATE 6/1/15 <<<

THANK YOU THANK YOU!

A HUGE thank you to all our fans, contributors and supporters for helping us reach 303% of our goal in 60 days! Not only have you helped launch a company, you've helped revolutionize grilling! Now that our campaign has ended, promotional pricing, stretch goals, referral bonuses, and some perks will no longer be offered. We are, however, continuing to accept pre-orders here until we shift to our own e-commerce platform. The pre-order perk is $149 and includes 1 GoBQ grill + strap.

 

 

 

 

This is the GoBQ™

Now you can grill anywhere you go!

 

Introducing the world’s first and only ultra-portable packable fabric grill. Made from fireproof fabric, the GoBQ folds up like a camping chair and fits in a backpack, a drawer, or slung over your shoulder. It's lightweight and compact. It’s quick and easy to set up and take down. Oh, and it's pretty dang cool too.

 

Ever feel shackled to your backyard, or steps from your car because traditional grills — even the “portable” ones — are just too bulky and heavy to take with you? We did too, but not anymore! The GoBQ Grill can easily be taken to the beach, camping, tailgating, picnicking, biking, boating, hiking, fishing, or anywhere you go! Take it wherever you imagine you could be grilling! And the high-tech heat and flame resistant fabric cools down soon after dumping the embers so you can quickly pack up and hit the trail to your next destination!

 

Want one this summer? Join the club! We surpassed our $30,000 funding goal in only 6 days and have a head start on producing our first manufacturer samples. Plus we have enough funding to pay for all the upfront tooling and material costs required to manufacture these in volume. AND we've recently reached our first stretch goal of $60,000 so we can provide another color choice (looks like red is winning so far)! PLUS, we extended our campaign through May 30th, so if you want one delivered from our first shipment and be able to"GoBQ" this summer and in time for tailgating season, claim your perk now. Thank you for your support!

 

 

 

 

Features and Specifications

 

 

 

 

 

Compact for easy packing and storage

 

 

 

The GoBQ is so compact there’s really no limit where you can take it. Whether you’re on foot or a bike, in a canoe or an airplane, the GoBQ folds up to the size of a small duffel bag. It’s perfect for urban dwellers who don’t have a balcony or storage space for a regular grill, as it easily fits in a drawer or closet! And guess what, you don't have to give up functionality for portability. The GoBQ unfolds (as if by magic! ) to become a sturdy, fully functional charcoal grill with a lid, and enough grilling space to feed the whole family. Forget about all those other so-called "portable grills"!

 

High-Tech Heat/Flame
Resistant Fabric

 

 

Made from heavy-duty silicone-coated fiberglass fabric that can withstand temperatures over 1200ºF (648º C), the GoBQ can take the heat! This material is  FDA-compliant for cookware, and is commonly used for baking mats and oven conveyor belts. It cools down much faster than metal, and insulates the heat so the outside stays cooler than the inside, making it safer for kids and clumsy cooks!

Contribute at any level, receive a MAJOR Award (aka: Perk)!

Perk: Pre-order 1 GoBQ + Strap (BLACK)

 

Perk: Pre-order 1 GoBQ + Strap (RED)

[NOTICE: The promotional Perks below are no longer available. Please choose from the Black or Red Pre-order Perks above for $149]

Just want a GoBQ Grill? Click on the right and claim Perk #3 or #4. Want one with a strap? Claim Perk #5! It's as easy as that. But don't forget to add shipping costs to your total contribution or we'll have to come back and nag you for that stuff!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

IMPORTANT: Please remember to add shipping costs to your contribution! See our USA and International shipping rates below!

 

 

Fathers Day, Graduation, Birthdays, all perfect occasions to buy a GoBQ for the person who grills everything. Get her a GoBQ! Can’t decide what to get Dad? Get him a GoBQ! Your kid’s going off to college? Get ‘em a GoBQ! It’s the gift that keeps on grilling!

Claim the "GoBQ Gift" perk for $135 (plus shipping) and we’ll send you a shiny new GoBQ Grill (with a strap) AND a link to download and print your choice of (5) 5x7" high resolution PDF gift cards (one is blank so you can write your own greeting!). The message at the bottom reads: "WOW, you must have done something right because you’ve been gifted one of the world’s first and only ultra-portable fabric grills… WELL DONE! (Shipping scheduled for August 2015)"
 

We  CRUSHED our first stretch goal thanks to all our supporters and especially KINGSFORD CHARCOAL – who claimed ALL 50 of our SPECIAL EDITION GoBQ Grills for $20,000! (Bummer for anyone else who may have wanted one but hey, you snoozed and you losed!)

 

 

International Shipping:

 

  • Please refer to the rates above for shipping rates for each perk, and add that amount to your total contribution for each perk. All shipping fees must be paid in full before we ship your perk/s.

  • If you've forgotten to pay shipping, please claim the SHIPPING perk and enter a custom amount to the total is equal to the proper shipping rate in the table above.

  • We cannot combine shipping of separate perks at this time. If you want  4 GoBQ grills, you will need to purchase two of Perk #7.

  • As our volume of shipments increase in different regions, we may be able to secure lower shipping costs for some countries.

  • If there are any legal, trade or carrier restrictions that prohibit us from shipping, we will notify you of the problem and refund the transaction if necessary.

 

FAQs

  • How do you clean it? Right after cooking and disposing of the coals, the grill can be folded up and transported quickly without a lot of mess. The body folds into the lid which snaps shut and helps prevent ash dust from falling out of the base. Once you're home or at your next destination, the silicone coating on the fabric make it easy to clean... just spray it out with water before storing. For a more thorough cleaning, wash it out further with dish soap (it fits in the sink too!). The bottom ember guard is also removable for easier cleanup of any grease that may have survived the coals.
  • What kind of charcoal can you use? We recommend any kind of match-light or quick-light briquette because you don't have to carry lighting fluid. Some brands offer small individual sized 3lb bags that you can ignite with a match (such as the  "Kingsford BBQ Bag"). Briquettes are also easier to arrange and rearrange in the basket (using metal tongs of course) if you like to get picky with your heat distribution.
  • Why not just use one of those campfire grates? We've tried those rickety contraptions too and got too frustrated finding the perfect positioning and/or fishing food out of the ashes. Cooking over an open campfire is great for marshmallows or a hotdog on a stick, but it's nearly impossible to control the heat enough to properly cook much else.
     

 

Our History

It all began in 2002 when Eric Goeken — a budding young architecture student without a car — wanted to tailgate with his buddies before the game. But lugging a bulky, heavy metal grill across campus on foot or by bike was out of the question. And even if… what do you do with the grill when you’re ready to go to the game? An idea was born. Invent a truly mobile grill that folds up, can fit in a backpack, and when you’re done you can just bring it right into the game with you!

Fast forward 12 years, an architecture degree, a patent and a bunch of prototypes later: Today Eric’s a 30-something hipster without a car — but he and his business partner Todd Zaroban have developed his idea into an amazing product that grilling fans are clamoring over… the GoBQ Grill. It’s the ultimate outcome — merging three of their favorite things — friends, food and the outdoors!

 

Meet the Team

 

 

Eric Goeken

AKA: The man behind the grill – Eric's inventive skills are matched only by his passion for grilling, green architecture and sustainable design. Since he was first allowed to wield a hammer and nails as a young'n, Eric has been building stuff — furniture, robots, you name it. Care to know how to build a graphene supercapacitor? Subscribe to Eric’s YouTube channel, and you might just be lucky enough to find out. If you could care less about graphene supercapacitors, be sure to check out his most ingenious method of cutting a grapefruit.

In his professional life, Eric spent eight years at an architectural firm, where he helped design commercial properties including the Peninsula Players Theater in Door County, Wisconsin, and Regents Hall at St. Olaf College. He hails from Omaha, Nebraska, and has an architecture degree from Iowa State University.

Though Eric has devised a number of brilliant inventions, the GoBQ is his pride and joy — and he can’t wait to share his passion with other grilling enthusiasts.

 

Todd Zaroban

 

 

Todd is a successful entrepreneur and business owner with over 25 years of design, branding and marketing experience. He keeps Eric in line and focused on one invention at a time, which is no small task.

He’s a proven entrepreneur, having run his own successful graphic design and web development firm for the past 17 years. He has served as brand consultant, web developer and visual communications designer for such major brands as Bayer, McDonalds, Hefty and AstraZeneca.

He too is a grilling junkie, and also smokes the best BBQ pulled pork this side of Saturn. Todd is also from Nebraska, and has a BFA degree from the University of Nebraska at Lincoln. He currently lives in Chicago with his wife Stefany – and has recently celebrated another successful launch, a newborn baby born in January!

 

 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

There are always possible bumps in the road with any new product development. Maintaining the integrity of the design and high standards of quality in the materials and craftsmanship is important to us, as is staying on schedule so our customers get their GoBQs as soon as possible. 

We've worked hard to minimize risks by first designing, creating, testing, using and improving several working prototypes in-house so that any design flaws, however minor, could be identified and solved well ahead of time.

Next we've carefully selected and vetted our manufacturing resources to ensure reliability, quality and scheduling is monitored and maintained throughout the process. Instead of having one factory make our product, we will source to factories that excel for each unique part and then bring everything together to assembly. 

Finally, before the first unit ships, we'll personally perform final quality inspections so every GoBQ meets our high standards of quality and performance.

All that said, there's always the possibility for unforeseen delays due to circumstances beyond our control. Inclement weather can affect shipping times. Ports can become backed up with surplus cargo.

But no matter what, we promise to keep you informed with frequent updates on the progress of our project. So check back often to see how everything is going, and thank you again for all your support!

 

Other ways you can help

Even if you can't make a pledge, you can still help up by spreading the word about our campaign. Just click any of the share links at the top left of this page and share our campaign with your friends and family, or anyone you know who likes to grill! Thank you SO MUCH for supporting GoBQ Grills!

story:
Our Story

Diapers2Go is the brainchild of two dads trying to do away with a problem all parents face. Founders Scott and Thomas met as neighbors while their kids played together in the same street. Their conversations soon turned from the joys of fatherhood to the stresses of being a parent, with both realizing it was diapers which topped the list of headaches

It is easy to see why: there are so many elements to the job, with the entire is process undone without one of the key ingredients. Scott knew there had to be a better way. After some thinking and tinkering in his suburban garage in Australia, Scott created an all-in-one solution: a single biodegradable package which included all the necessities. Needless to say, Thomas was impressed. The dads teamed up to patent, trademark and bring the product to parents of the world. Scott and Thomas, a cement truck driver from New Zealand and a film producer hailing from Denmark, may seem like an unlikely pairing but are perfectly poised to deliver their solution to the masses. Thomas has previously run almost 30 crowdfunding campaigns for film production, and the pair hopes they can get production started with enough pre-orders and online support.

Diapers2Go is a product from parents, for parents. Welcome to a world without diaper bags.

Support The Diaper Revolution

Diapers2Go is ready to begin the revolution, all they need is your support. The business has a working prototype, patent, trademark and factory production deal, but needs capital to bring the product to life. Customer support through pre-orders is hoped to get the all-in-one diaper into production, with an estimated $50,000 required to begin the first batch.

If the team does not reach its goal of $50,000, the money raised will go towards creating a smaller batch order to attract new investors to the company.

The $50,000 will go toward covering costs associated with the first factory run and materials used, like:

- Organic bamboo for the diapers

- Biodegradable plant-based material for the changing mat and trash bag

- Organic and chemical-free cream

- Organic and chemical-free wet wipes

Changing The Way We Diaper

The diaper is at least a thousand years old and had not evolved all that much until the disposable diaper came along in the late 1960s. Since then, little innovation has been made. Diapers2Go is prepared to change this. Their product, with its built-in changing mat, wet wipes, cream and trash bag, will give parents one less thing to think about.  The diaper will also offer a more environmentally-friendly option, with its biodegradable changing mat, chemical-free wet wipes and diaper made from bamboo. If successful, Diapers2Go could fundamentally change the diaper industry. Widespread adoption of the product will prove to the big industry players that parents want convenience, organic products, and an easier option.

Diapers2Go is prepared to build a company that delivers innovative and organic diapers directly to your door, providing a solution that is better for the kids, the parents and the world.

Challenges Along The Way

As with any new venture, the team admits there are risks:

- Will enough people pre-order the diapers?

- Will the factory be able to deliver the product to the desired quality?

- Will the product be safe?  

Diapers2Go is a team comprised of parents who want to help other parents. The team say  they are prepared to do its utmost to deliver a diaper of high-quality that they would use on their own kids. The business believes they have teamed with the right producers, right materials and right processes to deliver a safe, quality diaper.  Being outside of the diaper industry has allowed Diapers2Go to invent an innovative product and, with the right partners, deliver an outstanding diaper that is leak-free and organic with built-in accessories.

How You Can Help

These diapers are meant for parents who have diaper-wearing kids. But even if you don't have kids that wear diapers, you can help. Share this story with parents and families that you know could benefit from Diapers2Go. The product is borne from two dads with a belief in their ideas. They are not a global multinational conglomerate with billions of dollars to spend on advertising. By sharing this product online, through social media or Indiegogo, you could help to further this diaper revolution.

story:
Our campaign ends soon! Last call to order Radius at pre-launch pricing, before the campaign expires at 8am EST on Tuesday 3/8. 

 

This remarkable device will change the way you experience the outdoors. Compact and powerful, Radius creates a 110 Square-foot Zone of Protection, allowing you to enjoy the outdoors without the annoyance of biting mosquitoes, and without the use of chemical spray repellents.

 

Radius works differently than sticky sprays and lotions. Radius uses heat to activate a clean, scent-free repellent. Once activated, the repellent spreads out to create an invisible zone of protection. So instead of treating your skin and clothing with chemical repellents, Radius targets the mosquitoes themselves with a tiny amount of airborne repellent. You simply turn it on… and within minutes, the mosquitoes are gone.

With a fully rechargeable battery and a repellent cartridge that lasts up to 40 hours, the portable Radius can be taken with you to virtually any outdoor activity.

 

The Radius Starter Kit comes with all the components you need to immediately keep mosquitoes away and start enjoying the outdoors again.

A lithium-ion battery powers an internal heating element that silently warms and activates the repellent. Once activated, the repellent disperses to create an invisible zone of protection that keeps mosquitoes from entering into your outdoor space. And it works continuously, releasing fresh repellent to maintain the zone of protection around you.

 A key breakthrough behind Radius’ effectiveness is its repellent formulation. Radius uses an EPA-approved pyrethroid active ingredient. Pyrethroids are based on a naturally occurring repellent found in the chrysanthemum flower. This natural repellent from the chrysanthemum flower has been used to fight insects for millennia – dating back to ancient Egyptian times.

Radius uses an advanced pyrethroid that is highly effective, scent-free and is activated at a low temperature. This enables Radius to create and maintain the zone of protection using lithium-ion battery power. Unlike other area repellents that require intense heat from combustion for activation and dispersion, no flame is required, eliminating the use of candles and liquid fuels.

 

Creating a Zone of Protection with Radius couldn’t be easier. You simply insert the repellent cartridge, close the cover and turn it on. It’s push-button simple.

 

If you’re like us, you love the outdoors, but hate mosquito bites. And we’ve never been satisfied with the other options out there to protect against them. Sprays and lotions can work, but they’re messy, and we’ve never liked covering our skin with chemical repellents. Candles and torches look nice, but they don’t really work. And you can’t really take them with you. So we invented Radius. Combining modern digital technology with nature inspired repellent formulation, we think Radius can change the way the world fights mosquitoes. Join us, and say good-bye to chemical spray repellents!

Mosquitoes are a tough problem, and many others have tried and failed to come up with a better solution than sprays to fight mosquitoes. At Thermacell, fighting mosquitoes is our business. We're committed to finding a better way, so you can take back the outdoors.  

Started by entrepreneurs over a decade ago, Thermacell has created a growing business behind our family of butane powered zone repellents. But we wanted to bring a zone mosquito solution for everyone. To do so, we needed to make a smaller, longer lasting product that was simple to use. We also realized people would want to travel with it, and our original butane platform made air travel problematic. These were the challenges our product team faced…and was the genesis of Radius – Thermacell’s all new rechargeable battery powered platform.

 

The big question is always, how well does Radius work? To prove its effectiveness, we put Radius through extensive outdoor field trials by a third-party facility in Georgia. Placed in a controlled outdoor enclosure, Radius was exposed to hundreds of biting mosquitoes. Two groups of CO2 baited traps were set – a test group placed near the Radius Repeller and a control group set outside of the Radius Zone of Protection.

After the test period concluded, the traps were emptied, mosquitoes counted, and data recorded. The results showed Radius to be highly effective in reducing and eliminating mosquitoes in a 110 square foot area around the repeller.

At the same time, we also applied for and received EPA approval for sales of Radius. So you can be sure that it meets EPA standards for use on patios, decks, and other outdoor spaces around your home. 

100 % Satisfaction Guaranteed: We stand behind our products and our quality. If you are not completely satisfied with your Radius Repeller, you may return it to us for repair, replacement, or refund. 

Warranty: Thermacell® products are guaranteed against defects under normal use for one year from date of purchase. If your product fails to perform satisfactorily because of defects in material or workmanship, it will be repaired or replaced free of charge. If you register your Thermacell® product with us, we’ll double your warranty period to two years.

 

We are Thermacell, a small group of Boston based innovators and entrepreneurs who believe that the outdoors are best enjoyed free from mosquitoes. We want to change the way the world fights mosquitoes, and help people get more out of the outdoor world. Our team brings a diverse range of experience in the consumer products space. Collectively we’ve launched dozens of products that have sold millions of units. We’re also experts in insect protection, with over 50 years of combined experience in preventing and fighting insects.

While Radius is a revolutionary new product, it is not our first zone repellent. Thermacell is the leader in the design and development of Zone Mosquito Protection. We’ve sold butane powered versions of Thermacell for over a decade, and have earned a loyal following among outdoor enthusiasts. In fact, Thermacell currently enjoys the highest consumer ratings in the mosquito repellent space. Our technology and products have been used by the military and has been proven effective in some of the toughest mosquito infested areas.

 

But don’t just hear it from us. Here are a few of the recent articles and reviews of the new Radius product.

Press Links

 

 

 

 

We are looking to Indiegogo to help make this product a reality for everyone who loves to be outside. For the people that pledge to our Indiegogo effort, we have incredible deals and incentives to ensure you are the very first to own the new Radius repeller. 

Radius is available for shipment within the US only. Like most repellents, Radius is regulated by local governments and requires registration within each country. While we are working towards gaining registrations in other countries, we currently only have approval from the US. 

Risks and challenges

The Radius project has been in development for some time, and we've crossed many big milestones. Among them is EPA approval for the Radius system, which we received in October. The remaining risks include the supply chain, where hiccups could occur that delay arrival and shipment of Radius to you. The other remaining milestone is at the state level, where each state must approve the shipment of Radius. At launch of the campaign, the majority of states have approved, and we expect to complete the remaining states prior to shipment in February. However, there's always a risk that certain states take longer to approve than expected, and as a result shipment to these states is delayed. We're doing everything possible to ensure you get your Radius in February, before the mosquitoes show up!

story:
Many travel adaptors on the market are designed with single-use fuses to protect electronics from power surges and overloads, but replacing them and lugging spares around can be a hassle. To combat this annoyance, Zendure launched Passport in 2017, which was the world’s first travel adaptor with an auto-resetting fuse. Thanks to its revolutionary innovation and beautiful industrial design, it won the Good Design Award by the Chicago Athenaeum Museum of Architecture and Design.     

To continue leading the way in the industry and provide an even better user experience, Zendure dedicated over a year to the Passport upgrade project. This led to the creation of Passport Pro, the world’s first grounded travel adaptor with a push-button resetting fuse.   

In the 2017 version Passport with the auto-resetting fuse, you'd have to wait a minute for the adaptor to recover itself if there’s an overload. With the new one-push resetting fuse, when the current flow exceeds safety levels, the power will be interrupted automatically, and with just one push of the fuse button, Passport Pro can be reset immediately. There’s no need to wait, much less carry spares with you, or rush out to buy replacement fuses.  

It’s the first time that a resettable circuit breaker has been introduced into a travel adaptor. Why has no other product been able to do this? Because traditional circuit breakers are too big and too expensive for travel adaptors.   

In order to find the perfect circuit breaker that’s small enough to fit into Passport Pro, we partnered with a manufacturer from Taiwan to co-develop a solution. This manufacturer has been in the circuit breaker business since 1991. With over 27 years of experience in this field, they were able to manufacture the world’s smallest and most robust circuit breaker for us. This was a key component that enabled us to make Passport Pro so compact.  

A top priority in electrical safety is keeping electricity grounded. Passport Pro has four plugs and each is equipped with a ground connection. A ground wire is an essential safety feature for many electrical systems. In the event of high voltage, short, or irregular electrical currents, the grounding wire provides a path for the electricity, transferring energy to the ground rather than the electrical system. This keeps you and your devices safe, reducing the risk of electrical shock, fires and, other dangers.     

The ground wire plays such an important role, but surprisingly 99% of travel adaptors on the market do not have a ground connection. So far, only a few brands in the world can manufacture grounded travel adaptors due to the complexity of the design, and Zendure is proud to announce Passport Pro as one of them. Now you can use your beloved electronic devices with peace of mind. 

Zendure always keeps safety a priority and ensures safer compatibility for consumers worldwide. Passport Pro is compliant with national and international regulations and standards. It is the first travel adaptor which achieves both IEC60884-2-5 Certification and BS8546 Certification. The International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC) is the world’s leading organization for the preparation and publication of International Standards for all electrical, electronic and, related technologies. With the increasing complexity of plug and socket designs by different countries worldwide and in order to provide standardization for safe usage, the IEC published the latest version of its standard for plugs and socket in 2017- IEC60884-2-5. The document also applies to travel adaptors with limited scope.   

BS8546 is a British Standard introduced specifically for travel adaptors launched in April 2016, and it is now a regulation set in the UK to protect the user from unsafe travel adaptors. In fact, it’s the world’s first national safety standard for travel adaptors, and many more countries will follow. It’s also the most rigid standard for travel adaptors and has laid out stringent specifications for safety and quality.   

In order to meet the requirements of the above standards, our engineers have done tremendous work to re-design everything from the inside out, from electronic components, to the selection of raw materials, to the sizes of all the parts, and when it finally came together, we had a true game changer.  

Passport Pro features four powerful USB output ports, including one USB-C PD output and three USB-A outputs. Thanks to years of experience and expertise in charging technology, Zendure is the first company to apply industry-leading Power Delivery charging technology into travel adaptors.   

USB Power Delivery will charge your device up to 70% faster than a standard 5W charger and provide more power to charge tablets and laptops quicker. Thanks to its 18W maximum output, it can charge iPhone X, iPhone 8/ 8 Plus up to 50% in just 30 minutes. Passport Pro serves as an excellent travel companion with strong compatibilities. You can use it to power and charge mobile phones, laptops, electric shavers, digital cameras, game consoles, and other electrical items.  

Passport Pro is a compact and lightweight universal adaptor with UK, EU, AU, and US plugs. The independent World to Europe adaptor provides travelers with a reliable and easy connection in Europe. Thanks to built-in plugs and the universal AC output, this compact 3-pole travel adaptor can work seamlessly in over 200 countries and regions to power 2- and 3-pole devices from almost all over the world.   

Passport Pro can accept type A, B, C, E, F, G, I, J, L, N and O plugs. This is related to the devices you want to use, or in other words, where you are from. 

Passport Pro can plug into type B, C, D, E, F, G, I, K, and O outlets. This is related to where you want to travel to with Passport Pro. Here’s full list of countries whose outlets are compatible with Passport Pro (more than 200 countries and regions).  

Passport Pro includes a detachable World-to-Europe adapter. You can pull the EU portion off from the front of Passport Pro and use it independently to power your AC-powered devices when in Europe. When you don’t need to power any AC-powered devices in EU, you can use Passport Pro as a whole to charge your devices through the four USB ports.

With varying plugs and standards in different regions around the world, well-traveled globetrotters know the value of a versatile travel adaptor. In the past, you’d need to bring different types of travel adaptors if you travel across different countries. But now, you only need to bring one compact Passport Pro. Thanks to its four built-in USB ports and AC outlet, you can charge up to five devices all at once.  

Passport Pro has compact size with a simple and streamlined design. The beloved blue gradient colors from the original Passport are applied to the three slider buttons, and the reset button.   

Just like the original Passport, Passport Pro also includes the unique “Press and Slide” buttons so you can adjust the prongs for different countries with just one hand.  

With all the included features, Passport Pro is surprisingly 16% smaller than the original Passport. This was achieved through a total re-design of the internal structure.

Another unique feature of the Passport Pro is its baby-proof safety mechanism. With a traditional travel adaptor that has wide-open slots, a curious toddler can easily pry open the sockets with any small object and potentially get shocked. We designed this proprietary baby-proof shield to reduce the potential safety hazards. Both sides of the outlet need to be pushed in at the same time in order to bypass the shield.

story:
Be a part of one of the first ground-up, citywide participatory budgeting processes in the US!

For close to two years now, dedicated community members have been meeting, planning, and proselytizing in order to bring a participatory budgeting process to Greensboro, NC. Don’t let those nine tricky syllables scare you off - PB is super cool! It’s a process through which residents of Greensboro will decide how to allocate a portion of the city budget. After identifying issues that are important to us and our neighborhoods, we’ll vote on which projects to fund.

Think we need more bike lanes? Wish there were street lights in your neighborhood? Want to create an afterschool program for local kids? The wait is over! PB is the vehicle for you to share your ideas with neighbors and decide how to best spend our tax dollars.

You can learn a lot more about PB at the PB GSO website, http://greensboropb.org, and the Participatory Budgeting Project’s site, http://www.participatorybudgeting.org. This is way bigger than a budget – this is about re-energizing everyone that lives here to get off the sidelines and make Greensboro live up to its incredible potential.

After two years of drumming up support in the community and educating city council and city staff, we feel like we’re within reach of getting the city council to green-light this process. We need $4000 in order to:

  1. Pay travel and consulting costs for Josh Lerner of the Participatory Budgeting Project and Alderman Joe Moore of Chicago to attend a scheduled city council briefing in June and educate city council and staff on how to implement PB

  2. Contract with the Participatory Budgeting Project as a technical advisor as we build popular and political support to “get PB”

PB is taking off in the US – Chicago; New York; Vallejo, CA. We’ve been tremendously successful in starting the conversation in Greensboro, and with your help our final push will be forceful and successful. Tell your friends, your family, your neighbors and coworkers about this campaign. And then send them to greensboropb.org to find out how to keep up the momentum.

We need your donation right now to get PB. And then we’ll need you and everyone you know involved in doing PB! Our community, and this process, is only as strong and beautiful as those who step up and make things happen.

Help us reach our goal of $4000 by June 6th, 2013.

story:
Hi there.

There is nothing like a great ride in the countryside. The wind in your face, the sun shining, … just cruising along..

You’re enjoying your ride so much, you’d want to map it, share with your friends and ride it again!
That is why we want to create an app that tracks your route. We call it roadhunter!

It’s very easy to use. You activate the app on your smartphone at the start of your bike ride, and… simply forget about it. The app does all the rest. It Tracks in the background so you can listen to music, take calls, and use any other feature of your phone, while still tracking routes, distance and average speed.

Roadhunter automatically shuts down when you take a break for 15 minutes or longer to save battery power.

And there’s more! Snapshots you take during the ride will be added to your log. When you reach your destination, your trip will automatically be uploaded to and shared with fellow bikers on the Roadhunter community website.

In your personal profile you can review and download the gps data of your trip and share your biking experience with your friends.

And if you are looking for some inspiration for your next trip or holiday, the Roadhunter website offers you trip suggestions. All routes can be downloaded for your Garmin or TomTom.

We are thrilled about the idea. To create an app and matching community for bikers to share their best trips with each other, to point out that hidden treasure along the road, to inspire to make more trips.

So this is what we want to do. We want to create a useful app for bikers and a community website to back it up.

To be able to do this, we need funding. That’s where you come in. You can help us reach the amount of 30,000 euro we need for the development. Every donation is welcome, but the bigger your donation, the faster we can turn this test model into your favorite travel companion.. Have a great ride !
story_txt:
Hi
there. 
There
is nothing like a great ride in the countryside. The wind in your face, the sun
shining, … just cruising along..
You’re
enjoying your ride so much, you’d want to map it, share with your friends and
ride it again!
That is why we want to create an app that tracks your route. We call it
roadhunter!
It’s
very easy to use. You activate the app on your smartphone at the start of your
bike ride, and… simply forget about it. The app does all the rest. It Tracks in the background so you can listen to music,
take calls, and use any other feature of your phone, while still tracking routes, distance and
average speed.


Roadhunter
automatically shuts down when you take a break for 15 minutes or longer to save
battery power.
And
there’s more! Snapshots you take during the ride will be added to your log.
When you reach your destination, your trip will automatically be uploaded to
and shared with fellow bikers on the Roadhunter community website. 





In
your personal profile you can review and download the gps data of your trip and
share your biking experience with your friends. 
And
if you are looking for some inspiration for your next trip or holiday, the Roadhunter
website offers you trip suggestions. All routes can be downloaded for your Garmin or TomTom.


We
are thrilled about the idea. To create an app and matching community for bikers
to share their best trips with each other, to point out that hidden treasure
along the road, to inspire to make more trips.
So
this is what we want to do. We want to create a useful app for bikers and a community
website to back it up.
To be
able to do this, we need funding. That’s where you come in. You can help us
reach the amount of 30,000 euro we need for the development. Every donation
is welcome, but the bigger your donation, the faster we can turn this test
model into your favorite travel companion.. Have a great ride !

story:
Introducing the Vizibelt - a light with huge surface area that wraps around your body or backpack to make sure you get seen. Whether a cyclist, runner or anything else, you will become far more visible to those around you at night. It not only makes you more visible, it looks great too so you'll be turning heads for all the right reasons!

Vizibelt uses just two LEDs (one at each end) and a thin tube of flexible plastic to create a long, very bright and light weight light. The final touch is a bright PVC covering in Green, Orange or Blue that adds even better colour and visibility. Using just two LED lights combined with the innovative plastic light-carrying tube means battery life is still competitive with smaller, less eye-catching alternatives like under-seat rear LED bike lights. Vizibelt has three light modes; fast flash, normal flash and constant light.

Prototypes:

Vizibelt - Green

Vizibelt - Orange/Red

Vizibelt - Blue

 

Two Sizes Available

45cm (17.7in) OR 60cm (23.6in) light. Both models have an adjustable black band to accomodate as many shapes and sizes as possible!

Exact sizing and adjustment length will be confirmed. 

We recommend the 45cm model for people planning on using their Vizibelt around a backpack (like the Blue Vizibelt in our video) or for young children. The 60cm model is great for use on your hips, waist or over your shoulder.

Both models are under 120g (0.26 lbs) each including batteries, so you hardly feel the Vizibelt while in use. Batteries used are 2 x CR2032 button batteries - inexpensive and easy to replace.

Who is behind Vizibelt?

My name is Will Williams, I'm a 22 year-old Australian and I now run  a small but growing sourcing and logistics services company here in Shenzhen, China (founded in Hong Kong in mid-2011) called Capstone Pacific (www.cap-pac.com). Before this, I had 5 years experience in sourcing from China remotely, importing and then selling online in both Australia and the UK. I now work on the ground at Chinese factories on a daily basis to source, manufacture, quality control and then deliver products around the world for small-medium business clients who import from China. This places myself and my team in the perfect position to work face-to-face with the selected Vizibelt factory - a short drive from us. You can be assured we have the expertise to keep to our time and quality promises as Chinese manufacturing assistance and logistics is what we do! 

My LinkedIn profile: cn.linkedin.com/in/wdtwilliams

How can you help?

The goal is to raise $7000 to do the first decent sized production run, to hopefully make Vizibelts available to customers around the world. By pledging for one of the Perks packages offered, you will not only be one of the first people in the world to receive a Vizibelt, though you will have directly contributed to bringing a product to market that can be of real use.

Each supporter will also receive a unique Vizibelt souvenir (not yet finalised) to show that their contribution enabled Vizibelt to launch.

Delivery Timeline:

Production is ready to commence and at the latest this will be at the end of October (units would start shipping to you all by late November). If there is good interest early on in the Indiegogo campaign, production should be able to start earlier!

Shipping times for regular international postage from Hong Kong are 7-21 days for most destinations around the world. If you select Express Courier for $15 extra (or for free on some packages), you will receive the delivery within 3-5 days of being sent from our facility here in China! The Express Courier option means you can be assured of delivery no later than 7th December, and possibly by late November.

Ordering of components/materials will start in good time to assure that we experience no delays to the delivery plans. This is one of the advantages of being on the ground in China, we will keep a very close eye on everything and eliminate problems before they cause delays.

October

November

December

Vizibelt manufacturing starts late October

Packaging manufacturing starts alongside

Production finished between 18th and 25th Nov

Possibly Express Courier deliveries by late Nov

Express Courier delivery latest 7th Dec

Regular Post delivery between 5th and 20th Dec

Extra pictures and videos: Checking Vizibelt prototypes at the factory in Dongguan, Southern China.

    

As you can see, the Blue, Orange and Green are standout in the third picture (far left, middle and far right). We are working on perfecting Pink, Red and White versions as there is still some ugly discolouration at the centre of those, so they are not available yet.

 

You can see more videos on the Vizibelt prototypes here: http://www.youtube.com/user/vizibelt

 

Thanks a lot!

Your support is what will launch Vizibelt to the world. Whether you want to pre-order Vizibelt(s) or you just like the idea, you could also really help us out by sharing it with all of your friends and family. Thanks again!

If you have any questions please feel free to write them on the Comments page and they will be answered ASAP, or if you would like to speak to us in private, the email address is contact@vizibelt.com

story:
Nepal has been rocked this year by extreme weather events, causing the tragic loss of many lives.  One of those events was a massive landslide in early August.  156 villagers were killed and now over 600 are homeless and living in a tent city, having lost everything.  The weather will soon start to get very cold in this area and the temperature overnight will be 10 degrees below zero.  We want to provide large, warm blankets for these people and a warm jacket for each child.  These families really need our help.

Our organisation is based in Kathmandu and has a team in Nepal and Australia.  We’ve been working with hospitals, orphanages and Women’s centres for two years and 100% of all the money we raise goes to Nepal.  We’ve previously provided blankets for an orphanage in Kathmandu and the children were so excited to have warm, soft blankets that they still proudly show off to visitors.

We have already been to the landslide area in September and provided 1000lb (500kg) rice, 200lb (100kg) dahl and 100lb (50kg) of clothes and shoes for the villagers.  We are worried now about the cold weather. 

There is also an area to the west of Kathmandu called the Terai that is subject to severe cold weather during the winter that can be deadly.  This area is low and flat and during summer it’s incredibly hot.  Much of the population lives in poverty and they don’t have the clothes or shelter to protect them.  When the cold wave comes with winter and is prolonged it causes many deaths.  We want to give warm jackets to the children to help protect them from dying from cold.

A life saving blanket costs US$15 and we want to buy at least 300 and a warm jacket for a child is around US$5 so we hope to buy 500.  The more money we raise the more blankets we can buy and we’ll use whatever money is raised, even if we don’t reach our goal.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    You may not be able to contribute right now, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

    • Please help us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign by sharing our campaign on your social media or with your friends
    • Like our facebook page and follow what we're doing
    • Join us in Nepal sometime on one of our unique trips

story:
A childhood memory,

When we were kids, our kindergarten teacher would take us to the beach and sit us down on the row of logs that lined the beach. When we were all seated she would press the button on an imaginary TV remote control turning on our favorite show:

The Sea of Galilee (The Kinneret) - Live!

We would watch the waves and the wind, the clouds and the birds, the fish jumping, passing boats, the landscape, the sky and more.

Why are we here today?

Extreme level fluctuations of the Sea of Galilee (the Kinneret) caused the growth of invading plant species into a dense forest. The humidity of the soil causes the formation of wetlands which gives opportunities for mosquitoes, rough stench, foxes and wild bores to thrive and endanger the lives of the residents of the Kibbutz. 

Furthermore the sudden forest is blocking the view and challenging the safety of walking on the beach. 

I spoke to a lady in the Kibbutz which is a resident since Haon was still the front line of defending the most important water source of the new established country and she told me that there was times in which she loved sitting out side watching the view and now there is no reason to get out of the house.

We have the permit and we are ready to restore the beach and give the horizon back to the little community who have struggled with many challenges since they first settled the land in 1949.

Join the team - Make it Happen!

After researching the field, meeting with the authorities and inspecting the ground with contractors, I am delighted to say that accomplishing the mission is not that far fetched and even within our grasp. 

With the right funding we can make it happen!!!

Please join us!!!

Don't think about it to much, a small donation from everyone that has ever visited or lived in this beautiful piece of heaven and has a warm spot for Kibbutz Haon and its' residents in his/hers heart we can turn this dream into a reality.

Take out your card now and contribute as you see fit!

Time is of the essence, the water is rising and the job is vast! 

Please Share!

Please share the link for this page with your friends, relatives and who ever you think would like to join our mission.

It is possible to start the clean-up in the coming weeks but it all comes down to funding. 

If you got all the way down here reading, I guess you care! Now you know what you need to do.

Thank you very Much!

Join our facebook page for updates and pictures from the ongoing project
https://www.facebook.com/RestoringKibbutzHaonBeach
