story:
The Bluesign® system is today's leading solution for sustainable textile production. It takes on a holistic approach throughout the entire supply chain, from the very beginning of the manufacturing process, and sets and controls standards for an environmentally friendly and safe production. 

Our Air-Knit fabric is certified as Bluesign® approved, ensuring it has been made to the highest and cleanest standard in the textile industry.

All our tees are in US sizes and tailored as Slim fit. If you are in between sizes, either go down a size if you prefer a more athletic fit or go up a size for a more regular / relaxed fit.   

If you are used to wearing Asian sizes, simply go down a size if you are true to your size. 

If you are unsure about your size, we would love to help find that perfect fit, e-mail support@seadon.co and we'll take care of the rest. =)

Limited Men XXL and Women XL- Please message us first before ordering if you are looking for these sizes.

Men:

 

 

Women:

 

An in-depth video review from the guys at Trail and Kale:

 

 
 
 
To ensure The Regenerative Tee genuinely stand the test of time, over the past few months, we sent some of our shirts to different 'outsiders' around the world, asking them to put our shirts through a variety of adventures in all types of conditions- from epic ridgeline hikes to sending boulders to doing yoga (in Alaska!). The people shown in our video are just some of these remarkable people doing what they do best- enjoying the outdoors.
 
 
 
First, we got into research mode and tore up a bunch of 'lightweight' shirts. We measured just how 'light' they were with a precision balance machine that measures exactly the weight in gsm (grams per square meters). 
 
The higher the number, the heavier the fabric.
 
Most 'lightweight' fabrics fell between the 120gsm range, with some weighed in at 100gsm, 90gsm and even one with 80 gsm (but this shirt was $60!)
 

Air-Knit weighed in at only 72gsm and our tees start from $34 in our Early Bird tier.

Reflective Logo:

 

WRAP is an independent, objective, non-profit team of global social compliance experts dedicated to promoting safe, lawful, humane, and ethical manufacturing around the world through certification and education. All our shirts are made in a WRAP certified factory in Vietnam, ensuring our values are met throughout the production process, from start to finish.

In January, we flew to Vietnam to visit our WRAP certified factory to go through a pre-production quality control for our Regenerative Tees. This included seeing the overall conditions and capacity of the factory, checking the conditions of machineries and equipments, and workers general well-being. We also met with the factories head of technician to go through every single detail in our tees, down to the thread, to ensure they are made to the highest of quality.

Going through some quality control with the factory's head of technician in the sampling room.

Having a traditional Vietnamese lunch in the factory's canteen, where all the workers go eat together. Food was next level!

Joseph, myself and Mr Tien (our manufacturing partner) outside our WRAP certified factory in Vietnam, after a productive meeting!

Carson (left)- Founder / Hiker + Climber. Blanche (center)- Design / Dancer + Doggies Saviour (adoptions). Joseph (right)- Operation / Traveler + Jack of all trade.​

 

Hi, we are Seadon. We are a new outdoor clothing company who is on a mission to make the best product sustainably, for all those who share our love for the outdoors. 

The Outdoors give us energy. Being outside connects us, recharges our body and mind, and it just naturally makes us feel good.   

The outdoor clothing industry pride itself on the ability to connect people with the outdoors, yet all too often, this connection comes at the cost of the very thing we enjoy spending so much time in. There are a lot of nasty stuff happening behind closed doors in the clothing industry that are kept away from customers for a number of reasons- from fabrics being treated with un-known and toxic chemicals, made with non-renewable resources such as oil (dirty!) to produce, to cheap and unfair labour working in poor conditions. The result is often a product that is taxing on the planet, made cheaply and sold at a premium price. But we are not here to point fingers. We are here to add that extra sustainable and ethical touch of ours, to the highly-functional gear that we make. 

Imagine the feeling of being able to fully appreciate the outdoors with your gear, knowing that you're part of a gang of outdoor warriors who believe changes can be made for the better, and pledging for a healthy planet. This is who we are at Seadon.  

‘Seadon’ is an English name, meaning ‘From the Hill, by the Sea.’ We consider ourselves a bunch of outdoor enthusiasts first, designers and makers second. We believe in order to design and make the best products for the outdoors; one must first understand the culture, connect with the people, and immerse in our planet. 

We welcome you all with open doors with the launch of our first product- The Regenerative Tee.

We are a proud member of 1% for the Planet, and we are dedicated to doing our bit to give back to organizations helping to improve the environment. We pledge 1% sales to these awesome groups of people around the world, who are all collectively making a positive impact on the same goal- to create a healthy planet. 

30 days risk-free return:

If you are not 100% satisfied with the quality of the product upon receiving it, you can return it within 30 days and we will offer to replace the product. If that doesn't work out, just send it back and we will offer a full refund.
story_txt:
The Bluesign® system is today's leading solution for sustainable textile production. It takes on a holistic approach throughout the entire supply chain, from the very beginning of the manufacturing process, and sets and controls standards for an environmentally friendly and safe production. Our Air-Knit fabric is certified as Bluesign® approved, ensuring it has been made to the highest and cleanest standard in the textile industry.All our tees are in US sizes and tailored as Slim fit. If you are in between sizes, either go down a size if you prefer a more athletic fit or go up a size for a more regular / relaxed fit.   If you are used to wearing Asian sizes, simply go down a size if you are true to your size. If you are unsure about your size, we would love to help find that perfect fit, e-mail support@seadon.co and we'll take care of the rest. =)Limited Men XXL and Women XL- Please message us first before ordering if you are looking for these sizes.Men:  Women: An in-depth video review from the guys at Trail and Kale: 


 
 




 
To ensure The Regenerative Tee genuinely stand the test of time, over the past few months, we sent some of our shirts to different 'outsiders' around the world, asking them to put our shirts through a variety of adventures in all types of conditions- from epic ridgeline hikes to sending boulders to doing yoga (in Alaska!). The people shown in our video are just some of these remarkable people doing what they do best- enjoying the outdoors.
 

 

 

First, we got into research mode and tore up a bunch of 'lightweight' shirts. We measured just how 'light' they were with a precision balance machine that measures exactly the weight in gsm (grams per square meters). 
 

The higher the number, the heavier the fabric.
 
Most 'lightweight' fabrics fell between the 120gsm range, with some weighed in at 100gsm, 90gsm and even one with 80 gsm (but this shirt was $60!)
 


Air-Knit weighed in at only 72gsm and our tees start from $34 in our Early Bird tier.
Reflective Logo:

 WRAP is an independent, objective, non-profit team of global social compliance experts dedicated to promoting safe, lawful, humane, and ethical manufacturing around the world through certification and education. All our shirts are made in a WRAP certified factory in Vietnam, ensuring our values are met throughout the production process, from start to finish.In January, we flew to Vietnam to visit our WRAP certified factory to go through a pre-production quality control for our Regenerative Tees. story:
Next Generation Travel Towel

Fits perfectly with your sustainable travel plans.

100% Raw Silk, packs small & for all skin types.

AND no microplastics end up in our oceans when used & washed.

 

Finally a Sustainable Travel Towel!

We are happy to present our 100% raw silk travel towel to the world! Completely natural material as functional as advanced synthetic materials, yet much more beneficial for you and nature!

 

Why a Raw Silk Travel Towel?

Skin beneficial: hypoallergenic & gentle even for sensitive skin

Functional: super light, compact, anti-bacterial & quick drying

Sustainable: completely natural & biodegradable 

 

Why We Chose Raw Silk for Our Travel Towel?

 

Which Is the Best Travel Towel?

There are lots of travel towels on the market. The most common material is Microfibre. There are also a few other more natural alternatives such as Cotton and Bamboo.

How do we know which is the best travel towel? From our viewpoint, there is no absolute best one. More precisely, it is nearly impossible to pick one which is the best for everyone. Every material has different properties and its own pros and cons. Everyone has different preferences, experiences and values.

Check: Material Comparison

From this comparison, you can get an idea why we chose Raw Silk for our travel towel.

 

8 Benefits of SHIN JARDBO Travel Towel

 

  • Dimension

 

The STANDARD towel is functionally sized meaning ample enough to be used as a bath towel (or beach towel), yet not oversized. It can be folded like a pocketbook but a lot lighter at 140g.

The BANTAM towel is suitable for children and people with a smaller body type.

 

 

3 travel towels (STANDARD size) vs. 3 ordinary bath towels:

A mobile phone placed on top of 3 travel towels in different sizes: FACE & HAND, BANTAM, and STANDARD (from top to bottom):

 

  • Colours

  • Hanger loop

 

  • Care label

 

How to Care for a Raw Silk Travel Towel?

Our towel is sustainable both for you and nature. Following our care instructions will make it even more so. Check Here.

 

About Us

 

 

This is Lan and Martin, the founders & creators of SHIN JARDBO, also companions for life. Coming from completely different backgrounds, cultures, and continents, we have somehow found common values that we want to share with the world.

We believe our most precious gift is the opportunity to experience life, and Movement, Outdoor Adventures, and Being Mindful are the keys to enhance this experience.

SHIN JARDBO is based in Malmö, Sweden, and creates products for people who enjoy an active & natural lifestyle under the lead words Nature, Style, and Function. 

 

 

Nature - SHIN JARDBO products are not only made to be used in nature but also for and by nature

Since Martin was 4 years old, he refused to wear clothes made of synthetical materials as he found them itchy and uncomfortable. Having seen more of the world, his awareness of the environmental impact and fondness of nature increased. Therefore, the idea of avoiding synthetical materials has become even stronger with time. Both the body and the planet will be happier with more natural materials.

Style - SHIN JARDBO products stay essential without losing style

Growing up in Seoul where trends rapidly evolve, in combination with various international experiences, Lan has developed her own idea of what design can be resistant to fast-changing trends and last across borders in a multicultural world. The root of her idea is to stay essential without losing style (confidence in being oneself). This permeates both her lifestyle and SHIN JARDBO products.

Function - SHIN JARDBO products will be a good partner no matter if you are off on far away adventures or enjoying an active everyday life

Having shared many travels and physically demanding adventures, we know function is something that cannot be compromised. On one hand, we use natural materials to the biggest possible extent, but on the other hand, we do not let function down. Fortunately or unfortunately, we are stubborn enough to try new solutions until we have achieved this.

 

Our Perks

 

Packing & Shipping

Packing

All the components have been chosen with sustainable and minimal packing in mind.

 

Shipping

In this campaign, we offer Free Shipping Worldwide regardless of the perk value or destination country. Perk items are sent with postal service.

 

  • Estimated Process Timeline

 

  • Special notes

*For more info about Packing & Shipping, please refer to the FAQ section.

*Regarding the Delivery & Production progress, we will keep you informed in the UPDATES section.

 

Want to Support Us?

Do you find SHIN JARDBO travel towel favourable for you or someone you know? If yes, that sounds great! WE NEED YOU - Your Attention, Support, and Feedback! All of these can help us to grow. We as a company and as individuals, encourage people to enhance their active & natural lifestyle. This is what motivates us.

There are 3 ways to support us. 

1. Claim a perk:

Review the list of Our Perks above and choose what suits you the best. For the perk: 'Set A x 2' and 'Set B x 2', towel colour will be selected after clicking on 'GET THIS PERK'.

2. Back this campaign:

Yon can contribute without perks if you wish. This can be done by clicking on 'BACK IT' located in the campaign title area (in desktop) or 'Make a contribution' found in the perk selection area (in mobile). 

3. Share & Spread:

Sharing is very simple and easy today. Feel free to share our campaign page, product images, SNS posts, etc. in your favourite way. 

Find us here:

        

Upon sharing through SNS channels, kindly remember to tag our account name and add hashtags #shinjardbo and/or #shinjardbotraveltowel so we could find you to appreciate.

 

Contact Us

Do you have any questions regarding this campaign? Please check the FAQ section to see if you can find the answer you are looking for. 

If you are a backer of this campaign, you can leave a comment in the COMMENTS section.

If you have not backed this campaign, your questions can be answered at martin@shinjardbo.com. We are able to communicate in English / Chinese(中文) / Korean(한국어) / Swedish(Svenska).

story:
Short Summary

Valentino Griscioli | Photographer, DoP

Chiara Sestili | Chef


ITALIA SEGRETA  is a photographic journey through the excellences of Italy, which we will meet on the way, showing the most fascinating places to the world, to create a network of cultural, conscious, environmental friendly tourism.

Departure from Predoi (BZ) destination Lampedusa (AG). 

The path is not planned but will be the result of the experiences, the flow of events, stories and encounters that will make along the way.

Daily pictures, videos and stories, will be published on a dedicated blog www.italiasegreta.com

We will compile during the journeys a Visual Atlas of Italy and a multimedia ebook with photos, stories and multimedia links in three languages ​​(Italian, English and German).

We will move on a camper-media-studio between the different places and we will be flexible in movement following the events and meetings already scheduled. There is the possibilities of organizing on-site journey guided by local people (Cicerone) expert of the history, traditions and human excellences and local landscape.

Contact ciceroni@italiasegreta.com for reservations.

Departure from Predoi (BZ) August 2014

Arrive in Lampedusa (AG) September 2015

Estimated date of release of volume in December 2015


(Scorri giù per il testo in italiano)


Talking about us:






THE PROJECT: ITALIA SEGRETA

- Introduction

Travel into Italy. Travel for Italy.

30 years after the “Viaggio in Italia” by Luigi Ghirri, the peninsula is lacerated for the consequences of a deep crisis arrived from above. What Italy has become today? The world is getting used to an image of our country decadent and compassionate and the economic and political spheres still do not look at the reality of the country. A country that for its historical, geographical and human resources could live luxuriantly with a clean, clever and curious tourism. My experience of life outside the Italian borders has matured gradually a critical and angry spirit at the same time of the “Bel Paese” for the waste of resources and opportunities.

The last job assigned to me from the Berlin’s Magazine ST.ART was the “A” that was missing. They asked me to talk about my roots, what I feel as strong and true with my land. In the editorial drafts I found a picture of the Coliseum. There started the reflection that has stretched the way for the creation of a work inspired by the history and nature of a symbolic place of my story but that surprisingly fits on the story of Italy. The lake of Turano, the birthplace of my paternal grandmother, was the symbol of an Italy submerged, from which sprout, views from the world, only the top of the tower of Pisa, some arc of the Coliseum, the Mole of Turin.

Coming back home, this time for 10 days, to increase the material for Thurania project I went back on the shores of Lake Turano and I realized before I take photographs what could be the reaction of my colleagues on my return to the studio to see those landscapes. As predict it was. That places were only not famous, not noble, not tourist destinations places, there were just some of the thousands wonders of our country, and like almost of these places, the axe of depression breaking on people's dreams devasting them.

                                                           (Valentino Griscioli) www.valentinogriscioli.com


What we can do now is to show the world the wonders of Italy from north to south, traveling on a camper-media-studio on secondary roads, meeting this Secret Italy, photographing it, telling it with interviews, photographs and films. Spread it around the world through a daily blog during the trip and creating a Visual Atlas of Italy (digital and paper in 3 languages) to be edited at the end of the trip. What we want is to create a trail of contacts, people and places for a possible recovery to the crisis and as incentive for the eco-tourism. That will be a big media event and a reference point for the exploration of our country for the rest of world.



- What drives us to travel?

Living outside Italy for 4 years we have developed a vision of the country with more objective eyes and even a little of nostalgia. Now we see to Italy as abandoned and undeveloped in comparison with countries with whom we came in contact more, France and Germany in particular. Our main purpose is the revaluation of the territory, we know what the rest of the world thinks and knows of Italy, it is not necessary to say more about the Colosseum or the Tower of Pisa, but we realized the potential of the rest of the Italian territory, beautiful forgotten, unknown to the world.

-The idea

Journey from the extreme north to the extreme south of Italy avoiding all major cities and most noble goals to create a Visual Atlas of Italy, unusual, hidden, but real, close to our vision of life : civil, fair, legal, zero impact. The path will be marked by a free sense of traveling and based on the meetings, the places, the people that will take on the path.

As the story goes forward we will build a database of all the "big wave” of contacts of people and companies that we will meet along the way and that will be one of the engines of the blog www.italiasegreta.com that in partnership with our media partner promote responsible tourism and cultural heritage in Italy in the most disadvantaged and almost always forgotten places.

At the end of the trip we will publish a photo book guide in three languages ​​(English and German, Italian), a large Visual Atlas of Italy , with names , addresses and specialties , accompanied by our interviews and extracts from the documentary that will edit the end of the journey.

The blog will remain online but the site will become a support for the app  "Italia Segreta" that will act as a bridge with all the contacts recorded during the trip and will provide access to the database to be consulted and for reservations.

The app will work with an interactive map to discover all the places around the current position with previews of photos and small videos or interviews with the possibility of booking products and services directly from various companies online.


Where is your money going?

We established a budget for 1000 printed copies of the book:


You can pre-order your copy of the book at the special price of $129 / €94 during this 2 months of crowd funding campaign (the final cover price will be €120) saving €26.

If you want to become a technical sponsor of the project please email us at: hello@italiasegreta.com


FAQ

Shipping:

-Is the shipping included in the price of the Book?

A: The shipping is included for the EU zone, for the international shipping please add the €20 perk.

-I bought the book but forget to buy/can't pay for the international shipping perk, how can I solve that?

A: Don't worry about that, after the crowd-funding campaign is over we will contact back all our supporters and we can arrange for a solution.

-I subscribed for a 10 pack can I change the shipping address and what about international shipping?

A: Sure! After the crowd-funding campaign is over we will contact back all our supporters before shipping and you can at every time change before we ship the pack. For the 10 pack the shipping is included all over the world.

-I wrote you about the "cicerone" tour in my area but I still haven't an answer, is there some problem? 

A: Sorry my friend, we try to answer all the email and other messages in 24/48h but this days of crowd-funding campaign are really intense! If you don't receive an answer in 48h feel free to write again, maybe something goes wrong with the net.  


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Share on the Media and Social Media www.italiasegreta.com
  • Organize a "Cicerone" tour in your area.


Video message

ITALIA SEGRETA is a project of traveling through Italy searching the most beautiful and unknown places, the most interesting stories, the local realities and the excellence of the territory.

The idea comes from our way of life: we live and work in Berlin for 4 years while remaining deeply connected to our homeland.

This new life has opened up a new perspective with which to look at our country and we realized how much the knowledge of Italy abroad is limited to the usual and famous destination like Rome, Venice and Florence.

From all that was born the idea of showing the world the “Secret Italy” the one of the amazing landscapes, unknown villages and culinary  and artisanal excellence.

We decided to tackle this trip knowing that we will encounter a country affected by a deep economic and social crisis and we want this journey to be a springboard to relaunch a conscious, cultural and clean tourism.

The trip itself does not have a set route but only a starting point and a destination: the two extremes commons of Italy. From Predoi to Lampedusa we will proceed guided by the case, the flow of events , the stories, the experiences and encounters that will make along the way.

We established a budget to cover to cover the costs of a 12-16 months travel, the setting up of a mobile media studio inside a car camper  and for printing the book "Italia Segreta" Italy Visual Atlas.

With your contribution you can buy one or more copies of a hard cover book version in high quality photographic edition or in digital format or you can finance part of the project directly  becoming a sponsor or a media partner of “Italia Segreta” project .

During the journey we will compile a logbook on the blog www.italiasegreta.com where previews of photos of the beautiful Italian landscapes will be shown and the interviews and stories of our adventures and encounters will be published.

All material collected will be processed at the end of the journey in order to create a documentary film about our experiences.

We will also develop an interactive app that will allow you to instantly have access to the large database of contents: places, stories, accommodation, artisans, farms, restaurants, small excellence businesses, Km 0 producers, places of culinary traditions will be simply and quickly accessible directly on your mobile device.


PERKS LIST:








_____________________

ITALIANO

Valentino Griscioli | Photographer, DoP

Chiara Sestili | Chef


ITALIA SEGRETA è un viaggio fotografico attraverso l'Italia delle eccellenze, che incontrerà sulla via i luoghi più affascinanti e da mostrare al mondo, per creare una rete di turismo culturale, consapevole, pulito.

Partenza da Predoi e arrivo a Lampedusa. Il percorso non pianificato sarà il frutto delle esperienze, del flusso degli eventi, delle storie e degli incontri che faremo lungo il cammino.

Pubblicazione giornaliera di foto, video e storie, su un blog dedicato www.italiasegreta.com

Compilazione progressiva di un Atlante Visuale d’Italia e di un ebook multimediale con foto, storie e link-media in tre lingue (Italiano, Inglese e Tedesco).

Spostamenti su un camper-media-studio tra le diverse realtà che incontreremo, flessibilitá di movimento generata dagli eventi e dagli incontri già programmati. Possibilitá di organizzazione in loco tramite persone guida (ciceroni) esperte della storia, delle tradizioni e delle eccellenze umane e paesaggistiche locali. Contattare ciceroni@italiasegreta.com per prenotazioni.

Partenza da Predoi (BZ) agosto 2014

Arrivo a Lampedusa (AG) settembre 2015

Data prevista di uscita del volume Dicembre 2015

IL PROGETTO: ITALIA SEGRETA


-Premessa

Viaggio in Italia. Viaggio per l'Italia

A 30 anni dal viaggio di Luigi Ghirri, la penisola è allo stremo per le conseguenze di una crisi impietosa e piovuta dall’alto. Cos'è questa nostra Italia? Il mondo si sta abituando ad un'immagine decadente e drammatica del nostro paese e le sfere economico-politiche continuano a non rivolgere lo sguardo verso la realtà del paese, che per la sua formazione storica, geografica e umana potrebbe vivere rigogliosamente di un turismo pulito, intelligente, curioso, innamorato. La mia esperienza di vita fuori dai confini italiani ha fatto maturare pian piano uno spirito critico verso il belpaese e contemporaneamente una nostalgia arrabbiata per lo spreco di risorse e di possibilità. L'ultimo lavoro commissionato per la rivista ST.ART di Berlino è stato il LA che mancava. Mi hanno chiesto di parlare delle mie radici, delle mie origini, di quello che sento come legame forte e vero con la mia terra. Nelle bozze pre editoriali ho trovato la foto di un Colosseo. Lì è partita la riflessione che ha aperto la strada alla creazione di un lavoro ispirato alla storia e alla natura di un luogo simbolo del mio passato ma sorprendentemente calzante per le sorti dell'Italia: il lago del Turano. La terra natale della mia nonna paterna, è stato il simbolo dell'Italia sommersa, da cui spuntano, viste dal mondo, solo la cima della torre di Pisa, qualche arco del Colosseo, la mole di Torino. Nel rientro in patria stavolta durato 10 giorni l'illuminazione. Per incrementare il materiale sul lavoro Thurania sono tornato sulle sponde del lago del Turano e mi sono reso conto prima ancora di scattare le fotografie quale reazione avrebbero avuto i miei colleghi dello studio al mio ritorno nel vedere quei paesaggi. Così predetto, così è stato. Luoghi non famosi, non blasonati, non mete turistiche, erano solo alcune delle migliaia di meraviglie del nostro paese, e come quasi tutti questi luoghi la scure della depressione si infrange sui sogni della gente e li devasta.

(Valentino Griscioli) www.valentinogriscioli.com


Cio che ora vogliamo fare è mostrare al mondo le meraviglie dell'Italia da nord a sud, viaggiando su un camper-studio sulle strade statali e provinciali,  incontrando questa Italia, fotografandola e raccontandola con interviste, fotografie e filmati. Diffonderla in tutto il mondo tramite un blog giornaliero e creando durante il viaggio un Atlante Visuale d’Italia (digitale e cartaceo) da editare alla fine del viaggio.  Quello che intendiamo creare è una scia di contatti, di persone, di possibile ripresa e un incentivo del turismo man mano che questa onda passerà per tutto lo stivale, un evento mediatico e un punto di riferimento per l'esplorazione del nostro paese visto dal resto del mondo.


-Cosa ci spinge al viaggio

Vivendo da 4 anni fuori dall’Italia abbiamo sviluppato una visone del paese con occhi più obiettivi e anche un po’ nostalgici. Ora vediamo l’Italia come abbandonata e non sfruttata, in confronto con i paesi con cui siamo venuti piú a contatto, la Francia e la Germania in primis. Il nostro scopo principale è la rivalutazione del territorio. Conoscendo l'immaginario che il resto del mondo ha nei confronti dell’Italia, non riteniamo necessario dire altro sul Colosseo o la Torre di Pisa ma abbiamo capito la potenzialità del resto del territorio italiano, bellissimo, dimenticato, sconosciuto al mondo.

-L’idea

Viaggio dall’estremo nord geografico d’Italia all’estremo sud evitando tutte le maggiori città e mete più blasonate per creare un Atlante Visuale d’Italia inconsueto, nascosto, ma reale e affine alla nostra visione della vita: civile, corretta, legale, a impatto zero, solidale. Il percorso sarà segnato dal senso libero del viaggio e dagli incontri che ci porterà il cammino stesso: luoghi, persone, suggestioni.

Man mano che la storia andrà avanti compileremo un database di tutta la “scia” di contatti di persone e di aziende che incontreremo lungo il cammino e che sarà uno dei motori del blog www.italiasegreta.com che in gemellaggio con i nostri media-partner promuoverà il turismo responsabile e culturale nell’Italia più svantaggiata e quasi sempre dimenticata.

Alla fine del viaggio pubblicheremo un libro fotografico in tre lingue (italiano inglese e tedesco), un grande Atlante dell’Italia Segreta, con nomi, indirizzi e specialità, corredato dalle nostre interviste, da stralci del documentario visuale che editeremo alla fine dell’esperienza.

Il Blog rimarrà online ma il sito si trasformerà in un appoggio alla APP “ItaliaSegreta” che farà da ponte tra tutti i contatti scoperti e redatti durante il viaggio e garantirà l’accesso, agli utenti, al database sia come consultazione che operativamente per le prenotazioni alle strutture e servizi.

L’ App funzionerà con una mappa interattiva per scoprire tutti i luoghi intorno alla posizione attuale con anteprime di foto e piccoli filmati o interviste e con la possibilità di prenotare prodotti e servizi direttamente dalle varie aziende online.


Testo video

Italia Segreta è un progetto di viaggio attraverso l’Italia alla ricerca dei luoghi più belli e sconosciuti, delle storie piú interessanti, delle realtà locali e delle eccellenze del territorio.

L’idea nasce dal nostro percorso di vita: viviamo e lavoriamo da 4 anni a Berlino pur rimanendo molto legati alla nostra terra di origine.

Questa nuova vita ci ha aperto una prospettiva diversa con cui guardare il nostro paese e ci siamo accorti di quanto la conoscenza dell’Italia all’estero sia limitata alle solite mete famose e blasonate, come Roma, Venezia e Firenze.

Così è nata l’idea di mostrare al mondo l’Italia Segreta, quella dei paesaggi mozzafiato, dei borghi sconosciuti e delle eccellenze culinarie e artigiane.

Abbiamo pensato di affrontare questo viaggio sapendo di incontrare un paese colpito da una profonda crisi economica e sociale e vogliamo che questo sia un trampolino di rilancio per un turismo consapevole, culturale e pulito.

Il viaggio in se non ha un percorso stabilito ma solo un punto di partenza e uno di arrivo: i due comuni estremi d’Italia. Da Predoi a Lampedusa procederemo seguendo il caso, il flusso degli eventi, le storie, le esperienze e gli incontri che faremo lungo il cammino.

Il budget che abbiamo fissato è necessario per coprire le spese di viaggio, di allestimento dello studio mobile sul camper con cui ci sposteremo lungo lo stivale e di stampa del volume “Italia Segreta” Atlante Visuale d’Italia.

Con il tuo contributo puoi comprare una o più copie del libro in formato cartaceo di lusso o in formato digitale oppure puoi finanziare direttamente parte del progetto diventando sponsor o media partner di Italia Segreta.

Durante il viaggio terremo un diario di bordo sul blog www.italiasegreta.com su cui confluiranno le anteprime delle foto dei meravigliosi paesaggi italiani, i filmati e i racconti delle nostre avventure e degli incontri che faremo.

Tutto il materiale raccolto sarà elaborato alla fine del viaggio per creare un docu-film sulla nostra esperienza e una App interattiva che permetterà di accedere istantaneamente al grande database di contenuti: luoghi, storie, strutture ricettive, artigiani, agriturismi, ristoranti, piccole aziende d’eccellenza, produttori a km0, luoghi delle tradizioni enogastronomiche.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Valentino
Griscioli | Photographer, DoP
Chiara
Sestili | ChefITALIA
SEGRETA  is a photographic journey through the excellences of Italy, which we will meet on
the way, showing the most fascinating places to the world, to create a
network of cultural, conscious, environmental friendly tourism.
Departure
from Predoi (BZ) destination Lampedusa (AG). The path is not planned but will be
the result of the experiences, the flow of events, stories and encounters that
will make along the way.
Daily
pictures, videos and stories, will be published on a dedicated blog
www.italiasegreta.com
We will compile
during the journeys a Visual Atlas of Italy and a multimedia ebook with photos,
stories and multimedia links in three languages ​​(Italian, English and
German).
We will
move on a camper-media-studio between the different places and we will be flexible in movement following the events and meetings
already scheduled. There is the possibilities of organizing on-site journey guided by local
people (Cicerone) expert of the history, traditions and human excellences and
local landscape.Contact ciceroni@italiasegreta.com for reservations.
Departure
from Predoi (BZ) August 2014
Arrive in
Lampedusa (AG) September 2015
Estimated date of
release of volume in December 2015(Scorri giù per il testo in italiano)Talking about us:THE
PROJECT: ITALIA SEGRETA
-
IntroductionTravel into
Italy. Travel for Italy.
30 years after the “Viaggio in Italia” by Luigi Ghirri, the peninsula is lacerated for the
consequences of a deep crisis arrived from above. What Italy has become today?
The world is getting used to an image of our country decadent and compassionate and
the economic and political spheres still do not look at the reality of the
country. A country that for its historical,
geographical and human resources could live luxuriantly with a clean, clever and curious tourism. My experience of life outside the Italian borders has
matured gradually a critical and angry spirit at the same time of the “Bel
Paese” for the waste of resources and opportunities.
The last
job assigned to me from the Berlin’s Magazine ST.ART was the “A” that was missing. They
asked me to talk about my roots, what I feel as strong and true with my land.
In the editorial drafts I found a picture of the Coliseum. There started the
reflection that has stretched the way for the creation of a work inspired by
the history and nature of a symbolic place of my story but that surprisingly
fits on the story of Italy. The lake of Turano, the birthplace of my paternal
grandmother, was the symbol of an Italy submerged, from which sprout, views
from the world, only the top of the tower of Pisa, some arc of the Coliseum,
the Mole of Turin.
Coming back
home, this time for 10 days, to increase the material for Thurania project I
went back on the shores of Lake Turano and I realized before I take photographs
what could be the reaction of my colleagues on my return to the studio to see
those landscapes. As predict it was. That places were only not famous, not noble,
not tourist destinations places, there were just some of the thousands wonders of our
country, and like almost of these places, the axe of depression breaking on
people's dreams devasting them.                                                           (Valentino Griscioli) www.valentinogriscioli.com
What we can
do now is to show the world the wonders of Italy from north to south, traveling
on a camper-media-studio on secondary roads, meeting this Secret Italy,
photographing it, telling it with interviews, photographs and films. Spread it around
the world through a daily blog during the trip and creating a Visual Atlas of
Italy (digital and paper in 3 languages) to be edited at the end of the trip. What we want is
to create a trail of contacts, people and places for a possible recovery to the
crisis and as incentive for the eco-tourism. That will be a big media event and
a reference point for the exploration of our country for the rest of world.
- What
drives us to travel?
Living
outside Italy for 4 years we have developed a vision of the country with more
objective eyes and even a little of nostalgia. Now we see to Italy as abandoned
and undeveloped in comparison with countries with whom we came in contact more,
France and Germany in particular. Our main purpose is the revaluation of the territory,
we know what the rest of the world thinks and knows of Italy, it is not
necessary to say more about the Colosseum or the Tower of Pisa, but we realized
the potential of the rest of the Italian territory, beautiful forgotten, unknown
to the world.
-The idea
Journey
from the extreme north to the extreme south of Italy avoiding all major cities
and most noble goals to create a Visual Atlas of Italy, unusual, hidden, but
real, close to our vision of life : civil, fair, legal, zero impact. The path will be
marked by a free sense of traveling and based on the meetings, the places, the people
that will take on the path.
As the
story goes forward we will build a database of all the "big wave” of
contacts of people and companies that we will meet along the way and that will
be one of the engines of the blog www.italiasegreta.com that in partnership
with our media partner promote responsible tourism and cultural heritage in
Italy in the most disadvantaged and almost always forgotten places.
At the end
of the trip we will publish a photo book guide in three languages ​​(English and
German, Italian), a large Visual Atlas of Italy , with names , addresses and
specialties , accompanied by our interviews and extracts from the documentary
that will edit the end of the journey.The blog
will remain online but the site will become a support for the app  "Italia Segreta"
that will act as a bridge with all the contacts recorded during
the trip and will provide access to the database to be
consulted and for reservations.
The app
will work with an interactive map to discover all the places around the current
position with previews of photos and small videos or interviews with the
possibility of booking products and services directly from various companies
online.Where is your money going?We established a budget for 1000 printed copies of the book:You can pre-order your copy of the book at the special price of $129 / €94 during this 2 months of crowd funding campaign (the final cover price will be €120) saving €26.If you want to become a technical sponsor of the project please email us at: hello@italiasegreta.comFAQShipping:-Is the shipping included in the price of the Book?A: The shipping is included for the EU zone, for the international shipping please add the €20 perk.-I bought the book but forget to buy/can't pay for the international shipping perk, how can I solve that?A: Don't worry about that, after the crowd-funding campaign is over we will contact back all our supporters and we can arrange for a solution.-I subscribed for a 10 pack can I change the shipping address and what about international shipping?A: Sure! After the crowd-funding campaign is over we will contact back all our supporters before shipping and you can at every time change before we ship the pack. For the 10 pack the shipping is included all over the world.-I wrote you about the "cicerone" tour in my area but I still haven't an answer, is there some problem? A: Sorry my friend, we try to answer all the email and other messages in 24/48h but this days of crowd-funding campaign are really intense! If you don't receive an answer in 48h feel free to write again, maybe something goes wrong with the net.  Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
Share on the Media and Social Media www.italiasegreta.com

Organize a "Cicerone" tour in your area.
Video messageITALIA SEGRETA
is a project of traveling through Italy searching the most beautiful and
unknown places, the most interesting stories, the local realities and the
excellence of the territory.
The idea
comes from our way of life: we live and work in Berlin for 4 years while
remaining deeply connected to our homeland.
This new
life has opened up a new perspective with which to look at our country and we
realized how much the knowledge of Italy abroad is limited to the usual and famous
destination like Rome, Venice and Florence.
From all
that was born the idea of showing the world the “Secret Italy” the one of the amazing
landscapes, unknown villages and culinary  and artisanal excellence.
We decided
to tackle this trip knowing that we will encounter a country affected by a deep
economic and social crisis and we want this journey to be a springboard to
relaunch a conscious, cultural and clean tourism.
The trip
itself does not have a set route but only a starting point and a destination:
the two extremes commons of Italy. From Predoi to Lampedusa we will proceed
guided by the case, the flow of events , the stories, the experiences and
encounters that will make along the way.
We established a budget to cover to cover the costs of a 12-16 months travel, the setting up of a mobile
media studio inside a car camper  and for
printing the book "Italia
Segreta" Italy Visual Atlas.
With your
contribution you can buy one or more copies of a hard cover book version in high quality photographic edition or in digital format or you can finance part of the project directly  becoming a sponsor or a media partner of “Italia Segreta” project .
During the
journey we will compile a logbook on the blog www.italiasegreta.com where previews of photos of the beautiful Italian landscapes will be shown and the
interviews and stories of our adventures and encounters will be published.
All
material collected will be processed at the end of the journey in order to create a
documentary film about our experiences.We will also develop an interactive app that will allow you
to instantly have access to the large database of contents: places, stories,
accommodation, artisans, farms, restaurants, small excellence businesses, Km 0
producers, places of culinary traditions will be simply and quickly accessible directly on your mobile device.PERKS LIST:_____________________ITALIANO

Valentino Griscioli | Photographer, DoP
Chiara Sestili | ChefITALIA SEGRETA è un viaggio fotografico attraverso l'Italia
delle eccellenze, che incontrerà sulla via i luoghi più affascinanti e da
mostrare al mondo, per creare una rete di turismo culturale, consapevole,
pulito.
Partenza da Predoi e arrivo a Lampedusa. Il percorso non
pianificato sarà il frutto delle esperienze, del flusso degli eventi, delle
storie e degli incontri che faremo lungo il cammino.
Pubblicazione giornaliera di foto, video e storie, su un
blog dedicato www.italiasegreta.com
Compilazione progressiva di un Atlante Visuale d’Italia e di
un ebook multimediale con foto, storie e link-media in tre lingue (Italiano,
Inglese e Tedesco).
Spostamenti su un camper-media-studio tra le diverse realtà
che incontreremo, flessibilitá di movimento generata dagli eventi e dagli
incontri già programmati. Possibilitá di organizzazione in loco tramite persone
guida (ciceroni) esperte della storia, delle tradizioni e delle eccellenze
umane e paesaggistiche locali. Contattare ciceroni@italiasegreta.com per
prenotazioni.
Partenza da Predoi (BZ) agosto 2014
Arrivo a Lampedusa (AG) settembre 2015
Data prevista di uscita del volume Dicembre 2015

story:
Awareness Europe Presented by Asia Broadcast Satellite (ABS) 

- Simply put Awareness Europe exists as a means to raise funds and awareness for people with disabilities in Europe, while honoring children living with disabilities here in the United States. 

Awareness Europe Is:
• A 1,000 mile cycling event beginning in Glasgow, UK and ending in The Hague, NL. 
• Raising funds and awareness on behalf of people with disabilities. Our goal is to collectively raise at least $5,000. 
• Riding on behalf of the children who attend KinderFrogs. KinderFrogs is an early education school at TCU for children living with disabilities. All five members of Awareness Europe volunteer at the school regularly.
• An opportunity to learn more ways to honor and serve people with disabilities around the world.
• Reaching five different countries and spending time in over 15 cities. 
• Enhancing leadership opportunities for the participants by traveling abroad and giving back to their communities.
• A team of 3 cyclists, 1 crew, and 4 administrative men of Pi Kappa Phi’s from Texas Christian University and The University of Iowa
• A new way to honor people with disabilities in Europe.

Perks:

Our perks will allow you to be a part of the Awareness Europe Team. Depending on the level you choose, you can have your corporate logo (or name) on our social media pages, team t-shirt, team cycling jersey, and our event brochures. You may also have the opportunity to have more interaction with the team. Please contact the Awareness Europe team at awarenesseurope@gmail.com for more information.  

Donate:

To donate, please click on "Contribute Now". You can still donate without choosing a perk, and please keep in mind that any and every donation amount is greatly appreciated. For more information on our perks, please read below. As a reminder, your funds will go directly to enhancing the lives of people living with disabilities.

 

More Information

Awareness Europe is a Push America Challenge supported by Push America. Founded in 1977, Push America is a national nonprofit organization that enhances the lives of people with disabilities through educational programs, awareness raising events, and donations of specially designed equipment and recreational environments. For more information on Journey of Hope and Push America please visitwww.pushamerica.org.
story_txt:
Awareness Europe Presented by Asia Broadcast Satellite (ABS) 


- Simply put Awareness Europe exists as a means to raise funds and awareness for people with disabilities in Europe, while honoring children living with disabilities here in the United States. 
Awareness Europe Is:• A 1,000 mile cycling event beginning in Glasgow, UK and ending in The Hague, NL. • Raising funds and awareness on behalf of people with disabilities. Our goal is to collectively raise at least $5,000. • Riding on behalf of the children who attend KinderFrogs. KinderFrogs is an early education school at TCU for children living with disabilities. All five members of Awareness Europe volunteer at the school regularly.• An opportunity to learn more ways to honor and serve people with disabilities around the world.• Reaching five different countries and spending time in over 15 cities. • Enhancing leadership opportunities for the participants by traveling abroad and giving back to their communities.• A team of 3 cyclists, 1 crew, and 4 administrative men of Pi Kappa Phi’s from Texas Christian University and The University of Iowa• A new way to honor people with disabilities in Europe.
Perks:
Our perks will allow you to be a part of the Awareness Europe Team. Depending on the level you choose, you can have your corporate logo (or name) on our social media pages, team t-shirt, team cycling jersey, and our event brochures. You may also have the opportunity to have more interaction with the team. Please contact the Awareness Europe team at awarenesseurope@gmail.com for more information.  
Donate:

For more information on our perks, please read below. As a reminder, your funds will go directly to enhancing the lives of people living with disabilities.

Founded in 1977, Push America is a national nonprofit organization that enhances the lives of people with disabilities through educational programs, awareness raising events, and donations of specially designed equipment and recreational environments. For more information on Journey of Hope and Push America please visitwww.pushamerica.org.

story:
PATENTED TECHNOLOGY

Rouven (bufo) Brauers has been developing and engineering Skate- und Surfbaords since 25 years. He is the inventor of our new green composite technology, named HARDCORK®. By mixing cork with fibres and matrix in a very special way, he succeed in creating a cork fabric composite which is ultra sturdy and is spectacularly strong. The process retains all the positive properties of cork, like its lightness, smoothness, durability, damping and absorbing properties. That‘s really revolutionary! The perfect core material for boardsport applications is formed. 

After three years of prototyping, intensive testing and optimization, we‘re glad to present to you  the best performing decks you have ever skated.

TESTDRIVE
If you are interested in a test drive or individual advice from Rouven (bufo) Brauers, you‘re welcome to visit us in 30453 Hannover, Fössestraße 103 (Platzprojekt)


 

HARD TO BEAT

STRONG & DURABLE
Our decks are incredibly strong and durable. The lifespan is at least four times longer than that of other skatedecks and they features an integrated high density tail and nose protector.

LIGHTER
The composite material also makes HARDCORK® decks up to 40% lighter. The board is more responsive and reacts to you directly.

POP & ELASTICITY
With HARDCORK® you’ll reach the next level of skating! It has incredible pop and flex. You can jump higher and ride smoother. The elasticity of the cork absorbs shockwaves on uneven surfaces.

WATERPROOF
Our decks are 100% waterproof. They keep their properties for a lifetime and don’t soften up like other conventional wooden decks. (except our parkboard Peter, he‘s a hybrid)

UNIQUE LOOK
The cork and noble wooden surfaces give the boards  with a unique look.
»Corkgrip« is our special grippy cork surface. It performs like griptape, but is softer. It doesn’t damage your clothes while you are carrying it and allows you to skate barefoot. You can easily cover it with classical griptape if you want. Every aspect of Our boards is customisable, allowing each board to have it own unique look.

ECOLOGICAL
HARDCORK® decks are extremely ecological. 75% of the material used is regrowing. Our whole production process is solvent free and we only use eco-friendly organic resin.


 

PETER, FATBOY, TC, HANS & THE ANGLER

You have the choice between five innovative bufo® shapes.
The boards are engineered, designed and manufactured in Germany.
 

PETER POPSICLE hybrid

Peter provides the well-known skate feeling with improved properties. We’ve replaced half of the wood with a HARCORK® core layer. This gives the board more pop, makes it lighter and more responsive.

Shape: Popsicle, medium concave
Surface: maple wood  •  Core: HARCORK®

Style: Park-/Streetboard  •  Length: 32“  •  Width: 8.6“  •  Wheelbase: 13,5“

FATBOY

Fatboy is the perfect Mini Cruiser with great ollie ability. He is a real allrounder and also feels good in pools. He comes with a 14.5” wheelbase and a tight turning radius. The deck is 9,5” wide but thanks to the HARDCORK® construction still very light with great pop.

Shape: Wide with medium concave, modern tailkick
Surface bottom: »Slickcork«, our excellent gliding surface with a glossy cork look
Surface top: »Corkgrip«; our special grippy cork surface.
Corkgrip performs like griptape, but is softer. It saves your clothes while carrying and allows you to skate barefoot. You can easily cover it with classical griptape, if you want. 

Style: Mini Cruiser  •  Length: 29.75“  •  Width: 9.5“  •  Wheelbase: 14.5“

TC Mini Cruiser

The TC Mini Cruiser offers a wide range of usage. She is excellent for cruising and produces great ollie performance. The longer wheelbase gives that extra bit of control at higher speeds and due to added clearance under the wheels you can really lay it on the edge.

Shape: Late 70ties outline, combined with a modern deck concave and kicktail
Surface bottom: Apple veneer, natural oiled
Surface top: »Corkgrip«, our special grippy cork surface.
Corkgrip performs like griptape, but is softer. It saves your clothes while carrying and allows you to skate barefoot. You can easily cover it with classical griptape, if you want. 

Style: Mini Cruiser  •  Length: 30“  •  Width: 8,5“  •  Wheelbase: 14.75“

HANS DAMPF (Gingerbread)

Hans Dampf is designed to offer the control and stability of a longboard in a short, compact package, while staying agile and lively in his manoeuvring. Due to four different truck set up options, he is very versatile and can be tuned to different styles and speeds.

The center of the board is 0.4” lowered down for comfortable and effective pushing. He has no kick tail to offer a longer platform for carving.

Shape: Medium concave, light bowl tail
Surface bottom: »Slickcork«, our excellent gliding surface with a glossy cork look
Surface top: Dark »Corkgrip«; our special grippy cork surface.
Corkgrip performs like griptape, but is softer. It saves your clothes while carrying and allows you to skate barefoot. You can easily cover it with classical griptape, if you want. 

Style: Short Longboard  •  Length: 32,5“  •  Width: 8,85“  •  Wheelbase: 21.5“ – 23.5“

THE ANGLER

The Anlger is lowered down to about 0.4” which makes him more effective when pushing and locks your feet well while bombing down steep hills. His concave increases on the outside rails for improved hold in critical slides. His bowl shaped tail can‘t normally be built in the traditional way, but thanks to the drapeability of our new composite material, he has become real!

The Angler is also suitable for simply cruising around and many surfers love it because they can keep a wider stance on the board. He comes with our longest wheelbase of 25.5“ - adjustable to 26.5“ and 27.5“.

Shape: Bullit outline, lowered center, mushroom bowl tail
Surface bottom: »Slickcork«, our excellent gliding surface with a glossy cork look
Surface top: Dark »Corkgrip«; our special grippy cork surface.
Corkgrip performs like griptape, but is softer. It saves your clothes while carrying and allows you to skate barefoot. You can easily cover it with classical griptape, if you want. 

Style: Longboard  •  Length: 36“  •  Width: 9.5“  •  Wheelbase: 25.5“ – 27.5“


SKATE EXPERIENCE

Our boards have been tested extensively since the first prototype was developed. Our test pilots are life long skaters around and our series production models are already very popular locally.




SKATER FEEDBACK
from our testpilot Mike at Rouven (bufo) Brauers about the HARDCORK protoype

Mike: It’s a nice board. Isn’t it.

bufo: Nice board.

Mike: Nice board.

bufo: So what I did, I narrowed the outline by 4mm compared to the first board. And you also have a core made out of cork and flax fabric which gives the board more damping. You probably noticed that the board has a different pop compared to the other board you just skated. 

Mike: Hmm, There’s different effect for sure. It definitely feels much lighter. 

bufo: Were the ollies higher on this board, or was the other one better?

Mike: The ollies were definitely higher. The board has much more pop. You get the feeling that the board is attached to your feet and you don’t need to pull it up.

bufo: What this core effectively does is very important for the park skater. Because of the high amount of flex fabric in the core it makes the board very stiff, and, amongst other things, extremely torsion resistant. As a result, the board reacts much directer in its power transmission

Mike: Thats amazing, incredible. Especially when you push through in the ramps. When you push in the corners l, you gain a lot of speed, because you usually push pretty hard into the ramps with the board. At some point you have the feeling you’re going to lose control. I didn’t have it with that board.

bufo: Yes, that’s down to the torsional strength of the board, which really makes the difference. And , in comparison to other boards, you’ll notice that this board is extremely stiff  although, actually lengthwise, its flex is relatively normal.



IT‘S ALL ABOUT CORK



SKATESISTER'S QUESTIONS
from lokals Julia and Debby at Rouven (bufo) Brauers about the HARDCORK® Skateboards

Julia: How did you come up with the idea of building such boards?

bufo: Originally I was looking for better cushioning properties in surfboards and in particular for skateboards. Skateboarding provides a great example of having to deal with insane vibrations. Especially when you’re on small wheels.The cork is helping to smooth that issue out greatly. 

Debby: What exactly are they made of? What’s this in the middle here? 

bufo: The inner core is a 3 dimensional compound made from a mix of granulated cork and flax fabric. As a result, a 3D structure is formed which works very efficiently. You may have seen it for example on a  construction crane where you always have those 45° degree crossing poles in the middle. This leads not only to an extremely high shear strength, but also to an extremely high fracture strength   

Debby: But it's already a cork plate that you coat?

bufo: No, we mix the core ourself. We’ve built our own core press with which we press the granulated cork and the flax fibre into a mould. The mould was produced by a 3D printer. It’s a bit like baking a cake, but with 10 tones of material.  That’s how we make the 3D compound. 

The second step of the procedure is to laminate the board from the top and the bottom. This gives the  board its strength. So now the boards have a core as well as a top and bottom layer. This is known as a sandwich construction, and is how the stiffness is created. And, as you can hear, a great damping. 

Debby: How many different models are there already? 

bufo: In total there are 13 or 14 boards. From those we have 5 favourites which have already received very good feedback. And those are the ones we want to put onto the market. 

Julia: And you do that where?

bufo: We do that on the »Platzprojekt«, next to the 2er skate park. We have 3 containers there.

Debby: How long have you been doing this?

bufo: I have been building surfboards and skateboards for almost 30 years now. It all started  when I was a child. I couldn't get a surfboard at that time because,  as a 9 year old, I was much lighter than most adults. And most of all I wanted to have a shortboard. That wasn't so easy and especially not for my height. That's why I started to build boards by myself - in all variations. And I haven’t stopped since.

Debby: And was the cork board your own creation? Or have they been around for a while?  

bufo: The idea to make skateboards using a cork core isn’t new. What’s really new here though is the fact that the cork we use is so shear resistant and that we can make an extremely fracture-proof board which is much more fracture resistant than wood boards. . You’d definitely have to make the core very thick in order to make it work. And that’s not a good idea for a skateboard. You’d stand much too high and still wouldn’t have a lot of clearance on the wheels.That’s why a thin board always feels much nicer, unless it bangs on your shin. HAHA 

Julia: ith the Cruiser you can gather momentum really easily without pushing.That was really cool. I think I just saw you do it. How does that work? 

bufo: You mean generating speed using the energy of the curve. Our skateboards have a three axis construction in the laminate. One axis runs lengthwise ensuring the board doesn’t break.  Your everyday skateboard has a cross direction.Instead we have  two 45° degree crossing constructions. And, if you look at the board in more detail, and really twist the board, that’s to say bend the sides in opposite directions, you’ll notice that the board is much more torsionally rigid is than a normal board made from wood. That helps a  great deal to convert turn-impulses on the skateboard. That’s fantastic for when you’re in the skatepark, or even when you’re on the street, because you can generate speed through the curves.



TALK ABOUT THE WATER RESISTANCE OF CORK
with Rouven (bufo) Brauers, Rene and Mascha

Rene: It’s amazing that the board is totally waterproof. The bearings could still be an issue though. 

bufo: You could use ceramic bearings. Personally, I put a drop of oil on the standard bearings. But really only a drop. I’ve been doing that since I was a kid. 

Rene: Penetrating oil absorbs moisture. Of course, that makes sense. I’ll have to try that out.

bufo: My bearings are about 7 years old. I hardly ever ride a bike. I prefer my skateboard, it’s much more enjoyable. You can drink beer and have your hands free if you have to make a call. Simply much more enjoyable. And you can do anything you want. You’re allowed to drink a beer and make a call at the same time. 

This one here was really filthy. I’ll just take it to the sink and clean it with a brush. There you go, all clean again.

Mascha: But I thought the cork would dissolve. 

bufo: No, people know that from wine cork. They sometimes fish bottles from the Baltic Sea which have been down there for 400 years or so.They still have the corks. And the rum or whatever is in there is still in the bottle. In terms of its water resistance, cork is an unbelievably cool material. 

 



BUFO TECHNOLOGY

HARDCORK® is a registered trademark of the bufo technology UG.
Our manufacture is in Germany, Hannover at the »Platzprojekt«, next to the 2er skatepark.

We founded in April 2018. Rouven (bufo) Brauers invented HARDCORK® and has already won the Hannover Implus »Going Global« award.

In addition to skateboards, we also build surfboards with our new HARDCORK® technology.

Be a part of our green composite revolution and support us to expand from a small scale production to a large scale manufacturer. Let‘s do it!



THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT! 

DISCLAIMER

All of the prototypes shown in the photos and video are fully functional and tested, but details shown may change in the final product development and manufacturing.

RISKS

We at HARDCORK, with employees, families and friends support, have been developing board sport products for over a decade. After years of testing and sourcing, reliable manufacturing processes have been finalized. We have come to INDIEGOGO at the last stages of our product's launch which is almost ready.

We have proven our capabilities getting to this stage and beyond through a track record of manufacturing, marketing and selling other board sport products. Our products have been recognized by the industry with design awards. 

With that said, every new product launch has risks and challenges. Some of the challenges we face will include up-scaling production from prototyping into full production capabilities. We have put together a plan to do this which we feel is realistic and attainable. In addition, we have already secured sources for our raw materials and have been in constant contact with these suppliers about of needs which we feel they can fulfil. However, there are always a risks/challenges we must overcome.

The risks have also been minimized by the extensive prototyping and testing we have done. One risk is not being able to acquire raw materials in a timely manner to build the moulding and products themselves, but we feel this is a low risk.

Backers will be kept informed on the stages of development and when we will ship their boards.

Rene: It’s amazing that the board is totally waterproof. The bearings could still be an issue though. 
bufo: You could use ceramic bearings. Personally, I put a drop of oil on the standard bearings. But really only a drop. I’ve been doing that since I was a kid. 
Rene: Penetrating oil absorbs moisture. Of course, that makes sense. I’ll have to try that out.
bufo: My bearings are about 7 years old. I hardly ever ride a bike. I prefer my skateboard, it’s much more enjoyable. You can drink beer and have your hands free if you have to make a call. Simply much more enjoyable. And you can do anything you want. You’re allowed to drink a beer and make a call at the same time. 
This one here was really filthy. I’ll just take it to the sink and clean it with a brush. There you go, all clean again.
Mascha: But I thought the cork would dissolve. 
bufo: No, people know that from wine cork. They sometimes fish bottles from the Baltic Sea which have been down there for 400 years or so.They still have the corks. And the rum or whatever is in there is still in the bottle. In terms of its water resistance, cork is an unbelievably cool material. 




 

BUFO TECHNOLOGY


HARDCORK® is a registered trademark of the bufo technology UG.Our manufacture is in Germany, Hannover at the »Platzprojekt«, next to the 2er skatepark.
We founded in April 2018. Rouven (bufo) Brauers invented HARDCORK® and has already won the Hannover Implus »Going Global« award.
In addition to skateboards, we also build surfboards with our new HARDCORK® technology.
Be a part of our green composite revolution and support us to expand from a small scale production to a large scale manufacturer. Let‘s do it!

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT! 

DISCLAIMERAll of the prototypes shown in the photos and video are fully functional and tested, but details shown may change in the final product development and manufacturing.RISKSWe at HARDCORK, with employees, families and friends support, have been developing board sport products for over a decade. After years of testing and sourcing, reliable manufacturing processes have been finalized. We have come to INDIEGOGO at the last stages of our product's launch which is almost ready.We have proven our capabilities getting to this stage and beyond through a track record of manufacturing, marketing and selling other board sport products. Our products have been recognized by the industry with design awards. With that said, every new product launch has risks and challenges. Some of the challenges we face will include up-scaling production from prototyping into full production capabilities. We have put together a plan to do this which we feel is realistic and attainable. In addition, we have already secured sources for our raw materials and have been in constant contact with these suppliers about of needs which we feel they can fulfil. However, there are always a risks/challenges we must overcome.The risks have also been minimized by the extensive prototyping and testing we have done. One risk is not being able to acquire raw materials in a timely manner to build the moulding and products themselves, but we feel this is a low risk.Backers will be kept informed on the stages of development and when we will ship their boards.

story:
The first on-the-go insulated mug with an authentic, cup-like sipping experience that's truly easy to clean.  

Instead of a lid that goes on top, the lttl tumbler's stopper fits down inside so you can drink directly from the edge of the vessel - just like a normal cup. Sip naturally from any side, 360˚ around. The patent-pending stopper regulates flow for the perfect sip without splashes or overflow. All-around aroma venting allows full-sensory enjoyment of your favorite brew.

The lttl tumbler has been designed from the ground up for super easy cleaning. The lttl tumbler’s stopper is a single seamless part - there's no hidden crevices, no disassembly required, nowhere for gunk to hide! Down below, the vessel has a wide opening to easily fit a sponge or brush. The vessel's microscopically-slick electropolished interior resists stains and odors. When it's this easy to keep clean, your drink will always taste the way it should.

With a twist of your fingers the stopper seals tight, securely recessed inside the vessel. The single silicone gasket creates a reliable leakproof seal so you can conveniently carry the lttl tumbler in a bag or purse without worrying about messy spills and stains.

The vacuum insulated double-wall construction keeps hot beverages toasty for over 4 hours, staying cool and comfortable to the touch. Iced drinks stay cold all day with no messy condensation on the outside. The lttl tumbler will keep any beverage hot or cold for hours, so you can fill it with 16 ounces of any beverage you like: coffee, tea, iced and carbonated drinks, or a lttl beer or wine. 

The lttl tumbler has durable components and finishes so it can go on the top rack of your dishwasher. It's entirely BPA and BPS free, and there are absolutely no coatings, paint, or lining inside the vessel.

The lttl tumbler is launching in five colors: brushed stainless, matte black, soft lavender, pale rose gold, and malachite. Brushed stainless, matte black, and malachite tumblers come with a black stopper, while soft lavender and pale rose gold tumblers come with a white stopper. 

In the past 15 years, Matt and Gaz have helped dozens of clients bring hundreds of products to market. We've been down a similar road before, and we're well prepared to do it on our own this time.

The risks and potential challenges to this project have been minimized as much as possible in advance. We've been working with our factory's engineers to productionize the design. The overseas manufacturing partner we've engaged for this project is a trusted colleague that we've worked with for over a decade. The engineering, manufacturing, quality control and distribution plans are already in place.  All that's left is to garner the support of the Indiegogo community so we can pay for the molds and tools necessary to start mass production.

We pledge to actively deal with any challenges in a timely and professionally manner, and to be transparent and accurate as we keep you informed. We're excited to update our community regularly as we reach our production milestones.

Thanks in advance for your generous support. Every lttl bit helps!

story:
Travel should be full of fun, you don’t want to be worried about how to charge all the devices during your travel. There should be at least 3 things you need: the USB charger for multiple devices, travel adapter for power outlets, and power adapter for your laptop, which one do you prefer to take？Or both?

 

 

No, you only need one! Introducing Lukia, the best global travel adapter. This all-in-one adapter allows you to charge up to 3 devices together, and it supports worldwide universal 100-240V voltage and comes with USA/UK/EU pin converters so that it can be used in over 200 countries.

 

With all the research, we found the best way to advance the plug to another level. Now, the Lukia adapter supports worldwide universal 100-240V voltage and comes with USA/UK/EU pin converters that covered up to 200 countries, without any need for the additional converter plug.

 

 Leave all your adapters at home and use only one to charge your MacBook Pro, iPad Pro, phone, tablet and other devices. Lukia GaN adapter can quickly charge your usb-c MacBook Pro and up to three devices: 2 Type-C and 1 USB ports with a 65W maximum output, Lukia charges virtually all USB devices—simultaneously.

 

 

Lukia adopts the latest Gallium Nitride（GaN）technology. This new Gallium Nitride semiconductor material allows for power devices to operate higher voltages and switching frequency which results in smaller and more efficient chargers. 

 

 

Beside the speed, people are also in the pursuit of size. 30% Smaller than the normal charger. it's almost as small as an AirPods, fits comfortably your casual bag or suitcase. When you put it in your pocket, you’ll realize how little space it takes up.

 

 
 

Lukia has four powerful USB output ports, including two Type-C output and one USB outputs. It takes advantage to deliver 65W of charging power so that the power delivery will supplies at least 3 times faster than an ordinary charger and provide more power to charge tablets and laptops quicker. 

 

 

Lukia can intelligently determines how much power to feed to each device attached. It’s capable of providing a total of 65W to all devices plugged into it.

 

If only one device is plugged in, that device can use the entire 65W power. If more than one device is plugged in, the 65W will be intelligently split among the devices, to ensure all of can be charged as fast as possible.

 

 

We have to make sure every detail of Lukia to ensure it’s safety. The multi-protect safety system provides complete protection for your devices.

 

 Lukia’s removable plug can easily push & lock and recharge with different plugs. Those four plugs are everything you need in almost every country in the world!

story:
Solos takes the world's smallest heads-up display and pairs it with best in class performance tracking, precision training tools, and tons of every day useful features. Whether you bike to work, you're a weekend warrior, or professional athlete, Solos is perfect for you.      

With a super slim display and packed full of features, here’s what you can expect:   

 

 

Solos takes all the power of your bike computer and Smartphone to give you incredibly useful data about your bike ride.

 

 

"Solos ... makes it easier to see how your ride's going in the moment and analyze your performance stats and GPS directions. The text on this 4mm display looks easy-to-read without getting in the way" - Men's Journal   

"Putting that data stream in your peripheral vision lets you stay on top of it without looking down at a computer....The result is Vista, which is about one quarter the size of anything else out there". - Bike Rumor 

"One of our favorite products from Media Night was the new Kopin Solos smart glass display." - Aero Geeks

"if you're serious about your bike then Solos might be a good entry point into next-gen wearable tech." - SlashGear

Solos is a proud sponsor of Team USA Cycling for the Rio Games in 2016. They've been biking with Solos for months now and we know you'll love it as much as they do.    

 

“We worked in conjunction with the Solos team from the ground up to develop a wearable technology that could be a game changer in the industry and have a great impact across the board.”  - Andy Sparks, Director of Track Cycling Programs USA Cycling    

"This is definitely a tool to help you improve bike performance" – Sarah Hammer, Two Time Olympic Silver Medalist, US Olympic Team Member 2016

"It’s cool to have a dual purpose glasses and power meter all at once" - Ruth Winder, US Olympic Team Member 2016

"Without the access to this data and this technology we would not be where we are today. So a big thank you to Solos for supporting Team USA on our way to Rio" - Kelly Catlin, 2016 World Champion, US Olympic Team Member 2016

"It’s just super awesome" – Chloe Dygert, 2016 World Champion, US Olympic Team Member 2016

Everything about Solos is designed to make you a higher performing, more finely tuned rider. More than a bike computer, Solos isn't just for the hard core cyclist,  our fresh design and helpful features are made for anyone who loves to ride.     

 

We didn’t load all the heavy lifting of Solos into the headset itself, we leverage the computing power of your smartphone along with our full service FREE app to make Solos an unparalleled experience.     

 

 

 

 

Not only are the Solos Eyewear products beautifully designed, they're also highly aerodynamic to increase performance.     

 

 

 

We are selling the "Black Lens/Black Frame" version of Solos on Indiegogo (as shown below). But we might announce additional colorways as a stretch goal, more info on that to come.    

 

Be a part of the Solos team and add a Solos Jersey to any order by simply adding $99 to your pledge! Welcome to the team!   

 

 

A little about us:    

 

  • Product Dimensions: 161 mm W x 181 mm L (6.3" X 7.1")
  • Product Weight: 65 grams (2.3 oz)
  • Vista Pupil Display Dimensions: 45.04 mm (L) × 12.1 mm (W) × 5.78 mm (1.7" x .47" x .22")
  • Display Resolution - WQVGA 16x9 Widescreen LCD
  • Display Size In Field of Vision: 10.68⁰
  • Battery Type: Lithium Ion
  • Battery Life: 6 hrs
  • Device Compatibility: iOS and Android
  • Warranty: 1 Year
  •     

We are working with the best shipping methods to make sure you will receive your product in good condition at the lowest cost. We will work to make sure our shipping costs are as low as possible.    

INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING

We are working hard to open up Solos to international backers as well! If you live outside of North America, UK, or the EU and you are interested in getting Solos, please email us at kickstarter@solos-wearables.com so we can add you to our list and keep you up to date on International Shipping capabilities. Thanks!

 

 

We've spent several years working with our top team of scientists, designers, and engineers to build the best, thinnest, most feature rich cycling wearable in the market today. We're so excited that our journey has taken us here  to share with your our product. Below you can find some images and videos of our development to date.
