story:
You may be thinking about things the wrong way.

Everyday, we are hit from all directions by thousands of messages.  Not just news media, but everywhere from almost every source.
 
It screws up how you think.  More to the point, how you THINK you think.
 
So, you were raised in a ******** home.  That means you have to be a *******, right?
 
You can't change your DNA.  Well, at least not yet.  But if you were raised in a home with certain values, you probably DID absorb those same values.  Are you sure?
 
In this book, we will focus on ways to re-evaluate yourself.  This is not a psychology book.  We only focus on ways to help you be a better, more informed citizen.
 

"Convinced that the people are the only safe depositories of their own liberty, and that they are not safe unless enlightened to a certain degree, I have looked on our present state of liberty as a short-lived possession unless the mass of the people could be informed to a certain degree." Thomas Jefferson in a letter to Littleton Waller Tazewell, 1805.


The idea for this book spawned from my experiences as a reporter and radio talk show host.  Too often, well intentioned people identified themselves by political party but then described how their party no longer supports their views.  Other times, I would interview protestors who did not understand exactly what they were protesting for or against.

The first part of the book will go over my views and HOW I developed them, the changes over the years and why those views and changes of view came to be.

The next section will go through the Constitution of the United States AND how to apply it.  I will, WE will be sharing experiences that we have had already AND a few new ones will be happening to CREATE the stories for this book.  There are 27 Amendments to the Constitution.  All 27 will be discussed and demonstrated.

The end will include some tips to cut through the opinions of OTHERS and get to your own.

The tools to fix this is within ourselves. With this book, I hope that we can together be that enlightened and informed mass of people that Thomas Jefferson knew that our Republic needs to survive.

story:
If you got directed here from www.infidelixgoesnomadic.com.. in order to donate you must do so through this link. www.indiegogo.com/infidelixgoesnomadic

Thank you

My name is Bryan Rodecker. During the day I wait tables at a tex mex restaurant and at night I focus my time and energy into pursuing my goals with music. This April I am packing a back loaded with my new album "Nomadic", a good book, and a camera or two and am setting off to Europe to travel around solely off the sales of my new album for 365 days. I want to show the person who is about to give up on their dreams that anything is possible. I want to show the independent artist that they can take their music to anyone, anywhere in the world and that the only thing holding them back is their own mind.


  • This trip is extremely important to me, as well as extremely important to all the people that I encounter along the way. From holding music workshops that will be covering conformance art, recording, and confidence with the youth at the centers, to encouraging an adult who has never read his poetry out loud to a group of people, I will encounter and motivate them all. 


  • Without your help this journey will not be possible.The amount of work and dedication that will be going into this is already at its peak. The only thing missing is the financial backing. The goal is to complete this journey using funds only off my album sales, however I know this is not a perfect world and I will be encountering my obstacles. That is what scares me the most, and what I am least prepared for. Your help will not only be the diffenitive motivating factor in my journey, it will allow the people who are about to connect with me to experience something they may never have had before. Someone coming from a different country, showing appreciation for them and their music, is a big deal to anyone. Lets help grow this movement together.


What We Need & What You Get

  • I am looking to raise minimum €6k. From transportation, lodging, emergency medical supplies, calling cards, back up equipment, survival essentials, and so much more, your money will be a blanket for when I need it most. Your funding will help me get to that youth center when its a rainy day outside and nobody wants to purchase my album..or when I roll my ankle in a country where nobody speaks English and I need to quickly handle the problem myself. Your support for this trip is critical and greatly appreciated. More than words could describe. 


  • With the release of the new album "Nomadic" we have put together some very exciting and interesting incentives so you can receive something for your generous donation. From the album, to members only blog access, to receiving post cards from the countries I visit, there is something for everyone. 


  • Along the journey, I will be filming the people I encounter, the places I end up at, and the struggles and triumphs I face along the way. My at home team will be working to edit and create one of the most heartfelt and motivational documentaries geared towards the independent artist that has ever been released to market. We plan on submitting the film to a variety of competitions as well as events involving the independent come up.


  • On top of filming a documentary, interviewing people, and showing the independent struggle and triumphs, I will be writing a book that will be published and available for sale upon my return. The book will be in depth look at my thoughts, feelings, and situations, both good and bad that I encounter along my journey.

The Impact


  • Your generous donations will not only keep me going with positivity, but it will bring a positive outlook to everyone I meet. I have been to other countries before, teaching the youth about performance, goal setting, music, and so much more and the smiles that I left with in my memories will never fade.
  • From working with the youth in Ireland last time I was there for two weeks, we accomplished so much. From developing a song with the boys ages 13-16, recording the track, and setting up a show to perform at, we accomplished those goals. The impact that was left with the two youth centers I did this at has been extraordinary.
  • If I didnt say I was scared  I would be lying. If I said accomplishing these goals will be easy, I would be lying. The point however is to achieve regardless the situations or circumstances. The goal is to show the world that as an independent artist I can do whatever I want with my music and my life.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, that does not mean you can't help.

  • From gift cards, to camping supplies, to the occasional facebook email, anything and everything that you can provide will keep me motivated on this journey.


  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and get this information into the hands of the people that are able to donate!

If you got directed here from www.infidelixgoesnomadic.com.. in order to donate you must do so through this link. www.indiegogo.com/infidelixgoesnomadic Thank youMy name is Bryan Rodecker. During the day I wait tables at a tex mex restaurant and at night I focus my time and energy into pursuing my goals with music. This April I am packing a back loaded with my new album "Nomadic", a good book, and a camera or two and am setting off to Europe to travel around solely off the sales of my new album for 365 days. I want to show the person who is about to give up on their dreams that anything is possible. I want to show the independent artist that they can take their music to anyone, anywhere in the world and that the only thing holding them back is their own mind. This trip is extremely important to me, as well as extremely important to all the people that I encounter along the way. From holding music workshops that will be covering conformance art, recording, and confidence with the youth at the centers, to encouraging an adult who has never read his poetry out loud to a group of people, I will encounter and motivate them all. Without your help this journey will not be possible.The amount of work and dedication that will be going into this is already at its peak. The only thing missing is the financial backing. The goal is to complete this journey using funds only off my album sales, however I know this is not a perfect world and I will be encountering my obstacles. That is what scares me the most, and what I am least prepared for. Your help will not only be the diffenitive motivating factor in my journey, it will allow the people who are about to connect with me to experience something they may never have had before. Someone coming from a different country, showing appreciation for them and their music, is a big deal to anyone. Lets help grow this movement together. 
What We Need & What You GetI am looking to raise minimum €6k. From transportation, lodging, emergency medical supplies, calling cards, back up equipment, survival essentials, and so much more, your money will be a blanket for when I need it most. Your funding will help me get to that youth center when its a rainy day outside and nobody wants to purchase my album..or when I roll my ankle in a country where nobody speaks English and I need to quickly handle the problem myself. Your support for this trip is critical and greatly appreciated. More than words could describe. With the release of the new album "Nomadic" we have put together some very exciting and interesting incentives so you can receive something for your generous donation. From the album, to members only blog access, to receiving post cards from the countries I visit, there is something for everyone. Along the journey, I will be filming the people I encounter, the places I end up at, and the struggles and triumphs I face along the way. My at home team will be working to edit and create one of the most heartfelt and motivational documentaries geared towards the independent artist that has ever been released to market. We plan on submitting the film to a variety of competitions as well as events involving the independent come up. 

On top of filming a documentary, interviewing people, and showing the independent struggle and triumphs, I will be writing a book that will be published and available for sale upon my return. The book will be in depth look at my thoughts, feelings, and situations, both good and bad that I encounter along my journey. 


The Impact
Your generous donations will not only keep me going with positivity, but it will bring a positive outlook to everyone I meet. I have been to other countries before, teaching the youth about performance, goal setting, music, and so much more and the smiles that I left with in my memories will never fade. 

From working with the youth in Ireland last time I was there for two weeks, we accomplished so much. From developing a song with the boys ages 13-16, recording the track, and setting up a show to perform at, we accomplished those goals. The impact that was left with the two youth centers I did this at has been extraordinary. 

If I didnt say I was scared  I would be lying. If I said accomplishing these goals will be easy, I would be lying. The point however is to achieve regardless the situations or circumstances. The goal is to show the world that as an independent artist I can do whatever I want with my music and my life. 

Other Ways You Can HelpIf you cannot contribute, that does not mean you can't help. From gift cards, to camping supplies, to the occasional facebook email, anything and everything that you can provide will keep me motivated on this journey. 
Use the Indiegogo share tools and get this information into the hands of the people that are able to donate!

story:
Wildcat Adventure Race (W.A.R.)

This summer 2013! The 9Lives Adventures team is proud to present another, Canadian first-ever inclusive, weekend event. Our skilled and seasoned adventure-cats have come together to create an endurance course that will change the life of many. The Wildcat Adventure Race (W.A.R.) is comprised of 9 scenario-based obstacles that will test our participant’s abilities, teamwork, strength, navigation and heart. Together they will break down these barriers, and fight for a charity or organization of their team choice.


This race is open to people of all abilities, not limited to: Amputees, wheelchair users, visual or hearing impairment.


What Makes This Race So Different?

90% of pre-existing adventure races support local charities/ organizations. The 9Lives W.A.R. not only allows each team to fight for their OWN charity of choice, we actually incorporate the “wounded warrior” into the race experience and change the social mentality one individual at a time. Inclusivity.

9Lives Credibility: Since 2010

www.9livesadventures.com

Canada's leading activists for disabled Action Sport: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vseXEMoOMBc
Named Canada's Difference Makers
Me to We: Social Action Award
Continental Who's Who for Excellence
Ambassadors for the Rick Hansen 25th Anniversary Relay and spread our vision speaking to thousands of youth across Canada-http://www.youtube.com/watch?
We created a Canadian first ever Adaptive Skate Competition (WCMX)- http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UAWg1cpXffI

*We have the experience, we just need your support

What We Are Raising $ For

  • New interactive website, with team/ charity fundraising platform
  • Event licensing and production dollars
  • Race Materials/ Obstacles

The Impact

  • A multiple-level benefit for everyone:
  1. The participant experience (disabled or not)
  2. The charity that the team is representing and fighting for
  3. The breakdown of segreggation when it comes to society's perspective on living a life with limitation
  4. Creating more outdoor sporting opportunities for people with limitation
  • Visually see where everyones hard-earned fundraising dollars are going
  • Add to ANOTHER Canadian-First event
  • Breaking down more social barriers

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • If you would like to volunteer, or assist this vision in any way, please feel free to connect. info@9livesadventures.com

story:
In the beginning, there was fire.

Then, someone invented the wheel to get things rolling.

This is my definition of evolving technology.

Unfortunately, technology gets bogged down with complacency.

This is my good fortune.

Fishing lures were created to duplicate live bait, and to save money on cost and availability of live bait.

Exposed hooks were added and away we went.  This was an  effective solution for catching fish, but ineffective for it's original premise.

All lures have exposed hooks, defeating the purpose of duplicating appearance of live bait, and saving money because lures snag on debris, and that requires replacement cost, and in some instances even medical attention.

The fishing industry became complacent simply because lures caught fish.

Why think outside the box when you own the box?

Marketing's approach is basic: Our lures catch fish, so why change!

After all, that's a good thing-if lures are lost via exposed hooks, "We can sell more lures".

The Bumper 1000 not only duplicates appearance, but by concealing the hooks within the body loss is significantly reduced.

Adding a unique trigger mechanism to the hook assembly tricks the fish into setting the hooks itself!

More effective, cost efficient, and safer. That's whatIcall marketing.

Global Sourcessays Fishing Licences generated 600,000,000 dollars in revenue for state wildlife and fishing agencies.

Fishing anglers spend  approximately 15.47 billion dollars on equipment worldwide per year*

The typical angler in the United States spends 76 dollars annually on fishing tackle alone.

Rapala is the premier plug lure manufacturer.

They produce 40-50,000,000 plug lures per year.

If you take a good look at their plug lures there are 12 steps for a finished product.

(1) Specially designed machines to trim and shape the plug.

(2) A wire running from the top pf the nose wrapped along the belly and up over the rear section.

(3) A circular loop at the nose to fasten the leader and line.

(4) Continuing to the belly where another loop is placed to fasten a ring and treble hook.

(5) Adding a lead weight to the wire at the belly loop for a ballast.

(6) Continue the wire to the rear of the plug and add another loop.

Then, repeat step (4).
Now you have completed the wire, loop, and ballast assembly.

(7) Press the entire assembly into the soft plug.

(8) Glue the assembly to the plug.

(9) Wait for the glue to dry.

(10) Wrap plug and wire assembly with plastic sheathing, or paint it.

(11) Secure exposed circular rings to belly and rear loops on wire assembly.

(12) Secure twotrouble hooksto belly and rear loop on wire assembly.

 We now have a Rapala plug lure after 12 steps.
Time consuming, inefficient, with no tail or dorsal fin. 
A painted plug with exposed treble hooks, (or exposedtroublehooks)

The Bumper 1000 will effectively reduce manufacturing cost, provide a lure that mimics the appearance of live bait and deliver the lure bait to the belly of the fish wen swallowed.
A unique and simple trigger system will deploy the hooks.
Cheaper to make, more effective, and thetrueweedless lure.

I have been invited to the Muskie Expo and Milwaukee Fishing show on  January 9th-11th in Chicago and on and February 13th-15th in Milwaukee. The winner of these expos is featured on the cover ofMuskie Hunter Magazine.

I would like your assistance in securing travel vouchers for both events.
I need a 3D copier, and have contacted a plastics manufacturing company to manufacture the molds.
I require funding to hire an engineer for product designs and also Marketing, Accounting and Legal Services

*http://www.statista.com/topics/1163/recreationa...

story:
How Bonvoy began

My name is Sean Jackson and I began Bonvoy to have the opportunity to teach people about the outdoors and introduce them to the adventure sports I'm so passionate about.

I made a decision to change my life and pursue what I love.  I began taking people on adventure vacations 2 years ago.  It started small with a handful of trips and as this venture has developed I've noticed the impact it can have on people's lives.  

My fellow travelers have experienced and accomplished feats they never thought possible.  Many have made changes in their own lives, quitting their jobs, moving across the country, and pursuing their own passions.  

Because I've seen what the impact our trips have on people I want to revolutionize the travel industry allowing more people to experience the outdoors in a way they never thought possible.

That's why we've created a flex pricing model allowing people to name their own price on trips.  I do what I do because I love it and I want to give others the opportunity to join me on these adventures.

Our charity work

Bonvoy currently works with and supports the efforts of Big City Mountaineers, an organization that transforms the lives of under-served urban youth through wilderness mentoring expeditions that instill critical life skills. They partner with community-based youth organizations and caring adult volunteers who act as mentors in the field to help young people realize their potential. Their curriculum improves integrity, self- esteem, responsibility, decision-making abilities and communication skills in close to 1,000 youth annually. 

Why give?

You can help revolutionize the travel industry.  This is a chance to bring a unique service to life and allow you to name your own price on travel.

You can help impact people's lives in a positive way.  Many of our travelers walk away with a great sense of accomplishment after hanging hundreds of feet from the side of a cliff.  This has led many to make life changing decisions and a renewed outlook on life.

Ten percent of your contributions to this campaign will go directly to helping fund Bonvoy's support to Big City Mountaineers and its efforts. 

What we need

Bonvoy has been a labor of love and to date has been fully self funded.  We have invested over $250,000 into Bonvoy.  Those funds have helped us scout trips, develop itineraries, develop a worldclass website, and build a small but loyal customer base. 

Over the past 2 years we have learned a lot and are ready to grow but we need your help.  

We are requesting $20,000 to assist with acquiring office space, office equipment and bringing on some extremely talented staff to manage public relations, social and content marketing, and corporate sales.

Donations will directly fund:

  • Additional staffing 
  • Office equipment including computers, furniture, etc.
  • Rent for office space 

Even if you are unable to give we hope you'll support our efforts by sharing this project with your friends and family.  

We greatly appreciate your support and thank you for your donations.

Perks

We're giving away some amazing stuff for our generous donees.  T-shirts, water bottles, hats, fleeces, and even trips!

  • $5 - Good feelings
  • $25 - Magnet
  • $50 - T-shirt
  • $100 - T-shirt + water bottle
  • $150 - T-shirt + hat
  • $250 - T-shirt + hat + water bottle
  • $500 - Fleece vest 
  • $1000 - Fleece vest + T-shirt
  • $2000 (tier 1) - Free domestic trip
  • $2500 (tier 2) - Free domestic trip
  • $3000 (tier 3) - Free domestic trip

How flex pricing works


I started Bonvoy to share my love of travel and the outdoors with as many people as I could. Through scouting, building relationships, and finding the absolute best guides we’ve been able to put together some incredible trips…and now we want to make sure everyone can join us on one. While we take great care to price our adventures as reasonably as we can (we are, after all, running a business), we understand that there’s a lot people who would love to join us if it were just a little less expensive. That’s why we’ve created Flex Pricing – if you need to take a few dollars, or even a few hundred dollars off the price of a trip then we say “Go for it!” We’re sure that once you experience a Bonvoy Adventure you’ll be a life-long traveler and hopefully you’ll decide to travel with us again and again. So please, take a look at the info below and see how we put the price tag on our trips, then when you go to purchase a trip take off what you’d like to or need to. 

– Sean


Some nice things people have said

"Our Trip was everything I expected and more! Hands down one of the greatest weekends I've had and hopefully the start of many more to come in Horseshoe Canyon Ranch. As a beginner, I learned all of the basics from our knowledgeable and professional guide, Sean, and now I have the necessary skills to begin learning more on my own. Thank you Bonvoy!"

Brock Moltsau, Lawton OK

"I had the best time in Utah with Bonvoy adventure travel. I would definitely take other trips. In fact I have another trip planned with them in a few months. Sean and Charles were great host and guides. No matter what issues happened upon us in March they found a way to compensate for it. With weather not cooperating well they adjust and compensated as needed our activities to allow the maximum enjoyment outdoors. The food was awesome. It was not your normal camp diet, they were gourmet camping dinners and breakfasts. All in all the trip was great. I am definitely taking them up on other trips. I only wish I was closer to local area headquarters to join in more of their adventures."

Tammy, Minneapolis, MN

"I had the best time in Utah with Bonvoy adventure travel. I would definitely take other trips. In fact I have another trip planned with them in a few months. Sean and Charles were great host and guides. No matter what issues happened upon us in March they found a way to compensate for it. With weather not cooperating well they adjust and compensated as needed our activities to allow the maximum enjoyment outdoors. The food was awesome. It was not your normal camp diet, they were gourmet camping dinners and breakfasts. All in all the trip was great. I am definitely taking them up on other trips. I only wish I was closer to local area headquarters to join in more of their adventures."

Ron Llarenas, Moab Utah

"I have never been one much for camping or outdoor trips. But a good friend of mine alerted me to Bonvoy and the Chattanooga, Tennessee adventure. Rock climbing, hang gliding, caving, mountain biking and rafting! All at an affordable price too! I could not pass up the opportunity to go and it's been one of the best decisions of my life. Sean Jackson and Bonvoy put together an exciting and amazing experience, and all I had to do was get myself out to Tennessee. I also met a diverse and amazing group of people on this adventure, and I can relive that experience with a multitude of pictures and videos. My only regret is that I cannot afford to go on Bonvoy's next trip out to Oregon, but there's always next year."

H. Eric Kahrs Jr., Tampa, FL, USA

"We recently went on the Chattanooga trip, and it's hard to find a word that describes how much fun we had. BonVoy does a great job of just letting you enjoy the trip. From having camp set up when you arrive, to the great dinners, to making you feel comfortable on each activity, it was an all around great experience. Neither of us had done any of the activities before, but our guides were helpful and encouraging, and now we are hooked. We can't wait to go on another trip! I highly recommend BonVoy if you are thinking of taking an adventure trip!"

Adam Maxey, Moore, OK

story:
The Most Delicious Camping and Grilling Treat Ever!

The Doughy Maker is a perfect addition for your campfire, barbecue grill, camp stove, or backyard fire pit.  The Doughy project is about gathering people together to share a delicious camp fire and grilling treat and enjoy the outdoors together. Doughies not only taste great, but they give you a great excuse to get together with your friends or family. We want to give every Indiegogo viewer the opportunity to make doughies for themselves and in the process, have a great new reason to reconnect with friends and family.  We think you'll want to invite everyone over for a Doughy night.

 

Doughies are made by cooking pieces of pop-open biscuit dough to a golden brown in our unique new pan, rolling them in butter, and then rolling them in cinnamon and sugar.  It is as simple as that but the taste will keep you coming back for more. The Doughy is destined to replace the marshmallow and the S'more as the treats of choice around the campfire.

 

 Welcome to the Doughy Maker Project

My name is Jesse Cooley.  My family and I are the inventor of the Doughy Maker (patent pending).  We are so excited to share our invention with Indiegogo contributors and hope you will love Doughies as much as we do.  

With your help we will fund the manufacturing that will take the Doughy Maker beyond our little family circle. Our prototypes of the Doughy Maker have turned out awesome, but we need to raise money to build additional production molds and to fund our production process in order to give our Indiegogo backers the chance to experience this fun and delicious treat. 

About Me

I am a college studend studying human physiology and developmental biology, but I have always considered myself an entrepreneur. Now its time to really prove it.  I am confident that with your help we can make this project a great success.  Thanks so much for supporting us and the Doughy Maker on Indiegogo.  

Our Story

The Doughy Maker was born of ingenuity and a passion for delicious food and the outdoors. However, the birthing process for the Doughy Maker was a bit painful.  You should have seen some of the early prototypes.  They started out with pans we bought at the grocery store, a makeshift handle pounded into shape with a big hammer and an anvil, and with a cotter pin to keep it shut. Needless to say we’ve come a very long way since then.

Eventually, the Doughy Maker evolved into what it is today, so fun and easy to use. - Telescoping adjustable handle, non-stick cooking coating, and 10 holes to match the 10 pieces of dough in one of those "pop-open" dough packages.

Now, with new Doughy Maker prototypes completed, we can make Doughies almost perfect, almost every time. Once the Doughies are golden brown, simply roll them in melted butter, then roll them in a cinnamon and sugar mixture and you'll see smiles that won't stop until you run out of dough. Doughies are the best thing to happen to camping and grilling since the invention of fire.

USE OF FUNDS

The Doughy Maker project has now moved to the point where our prototypes are almost perfected.  We are still working out small details to refine and finish the manufacturing process. We have plans in place that will make the Doughy Maker rock. We are seeking $50,000 in Indiegogo contributions that will be used for putting the finishing touches on the prototypes and build the production molds, so that we can get the Doughy Maker out to our Indiegogo fans faster.

Specifically, Indiegogo funds will be used for the production and other manufacturing costs as necessary to fulfill this project.  Up to this point, we have been using molds that were built for our prototyping process, not designed for long-term use. In other parts of the Doughy Maker we are not using molds at all but are crafting parts using materials currently available on the open market. Improving these parts requires us to build molds.  This will make the product even better.  These molds are very expensive and your contributions will be greatly appreciated. Once again, thanks for believing in us.

Risks and challenges

There are many risks that can arise in opposition to completing this project. Our experience has been that because of our small size, we wield no significant clout with suppliers and manufacturers. As such, our orders can be pushed to the back of the line. Orders are always fulfilled but sometimes not in as timely a manner as we would like.

However, significant lead times have been built into this project in order to account for this type of schedule risk. In other words, we have significantly padded the schedule. As such, we should be able to meet the proposed schedule for delivery of all Indiegogo rewards without difficulty. If difficulties arise, we will email each contributor in an effort to keep you informed of our situation and progress. Additionally, we will continue to work with those helping us with our manufacturing to minimize the effect of any new risk situations as much as possible.  Thanks for believing in us.

 Thanks for Your Help

Thanks for your contributions.  Thanks for believing in us. Even if your not in a situation where you can contribute, we would appreciate your help getting the word out about the Doughy Maker and making a noise about this great campaign.  One helpful way to do this is to use the Indiegogo share tools.  Thanks for helping us make this campaign successful.  We hope you and your family and friends enjoy Doughies as much as we do.

story:
Venus is our 10 year old daughter.  Riding her bike around the neighbourhood is absolutely her favourite pastime.  This past summer, her aunt and uncle gifted her a brand new bike from Mountain Equipment Co-op.  She loved it, and spent almost every waking minute on it when she wasn't in school.

On Friday, October 25, we were all at the family dance at the elementary school, just a few blocks from our house.  Because it was dark afterwards, we encouraged her to leave her bike locked in the bike rack at the school and pick it up in the morning.  She returned the next day to find her bike ruined.  The tire rims were bent, the seat slashed, the brakes broken, and the body scratched and mangled.

We, her parents, are raising four children off one blue collar income and struggling to make ends meet.  Her bike cost $420 at MEC.  That kind of bike is not normally within our price range, but her aunt and uncle bought it for her, insisting that no kid should be without a decent bike.  

The first $420 we raise will go towards replacing Venus' wrecked bike.  Any money we earn above that will go toward buying a new bike for Ocean, our 7.5 year old daughter, who has yet to have a decent bike.  Our total goal of $840 would cover really nice bikes for each of them.  We hope to be able to buy them by Christmas time.

story:
Thanks for visiting our page! To Contribute, either click the "Contribute Now" button OR Click on the "Perk" that you want!! 

When was the last time something innovative was created for the beach? The first Beach Volleyball game, created by William G. Morgan was played in 1915 in Hawaii. The Beach Ball was invented by Jonathon DeLonge from California in 1938.  The Frisbee was invented by Walter Frederick Morrison in 1950, also from California.

 

INTRODUCING THE BLANKET ANCHOR®...2013

NYC - Rockaway Beach

Blanket Anchor® Peg Set

WHAT IS THE BLANKET ANCHOR®?

The Blanket Anchor® is a new patent pending revolutionary set of brand-able beach tools that anchor your blowing blanket to the sand. This unique product comes in sets of (4) 6-inch pegs packaged neatly in a little mesh bag.

 

CATALYST THAT SPAWNED THE CREATION

It all started in July 2011, on a birthday trip to Bermuda where I was assaulted with pink sand having packed very lightly for a day at Horse Shoe Bay. (Aside: Did you know that the pink sand in Bermuda is actually the poop from the Parrot Fish? Nice, right? I didn't see any t-shirts proclaiming that tid bit!) Anyhoo, I discovered sand / poo in unwelcome places for 3 days. I returned to NYC and went to Rockaway Beach for a leisurely day in the sun.  I took a big frozen water, my book, a towel, my ipod  and some fruit.  The gusts of wind felt great in the hot sun but my blanket persisted in being unruly, resulting in sandpaper skin.  So, I grabbed all of the items that I took for my enjoyment and used them to hold the corners down. I then sat in the middle of my blanket, angry, looking at my configuration. I said, "there has to be something effective that I can buy so I won't have to deal with the 4 corner fumble!" I resolved to battle with sand for the last time and decided to do something about it.  And as they say, they rest is history and necessity is truly the mother of invention.

WHAT MAKES THE BLANKET ANCHOR® UNIQUE?

For ages people have dealt with the fumbling blanket syndrome at the beach.  We are so accustomed to playing 4 corners with our blankets that this product, designed in this manner does not exist.  Your flip flops are too light, your water bottle will get hot and you planned to read that book, right?  Well, no more fuss and no more blowing blanket, just grab your pegs and go! It's a pretty simple idea that we have taken great lengths to develop and now we need your help to produce it!!

We went a step further after making our prototypes and added a branding feature where the tops of the pegs can be customized.  We are not only introducing a fun and useful product, we are introducing a new category of beach advertising. Currently, the plane dragging the sign is our competition and we feel very confident that our product idea will be much more effective.

HOW DO BLANKET ANCHORS® WORK?

The base is twisted or screwed clockwise into the sand until the clamp is flush with the sand and then you gently grip the corner of your blanket to hold it in place.

Twist! & Clip!

The resistance created between the sand interlocking auger at the base (in the wet sand) and the topical surface of the sand enable the consumer to roll about with no worries on top their blanket without it becoming disheveled. 

We went through great lengths to make sure that the pegs had some sort of mechanism at the base that actually had the ability to remain secure and solid in sand as well as combat sudden gusts of wind.  They even work in grass. And as a result, when screwed down, flush with the sand - Blanket Anchors® are able to withstand up to 15 lbs of tension.  Yes, much more than necessary for a windy day at the beach, and if it were any windier you should be seeking shelter - but hey they really work and that was our goal!   

Everyone goes to the beach and research shows that 180 million people make 2 billion visits to U.S. beaches annually and close to 1 billion people frequent beaches globally. For instance in Brazil, close to 100,000 sunbathers can be found on a stretch of beach on a weekday afternoon and not necessarily on a holiday. So as you can see - the world needs Blanket Anchors® - there is an extremely vast market for this revolutionary new product.

Our starting product line-up consists of branded Blanket Anchor® pegs, Blankets, Towels and Sarongs. We paired up the pegs with blankets to form the Blanket Anchor® Kit which consists of the (4) branded pegs and (1) matching oversized 60 x 80 blanket. 

 USA Blanket Anchor® Kit & Sarong

Blanket Anchor® Signature Flag Line

6 Countries to select from:

  1. USA
  2. Jamaica
  3. Costa Rica
  4. Brazil
  5. Puerto Rico
  6. Italy

 

DON'T SEE YOUR COUNTRY??? ...have no fear just let us know...and we will see what we can do.  There will be no country left behind!! 

 

We also have a World Traveler Design Series for the savvy traveler as a part of our rewards. More colors to come!

World Traveler Design Series

World Traveler Blanket Anchor® Kit (Sarong forthcoming!)

 

WHAT WILL WE DO WITH FUNDING?

With the level of tenure involved in this project we all dove in head first and pooled our intellectual resources together and got a ton accomplished in a short period of time.  We basically need funding for marketing, commercials and air time as well our first large production run.

 

Brazil Blanket Anchor® Kit

The Blanket Anchor® Company needs your HELP to make our product available to the public.  We want to make Blanket Anchors® as common as taking a towel to the beach; a household product, where you will become upset if you forget them, much like your sunglasses or sun screen.  

 

USA Blanket Anchor® Bundle (Pegs, Blanket, Sarong)


Order Fulfillment

Once we receive your pledege we will confirm your design preferences via email to make sure we got it right.

 

Blanket Anchor products do not exist, you cannot buy them anywhere except here.  BE THE FIRST TO OWN... :)

 

We thank you in advance for your support…

The Blanket Anchor® Team

story:
ATTENTION FUNDERS!

In order to receive your perks you MUST verify and confirm your shipping address from the page:
 http://bemaker.borderlesselectronics.org.
No perks will be shipped to the unconfirmed addresses!


Thanks to 4,299 supporters!

BE SHIELD is the result of one of the most successful Indiegogo projects, and this short campaign is a follow up dedicated to those who missed the opportunity of contributing to the project:

BE MAKER

If you are not one of our former supporters, please spend a few minutes to review the original projects:

http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/be-maker-kit-plus-free-lessons-on-electronics-from-zero-to-internet-of-things

http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/9-arduino-compatible-starter-kit-anyone-can-learn-electronics

And you can also know more about us by reading the information from the previous campaign of the other partner of this project, the famous Alberto PighiXXX:

http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/arduino-basic-connections-the-book

Get what you have missed

Many of the supporters of the BE MAKER campaign sent me messages in the past weeks, asking how they could buy more BE SHIELDS. So I've decided to create this follow up campaign, that will run for a very short time, to give anyone the opportunity to order more boards before the production run starts.

The BE SHIELD has been improved, tested and is now ready for mass production. The final PCB design has been sent to the factory and the total quantity to produce must be communicated by the 23rd of January. So the following days will be the last opportunity to order this product.

Please note that no other production runs for the BE SHIELD are planned.

BE SHIELD

It was originally designed to be a simple tool dedicated to beginners, to learn how to create advanced project with the Arduino™, for example over the Internet, mainly to support the lessons for the BE MAKER project.

Thanks to the great support the project has received, the BE SHIELD was upgraded and became one of the most advanced additional device that can be used with any Arduino™ compatible board.

No other shields available on the market are packed with so many features!

The functions offered by the BE SHIELD includes:

  • 16x2 LCD Display socket with contrast control
  • microSD (TF) memory card socket
  • 5 control buttons that uses only 1 single analog input
  • Direct control for a servo motor
  • RGB LED Strip driver circuit capable of over 1A per channel
  • Ethernet controller for Internet connection
  • A digital I/O expander that adds 16 channels to the original 14 of an Arduino™; a total of 30 digital Input/Output channel available for your projects

All this in a very small board (only 4.25" or 10.8cm long). Plus, the board has been designed to allow the use of basically all of these functions at the same time. With the BE SHIELD it's possible to create hardware application with Internet connection, local display, control by button, and memory card storage, all together, working at the same time and without adding any wire. This with 5 analog and 16 digital channels still available for additional components.

BE SHIELD is 100% compatible with Arduino™ UNO! Check the video:



The BE SHIELD is totally Open Source. You can take a look at the schematics here:

http://bemaker.borderlesselectronics.org/BE_SHIELD.pdf

Not to mention the fact that the BE SHIELD costs only $15 including shipping!

If you didn't watch the video at the top of this page yet, please do it, to see the BE SHIELD in action.

BE BOARD

The BE BOARD is a low cost (because nonprofit) Arduino™ compatible board introduced on Indiegogo last August that sold out (over 15,000 pieces) one week before the natural end of the campaign.

The BE BOARD is the perfect companion of the BE SHIELD, like any other Arduino™ compatible board, and it's also available from this short campaign.

PERKS

With this campaign you have the opportunity to order one or more BE SHIELD boards from the only scheduled production run.

As we are also starting a production run of the BE BOARD, our nonprofit Arduino™ compatible board, it's possible to order more with this campaign as well. Also for this board we don't have other production runs scheduled for the future.

For a lower price it's possible to request a bundle that includes one or more BE SHIELD(s) and BE BOARD(s), in equal quantities.

Finally, in order to be as fast as possible we have started to prepare the materials for the BE MAKER project before receiving the final list of contributions from Indiegogo. So we have enough material for up to 200 more kits. It's possible with this campaign to order a limited quantity of complete kits.

Please refer to the original campaign for the full description of the content of the $69 kit:

http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/be-maker-kit-plus-free-lessons-on-electronics-from-zero-to-internet-of-things


Some legal note, just in case: Trademarked names, logos, and images may appear in this page. Rather than using a trademark symbol with every occurrence of a trademarked name, logo, or image we use the names, logos, and images only in an editorial fashion and to the benefit of the trademark owner, with no intention of infringement of the trademark. The use in this page of trade names, trademarks, service marks, and similar terms, even if they are not identified as such, is not to be taken as an expression of opinion as to whether or not they are subject to proprietary rights. While the advice and information in this page are believed to be true and accurate at the date of publication, can't accept any legal responsibility for any errors or omissions that may be made. Arduino and the Infinite symbol are tradermark of Arduino LLC which is not affiliated with the publisher or the author, and does not authorize, sponsor, endorse or otherwise approve this project.

The final PCB design has been sent to the factory and the total quantity to produce must be communicated by the 23rd of January. So the following days will be the last opportunity to order this product.Please note that no other production runs for the BE SHIELD are planned.BE SHIELDIt was originally designed to be a simple tool dedicated to beginners, to learn how to create advanced project with the Arduino™, for example over the Internet, mainly to support the lessons for the BE MAKER project.Thanks to the great support the project has received, the BE SHIELD was upgraded and became one of the most advanced additional device that can be used with any Arduino™ compatible board.No other shields available on the market are packed with so many features!The functions offered by the BE SHIELD includes:
16x2 LCD Display socket with contrast control
microSD (TF) memory card socket
5 control buttons that uses only 1 single analog input
Direct control for a servo motor
RGB LED Strip driver circuit capable of over 1A per channel
Ethernet controller for Internet connection
A digital I/O expander that adds 16 channels to the original 14 of an Arduino™; a total of 30 digital Input/Output channel available for your projects
All this in a very small board (only 4.25" or 10.8cm long). Plus, the board has been designed to allow the use of basically all of these functions at the same time. With the BE SHIELD it's possible to create hardware application with Internet connection, local display, control by button, and memory card storage, all together, working at the same time and without adding any wire. This with 5 analog and 16 digital channels still available for additional components.BE SHIELD is 100% compatible with Arduino™ UNO! Check the video:The BE SHIELD is totally Open Source. You can take a look at the schematics here:http://bemaker.borderlesselectronics.org/BE_SHIELD.pdfNot to mention the fact that the BE SHIELD costs only $15 including shipping!If you didn't watch the video at the top of this page yet, please do it, to see the BE SHIELD in action.BE BOARDThe BE BOARD is a low cost (because nonprofit) Arduino™ compatible board introduced on Indiegogo last August that sold out (over 15,000 pieces) one week before the natural end of the campaign.The BE BOARD is the perfect companion of the BE SHIELD, like any other Arduino™ compatible board, and it's also available from this short campaign.PERKSWith this campaign you have the opportunity to order one or more BE SHIELD boards from the only scheduled production run.As we are also starting a production run of the BE BOARD, our nonprofit Arduino™ compatible board, it's possible to order more with this campaign as well. Also for this board we don't have other production runs scheduled for the future.For a lower price it's possible to request a bundle that includes one or more BE SHIELD(s) and BE BOARD(s), in equal quantities.Finally, in order to be as fast as possible we have started to prepare the materials for the BE MAKER project before receiving the final list of contributions from Indiegogo. So we have enough material for up to 200 more kits. It's possible with this campaign to order a limited quantity of complete kits.Please refer to the original campaign for the full description of the content of the $69 kit:http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/be-maker-kit-plus-free-lessons-on-electronics-from-zero-to-internet-of-thingsSome legal note, just in case: Trademarked names, logos, and images may appear in this page. Rather than using a trademark symbol with every occurrence of a trademarked name, logo, or image we use the names, logos, and images only in an editorial fashion and to the benefit of the trademark owner, with no intention of infringement of the trademark. The use in this page of trade names, trademarks, service marks, and similar terms, even if they are not identified as such, is not to be taken as an expression of opinion as to whether or not they are subject to proprietary rights. While the advice and information in this page are believed to be true and accurate at the date of publication, can't accept any legal responsibility for any errors or omissions that may be made. Arduino and the Infinite symbol are tradermark of Arduino LLC which is not affiliated with the publisher or the author, and does not authorize, sponsor, endorse or otherwise approve this project.

story:
We know that a well-organized, beautifully-designed bag makes traveling so much easier and more pleasurable. And when that bag is a multi-tasker that holds up during business trips, vacations, and the daily commute - well, that's even better.

But finding an affordable, high-quality travel backpack that truly delivers in terms of convenience, performance, and style is a challenge. We searched too, and we struggled.

So we designed our own.

After months of getting our creative heads together, the first Sterkmann product was born. Our expandable carry-on backpack launched in December 2018 and was an instant hit with frequent travelers and busy professionals alike. Since then, we've increased our product line to include a duffel bag, a toiletry bag, a tech pouch, and more. We've grown our brand too, shipping to thousands of (highly satisfied) customers worldwide this year alone.

Sterkmann devotees love the intelligent design, superior quality, and competitive prices of our products. They find our bags easily rival the big brands, offering luxury and innovation without laying waste to their paychecks. They feel they're the logical choice for every trip, whether they're city-hopping or dashing to business meetings.

You'll believe this too, from the very first use of your Sterkmann travel bag.

Tross is a data driven Crowdfunding company

story:
Why?

We created the GreenTraveler to offer a solution to people who want a convenient, travel-friendly way to take food on-the-go without messes like these:

With GreenTraveler as your primary container you may be amazed how many uses it has - keep liquids in, keep rain and water out, store food and beverages, use for first aid or baby supplies, or for any items you need protected.

 

What?

GreenTraveler is a cylinder with carabiner loops and 6 compartments that won't leak, spill or break. Modeled from a water bottle which we carry everywhere to avoid disposable plastic bottles.

GreenTraveler Specs​

How does it work?

The Original GreenTraveler may feel like a puzzle the first time, but once you get the hang of it, you'll wonder why it didn't exist before.

How Much?

The Original GreenTraveler replaces many items you may use every day.

Perks

 

 

Custom designed insulated carrying pouch Add-On by Bluewave. Measures 14"x4" with an added pocket for utensil plus what is shown above. $23 includes shipping worldwide.

End caps to hold two center body compartments tightly together to make a smaller liquid-tight GreenTraveler without the need for cups. $8 includes shipping worldwide!

Put them all together in a great value bundle!

What if?

We have a consultant living next to the manufacturing facility who is nearly like a partner, conducting continuous 3rd party quality control. But what if your GT breaks or you don't like it?

Warranty:

Manufacturer's defects are covered for a month. Just send picture or video of the defect to us and we will get a replacement part sent to you.

GreenTraveler covers its products under normal use for life. We want you to enjoy our products your whole life and never see them in a landfill. We also offer a recycling program to provide a replacement part with free shipping if you ship the broken part to us (or send a photo of it in the proper recycle bin). See our website for warranty details.

 

What's Next?

We have planned for a couple years in the future with logistics, partnerships, financial proformas, and designs of new products we will launch. All we need is the successful launch of this first product with initial funding for injection molding and we can give you much more convenience while traveling.

Connect with us on social media and stay tuned as we have new innovations coming to you!

 

Then and Now

This project  kept calling us to be born! This is our first crowdfunding campaign, but not our first business. As serial entrepreneurs with finance experience, we put all our intelligence, time, and money starting in November 2015 to make GreenTraveler a reality with full force. Here is how far we've come:

THANK YOU from the GreenTraveler Team!  

Press Links

http://finance.yahoo.com/news/camping-enthusiast-foodie-either-way-145921041.html 

https://sports.yahoo.com/news/camping-enthusiast-foodie-either-way-145921041.html 

https://www.yahoo.com/music/camping-enthusiast-foodie-either-way-145921041.html

http://www.digitaltrends.com/home/greentraveler...

 

Spread the Word!

Help share this campaign with the links at the top on your favorite social site. Or get paid for it with KickBooster! 

Or with Funded Today's Cashback Program:

Thank you!

We couldn't have done this without our awesome media firms helping us get the word out!

 Get Your Project Funded Today!

 

IndieGogo Video Production by StartMotionMedia.com
story_txt:
At a picnic in the park…
On an adventure in the mountains…
Or in the office…
Take your food or leftovers anywhere without leaking or spills. Guaranteed. You'll never throw away a container again.
 Why?We created the GreenTraveler to offer a solution to people who want a convenient, travel-friendly way to take food on-the-go without messes like these:
While trying to use other portable containers, we were tired of leaks, spills, having only one compartment leaving our food soggy, inconvenient shapes and sizes that don't fit in a bag, and throwing away disposable to-go containers that didn't work very well anyway.With GreenTraveler as your primary container you may be amazed how many uses it has - keep liquids in, keep rain and water out, store food and beverages, use for first aid or baby supplies, or for any items you need protected. What?GreenTraveler is a cylinder with carabiner loops and 6 compartments that won't leak, spill or break. Modeled from a water bottle which we carry everywhere to avoid disposable plastic bottles.
For this size and shape, plastic is still the best material. But don't be afraid of it. It has no BPA or phthalates so it won't leach chemicals in your food, even in a microwave. The plastic used in the Original GreenTraveler is approved by the food safety foundations for food around the world.GreenTraveler Specs​
 
For Who?
 
GreenTraveler is not only for adventure travel or active lifestyles. It is for the commuter who goes to a job all day. The student who goes to school. Hobbyist photographers or fishermen. The GreenTraveler is for people who leave the house and want good food wherever they are. 
 
The world has taken notice..... How does it work?The Original GreenTraveler may feel like a puzzle the first time, but once you get the hang of it, you'll wonder why it didn't exist before.... 
Assembly and disassembly are super easy!
Just put some food in it and off you go :)
 How Much?The Original GreenTraveler replaces many items you may use every day.GreenTraveler is worth the price!

All we need is the successful launch of this first product with initial funding for injection molding and we can give you much more convenience while traveling.Connect with us on social media and stay tuned as we have new innovations coming to you!  Then and NowThis project  kept calling us to be born! story:
As Seen On...

Our team at Global Travel Clothing has been creating the most affordable, full-featured travel jackets since 2010. Because technology has continued to rapidly advanced since we opened for business, we decided our jackets should too.

We’re proud to introduce the perfect solution for your everyday carry needs: “The Joey”.

We’ve been in the jacket business for a long time. As a team of avid travelers, we know how important it is for you to know your belongings are safe and secure. Joey EDC is our new and improved line with features, like detachable sleeves and a built-in eye mask, that tailor to YOUR individual needs.

Everything seen in the above picture (left) is in the jacket being worn (right)

PLUS - All of our jackets are machine washable with NO special washing conditions!

We obviously think our jackets are awesome, but don't just take our word for it. We sent one to EverydayTacticalVids who has an awesome channel on YouTube for his review of the jacket.

 For more of his awesome videos check out his channel here - CLICK HERE

Soft Shell

Our Sturdy Waterproof Jacket

The Soft Shell is a poly blend that is soft, sheds water, yet breathes. The material has been tested under two hours of water without leaking.

Sweatshirt

Super Comfortable Perfect For Staying Warm

The sweatshirt is a cotton poly blend that is soft and warm, it has polyester lined pockets to make them water resistant.

This custom fit zip-in liner fits both jacket styles and adds approximately 10°F (or 5°C) of warmth. Plus it has built-in zippers which allows easy access to jacket pockets. The liner includes one large pocket of its own located in the back.

We have a TON of new features for this jacket! This includes all new material on the soft shell jacket. This new material is softer and more breathable, while still shedding water. Both style of jackets have two new pockets, a carabiner strap, side vents, and zip off sleeves. Rounding out the upgrades are better zippers and the Joey Branding. Our crowdfunding backers will be receiving the very first edition of this jacket.

Whether you’re a gadget lover, parent or adventurous traveler, the Joey EDC gives you an extra pair of hands and peace of mind knowing your belongings are secure.

We will have absolutely no problem getting you a great jacket delivered on-time!

Mens Sizes

Womens Sizes

Our top priority is to get quality jackets to our backers as scheduled, and will do everything in our power to make it happen. 

Founded in 2010 Global Travel Clothing was created to make affordable and high-quality travel jackets. The idea was inspired by our CEO's husbands travels to China and having to carry a fanny pack and awkward money belts just to keep all his stuff on him. From that experience the idea was born to create jackets with enough storage to carry everything you'd need for everyday situations.

story:
“One morning I had this crazy idea to give people an opportunity to experience the world of paragliding like never before” – Rhys Fisher, Agile Existence

 

In June 2017, along with Mark Baldwin and Fons de Leewe, we will attempt a coast to coast Pyrenees crossing–powered only by the elements.

From the Bay of Biscay to the Mediterranean sea, We will navigate through epic peaks, confront demanding flying, loaded hikes, and wild camp deeper than any of us have ever gone before.

To get you closer to the action, I've co-founder Adventures Unbound with Alice Horwood, and soon we will have a custom project website (reachinglostmountain.com) where you'll get access to LIVE tracking and social updates and an exclusive paragliding game level.

Project Thermal Crossings

Thermal Crossings is a “bold new approach” for adventuring that makes vol-biv paragliding more accessible, more transparent and more engaging to fans. Above all this, it allows Rhys, with your support, to inspire the next generation of adventurers.

“Everyone who lives, dies. Yet not everyone who dies, has lived. We take these risks not to escape life, but to prevent life from escaping us” – unknown

Rhys is assembling some of the most successful and recognisable names in paragliding and adventure athletics to guide him through a demanding training to prepare him for this expedition. He is once again questioning untested assumptions and taking his team through an innovative new model. This model starts by inviting you to crowdfund the first phase of the project--budget and itemize.

In return, he will provide fans with HD videos edits that capture his XC flying and vol-biv paragliding expeditions in stunning detail. Revealing a never before seen perspective into such an expedition, and providing you with an opportunity to nudge an adventure into existence.

"It's the first time anybody has offered the opportunity to be so involved, to be able to access all of the training data, and the inside stories” – Stan Radzikowski

Read more of Rhys's story here.

The History of Paragliding:

 

In the 1960s, the military needed to train parachutists how to perform safe landings. In order to fit more landing practice into a day, they would attach the parachutists to a truck with a tow rope and once high enough, would release the tow rope so the parachutists could descend back to earth. Many parachutists soon became more interested in the floating part instead of the landing part.

For fun, they would launch themselves off steep hills and parachute to the ground below, experimenting with how they could harness air currents to stay in the air longer.

This soon became a sport and really picked up steam with the invention of the ram-air parachute. Also known as the parafoil. Developed by Domina Jalbert in 1964, the ram-air parachute called a wing or canopy -- was broken up into cells. As the canopy caught the wind, air would "ram" into these cells, inflating the wing. The shape allowed the wing to glide further.

 

 

 

Modern paragliders have evolved a lot since the early days and have since become highly sophisticated ultralight aircraft. A complete gear can weigh between 8kg–20kg, and enable pilots to fly at speeds between 20km/h–70km/h. They have glide ratios of 10/1. The performance enhancements allow pilots to stay in the air for many hours at a time and to fly many hundreds of miles in a single flight.

Here's what one of Rhys's Flights looks like visualised over a 3D map.

 

A Winning Team

The thermal crossing’s team is still growing but is already home to some of the biggest names in adventure athletics. The superheroes of today. With that said, it's a pleasure to introduce you to the team.

Rhys Fisher: Cross Country Paraglider 

Rhys has written about tech, lifestyle, business and more. And is quickly making a name for himself as a lifestyle hacker by blazing an uncommon trail, making the seemingly impossible possible, and sharing his learnings along the way. He has helped companies grow large audiences, thoroughly enjoys traveling the world and meeting new people, and is eager to embark on his biggest adventure yet. Follow his journey on Instagram and Facebook if you're into that sort of thing.

Advisors:

Stan Radzikowski: X-Pyr competitor

Stan has earned podium placings internationally since his first season flying–including multiple PWC and FAI events. His dedication and training have given him the skills to fly deep into extremely remote and hostile mountains while always maintaining a healthy safe risk to reward ratio. He has since served as Chief pilot at Everest Paragliding, set solo and tandem distance records, has competed in the X-Pyr race, and now offers a range of tandem and XC guiding services–eager to pass the knowledge he has accumulated as the one of the world's ultimate flying explorers. See more of Stan at Parakros.com.

Krischa Berlinger: Redbull X-Alps supporter

Growing up as a swiss, Krischa has been climbing in the alps since he could remember. Two and half decades in the mountains and the draw to pursue the rock warrior's way in the vertical world around the globe hasn't diminished. He grew his wings in 2012 in Tahoe, California where cowboys still roam. After learning how to paraglide, his obsessiveness switched towards flying very quickly. Talent and Airtime would bring results, earning him a supporter role for Team USA4 in the RedBull XAlps 2015. See more of Krischa on Instagram.

Nick Neyens: Redbull X-Alps competitor

Nick has been actively exploring the world hiking and flying (vol biv) since he learnt to fly in 2007. Trained as an engineer, after returning from one year working in Antarctica he took two years off to travel. Following hike and fly competitions in the Pyrenees (X-Pyr 2014) and South Africa's Drakensberg mountains (X-Berg 2014), he completed the 2015 Red Bull X-Alps in tenth place. He hopes to write about his subsequent adventures in South America while studying to become a meteorologist. See more of Nick at Share MyJoys.

Adél Honti: Entrepreneur & XC Competition Pilot

Adél started flying in 2004 and became an instructor, cross-country guide, and competition pilot in 2013. Since then she has participated in 11 competitions, and has earned 7 medals. She is the ambassador of a 700 pilot strong Facebook group for female paragliding pilots, has given lectures on the psychology of female pilots at the Hory a Mesto Extreme sports film festival, and has started to work on an international training program for female pilots, currently raising sponsorship money for an event series. She is dedicated to helping others fly safer, higher and further. See more of Adél on Instagram.

Talent and Airtime would bring results, earning him a supporter role for Team USA4 in the RedBull XAlps 2015. See more of Krischa on Instagram.
Nick Neyens: Redbull X-Alps competitorNick has been actively exploring the world hiking and flying (vol biv) since he learnt to fly in 2007. Trained as an engineer, after returning from one year working in Antarctica he took two years off to travel. Following hike and fly competitions in the Pyrenees (X-Pyr 2014) and South Africa's Drakensberg mountains (X-Berg 2014), he completed the 2015 Red Bull X-Alps in tenth place. He hopes to write about his subsequent adventures in South America while studying to become a meteorologist. See more of Nick at Share MyJoys.

Adél Honti: Entrepreneur & XC Competition Pilot

Adél started flying in 2004 and became an instructor, cross-country guide, and competition pilot in 2013. Since then she has participated in 11 competitions, and has earned 7 medals. She is the ambassador of a 700 pilot strong Facebook group for female paragliding pilots, has given lectures on the psychology of female pilots at the Hory a Mesto Extreme sports film festival, and has started to work on an international training program for female pilots, currently raising sponsorship money for an event series. She is dedicated to helping others fly safer, higher and further. See more of Adél on Instagram.

story:
What? Tahoe Ski Trip!

When? Friday night March 13th through Sun March 15th.

Where? In this amazing mansion!

Who? All the Indie team members are invited, with +1s

Why? 42 ... also, because it's going to be amazing!

What do I bring? Yourself. Your +1, if any. Warm winter clothes. 

What will be there? Fun. Friends. Awesomeness. Snow. Skiing. Snowboarding. Food. Drinks. Boardgames. Maybe even Rocksmith 2014 (also known as the best video game in the history of mankind) if Victor has his way. Pool - the kind you shoot. Hot tub - the Tardis kind. Random printed out picture of Chuckee just cause.

Why haven't I signed up for this yet? Ask not what the Indiegogo platform can do for you, ask what you can do for the Indiegogo platform:


What resort is it? Heavenly is closest, but you are welcome to go wherever. Or just hang around the house and hang out the whole time.

What do I get? We'll be using the funds to pay for the cabin & buy supplies.

Should I bring sunscreen? Nah..


What isn't included? Special dietary restriction food. Getting to & from Tahoe - we will help coordinate carpools, but as far as costs go, that's you car's business. Lift tickets & gear rentals - again, you are on your own. Check out online for various discounts for Lift tickets. Gear is much cheaper to rent from SF, but that does create extra logistics headache.

Anything else? Yep - space is limited. First come first serve. No refunds or cancellations (though you are welcome to talk someone else into going in your place if you have an emergency).

Hmm, I don't know, what about ... ? For any doubts, please refer to the following images:

story:
What is Incubasic?

Incubasic is a group of diverse students, from engineers and medical personnel to communications and political science majors. Our motley crew has all banded together for one end goal: to save lives. 

    In Tanzania, premature infant mortality from improper post-birth warming is a horribly prevalent issue, resulting in tens of thousands of deaths each year. 

    With this in mind, we set to work creating The Life Blanket- an individualized heating pad which regulates newborns' body temperatures. Our resulting product is:

    • Affordable- It is 90% cheaper than traditional incubators.
    • Sustainable-The Blanket is made in-country using the local trained technicians. 
    • Repairable- It is easily fixed or replaced with local parts and materials.
    • Effective- It is accurately and precisely monitors temperature  to 0.1ºC.
    • Useful-  We are developing a heart-rate monitor and oxygen-monitor for simple integration into the same device. 

    All of these aspects combine to make The Life Blanket a major improvement over anything in the market today. With your help, nearly half of the children who die prematurely in Tanzania can possibly be saved by simply having the Blanket to warm them.

    -Prototype of the Life Blanket

    Where we need help

    We have gone through preliminary testing of our prototype, but we need your help to scale up in order to help more at risk infants . Our $7000 goal will help buy more materials for additional prototype blankets in our expanding testing trials.

     A portion of the proceeds will fund travel and housing expenses for the engineers on the team when they go to Tanzania. These travels allow the team to work with local technicians and clinicians to train them on how to use the Blanket as well as how to build and repair the device.

     

    What you get- The "Perks"

    When you donate, you do get something in return! 
    Depending on how much you give, you can get some of many possible "thank you" gifts, including: 
    • Heartfelt Thank You message
    • Set of photos of children you are helping, our research and development process, scenes in Tanzania, and our partnering hospitals
    • Tee-shirt from Incubasic: The Life Blanket, with the team logo
    • Mini-blanket modeled after The Life Blanket, with the team logo
    • Google Hangout, Skype-chat, or web-chat with the team
    • Personal tour of the Clemson University BioEngineering lab
    • Corporate-sponsorship, in which your name/brand will be printed on all promotional blankets and tee-shirts


      The Current Situation in Tanzania

      Hot Rooms

      A common practice to keep babies warm in Tanzania is to simply keep an entire room heated to temperatures close to 100°F. Such an environment is prime for outbreaks of disease and infection. One of the hospitals we have worked with reported that in 2010,   30 of 33 infants died within one week due to the rapid spread of infection in a hot room. 

      Furthermore, the heat is nearly unbearable for already underpaid and overworked doctors and nurses. The working conditions in these wards many time discourage perspective healthcare workers from joining  the industry. Furthermore, the uncomfortable heat encourages quick and less-than personalized attention for the at-risk babies. The Life Blanket not only helps the babies by providing a safe warming method, but it also helps the nurses and doctors have a more comfortable work environment- which in turn means the babies will be more well attended! 

      Donated Incubators

      A common, although unfortunately misguided, practice to attempt to solve this lack of warming instruments is for industrialized countries to donate high-tech, expensive, and complex incubators.

      The impoverished and needy recipients are many times disappointed; an estimated 48% of the $20,000 to $40,000 worth of the donated machinery arrives unusable. Furthermore, maintenance is expensive and complicated. If any parts of the incubators break, the entire system is useless until more donated parts can be shipped (if they are lucky enough to even receive them at all). Additionally, due to the lack of necessary training and manuals, the technicians are many times unable to repair the incubators anyway. Overall, donated goods usually end up being unusable after some time. 

      Makeshift Warming

      For those who do not have the capability to warm an entire ward, or those who do not have access to the few donated supplies given to Tanzanian hospitals, the healthcare providers have to use more makeshift methods: heat-lamps usually used for animals or food, boiled water bottles, industrial continuously-heating pads, or even just bundles of normal blankets. These "one-size-fits-all" methods are not the most preferable when compared to individualized care provided by The Life Blanket. 


      Features

      Currently, the Life Blanket's main features include:
      • Locally available materials
      • Simple to replicate design
      • Temperature-monitoring thermister to regulate the ideal amount of heating for the blanket
      • Three LED lights to display the current temperature: Blue for cold, green for in range, and red for too warm                               


      What we are working on

      We are constantly looking for ways to improve upon the Life Blanket. Currently undergoing further development is the:

      • Pulse/oximetry unit for monitoring blood-oxygen levels and heart rate
      • LCD screen for displaying the monitoring data- heart rate, oxygen levels, and temperature
      • A new enclosure made from recycled locally sourced materials, such as melted and reformed melted bottle caps or shop-vac thermoforming boxes


      What We Have Done 

      We have been involved in nearly four years of intensive development, trips to several hospitals -including Dar Es Salam's Muhimbili National Hospital- and partnering with other local administrators, doctors, nurses, technicians, students, and teachers. We are on the first steps of our journey to expand The Life Blanket's reach. 

      We have also had previous success at Clemson University's "Social Launchpad Competition," in which we were awarded $2000, as well in SC Launchpad, in which we were one of the few finalists from around the upstate state.

      Media Recognition 

      Many stories have been run about the Life Blanket, and it is gathering recognition. 
      Check these out: 

      http://www.wspa.com/story/28755246/clemson-students-create-life-blanket-to-save-tanzania-babies

      http://gsabusiness.com/news/54156-clemson-student-researchers-launch-crowdfunding-of-infant-project

      http://www.foxcarolina.com/story/28747355/clemson-students-looking-to-save-infant-lives-in-tanzania

      http://greertoday.com/greer-sc/these-babies-dont-have-to-die/2015/04/07/

      http://upstatebizsc.whosonthemove.com/clemson-university-student-team-launches-crowd-funding-effort/


      Challenges and Road-bumps

      While we have the resources of a professional research University, we still encounter some difficulties, including:

      • Receiving regulatory approval in Tanzania (We are currently under a fast-tracked review, expecting good news soon!)
      • Raising funds to finance development
      • Establishing manufacturing centers in-country
      • Creating distribution centers in-country
      However, none of these challenges are with the technology itself. We have worked very intensely with the "customers"- that is, the doctors and nurses who will be using The Life Blanket every day- to make sure the product is workable and useful. We are confident and stand behind our product.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      We understand that sometimes you just can not afford to contribute, but you can help in other ways!

      • Tell others about the campaign! If you think this is an admirable cause, join us!
      • Use the IndieGogo sharing tools to post on your social media outlets- they are simple and easy!


      Thank you for all of your help!

      -Incubasic- The Life Blanket team
