story:
Sarajevo Video Guide – prvi video vodič za Sarajevo

U posljednje tri godine Sarajevo, glavni grad Bosne i Hercegovine, bilježi dvocifreni rast turista godišnje. Turisti dolaze iz 110 država svijeta.

Prošle godine kreirao sam audio vodič “Sarajevo Travaler Vol. 1” a ove “Sarajevo Traveler Vol. 2” koji su dostupani na iTunes, Apple Music, Google Music and Amazon platformama i dosada su snimci preslušani više od 500.000 puta.

Sada, želim napraviti mobilnu aplikaciju koja će sadržavati video vodič za 20 atraktivnih lokacija u Sarajevu. Lokacije su pažljivo odabrane kako bi otkrili pravo Sarajevo koje donosi poseban duh i inspirativnu energiju.

Video vodič će kroz svoje aktere pokazati priče o gradu koje čak i lokalci rijetko poznaju.

Format:

  • Mobilna aplikacija za iOS i Android uređaje
  • 20 video materijala koji pokrivaju 20 lokacija u Sarajevu
  • Promovisanje projekta prema domaćim i inostranim medijima
  • Komuniciranje projekta u fizičkoj i online formi prema krajnjim korisnicima

 

Zašto aplikacija? Zašto video?

Razvojem brzih internet konekcija ruše se barijere prometa video sadržaja na mobilnim uređajim. Turisti traže sažete i jasne informacije o znamenitostima bez dugih tekstova jer obično imaju malo vremena zbog nastavka putovanja prema drugim destinacijama.

Tokom ljeta 2016. godini snimili smo zvanični trailer i imao je veoma pozitivne komentare na socijalnim mrežama i pregledan je više od 700.000 puta (Youtube + Social media). Mediji u BiH su ga proglasili najboljim videom o Sarajevu ikada!

Pogledajte ovdje: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JuzW1gtO5DQ&t=1s

Planiram da aplikaciju sa video snimcima lansiram u septembru 2017. godine i trenutno prikupljam sredstva za izradu aplikacije i produkciju video snimaka vrhunske produkcije:

  • Aplikacija – 15.000 EUR
  • 20 video snimaka – 40.000 EUR

 

Nemate novac, kako možete pomoći?

Ako niste u mogućnosti da finansijski podržite ovaj projekat, podijelite link na kampanju sa vašom mrežom prijatelja, poznanika i kolega.  Hvala!

 

Web: www.sarajevo.guide

Facebook: www.facebook.com/SarajevoGuideApp/


---

Sarajevo Video Guide – The first video guide for Sarajevo

In the last three years Sarajevo the capital of Bosnia and Herzegovina, recorded double-digit growth of tourists annually. Tourists come from 110 countries around the world.

Last year I created the audio guide "Sarajevo Travaler Vol. 1" and this year “Sarajevo Traveler Vol. 2” which are available on iTunes, Apple Music, Google Music and Amazon platforms. Since than the recordings have been streamed more than 500,000 times.

Now, I want to make a mobile application that will include a video guide about 20 attractive locations in Sarajevo. The locations are carefully selected in order to discover the Sarajevo which brings a special spirit and inspiring energy.

The Sarajevo Video Guide through it’s actors will show stories of the city that even the locals rarely know.

Format:
- Mobile applications for iOS and Android devices
- 20 videos covering 20 locations in Sarajevo
- Promote the project to local and foreign media
- Communication about the project in the physical and online form to end users


Why app? Why video?

Availability of high-speed Internet and fast mobile Internet demolish the barriers to use videos as a medium on mobile devices. Tourists look for a concise and clear information about attractions without long texts because they usually have little time due to travel to other destinations.

During the summer of 2016, we recorded the official trailer and had very positive comments on social networks. The video has been viewed more than 700,000 times (Youtube + social meida). Media in Bosnia and Herzegovina declared it as the best video of Sarajevo ever! You can watch it here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JuzW1gtO5DQ&t=1s
I plan to launch the application in September 2017 and currently I am raising funds for the development of the app and the production of the high-quality videos:
- Applications - € 15,000
- 20 videos - € 40,000

 

I have no money, how can I help?

If you are unable to financially support this project, share the link to this campaign with your network of friends, relatives and colleagues. Thank you!

Web: www.sarajevo.guide
Facebook: www.facebook.com/SarajevoGuideApp/

story:
Who We Are and What is Project EMPOWER?

We are three guys from Galway, Ireland. The sport of rugby brought us together almost 20 years ago when Damian and Fergus played for the Galwegians RFC senior team that MacDara managed. Damian and Fergus are in their very early forties and MacDara is at least a decade older than both of them! All three of us are self employed, Damian as an extreme adventurer and speaker, Fergus owns and operates a small bus company and MacDara is a business consultant specialising in the tourism, leisure and hospitality sectors. In our lives we enjoy and endure the same struggles, challenges and opportunities as most people but what sets us apart is our dogged determination, our never, ever give up attitude  and our absolute belief in the power of "me". We believe that digging deep enables us to climb high and we need you to help us prove just how high digging deep can take us and to help us share that learning with the World. These beliefs have helped Damian win European Cups, row the Atlantic solo and climb the worlds highest mountains, have helped Fergus to walk again after suffering a life threatening spinal injury in 2018  and helped MacDara survive the global financial crisis in 2008.

Project EMPOWER has grown out of Damian's ambition to row the Atlantic from New York to Galway, Fergus's ambition to show the World that suffering a life threatening debilitating injury does not mean that life can no longer be lived and MacDara's desire to help us to be our very best selves in every second of every minute of every hour of every day that we're gifted. 

Project EMPOWER is a studied endeavour over 24 months encapsulating Fergus and Damian's journey to empower themselves from very different starting points, to prepare for, partake in and persevere through one of the world’s most extreme challenges; Rowing 4937.47km unsupported across the Atlantic Ocean from New York City to Galway in world record time, and to detail the complete experience in a book and documovie that will tell a story, that can empower us all to realise our true potential through planned ambitious endeavour.

Help us to make waves that will break down barriers and EMPOWER us all to be our very best selves. Your contribution will fund the purchase of the boat that will carry Fergus and Damian across the North Atlantic from New York City to Galway in the Summer of 2022. This is your chance to float your boat by floating ours!

 

What We Need & What You Get

As you can imagine, rowing the North Atlantic, publishing a book and making a movie about it so that the World can learn from the lessons taught by the endeavour is not a cheap exercise.  Critical to the project is the boat Damian and Fergus will use in the row. In short, we need the money to but the boat.

Ocean rowing boats are not off the shelf purchases. They are handmade, specially designed bespoke pieces of essential equipment. This boat will be the difference between life and death for Fergus and Damian. In this boat that will be just big enough for both of them, they will encounter huge sea storms, will climb swells higher than your house, and will row for hours on end. The purpose of this campaign is to raise the money we need to buy the boat.

Depending on which tier you decide to purchase there are various different perks from owning one of the project Oars, to having your name on the boat ,to spending quality time with Fergus and Damian at the boat launch, to launching the boat, to having an ocean rowing experience and to getting virtual stickers which you can use on all of your digital platforms to show the World that you are a proud member of the Project EMPOWER tribe. 

Funding Project EMPOWER will make dreams come true and will help to show the World what can happen through the focused execution of planned ambitious endeavour. 

 

The Impact

Through stories, we share passions, fears, sadness, hardships, and joys, and we find common ground with other people so that we can connect and communicate with them. Stories are universal, conveying meaning and purpose that help us understand ourselves better and find commonality with others. The Project EMPOWER story will be a work of fact that will be available to the World and your contribution to this campaign will directly impact our ability to create and share this life forming and affirming story with the World. 

 

Risks & Challenges

The risks and challenges associated with this endeavour are immense but between us we have amassed a significant body of relevant experience that we believe will enable us to overcome whatever those challenges and risks may be. It is not our first time to undertake an Atlantic rowing challenge. In 2017 Damian successfully delivered a project that saw him overcome many significant obstacles and successfully row solo from Tenerife in the Canaries to Antigua in the Caribbean. Weather mapping and route planning will be hugely important and as an established Ocean Rower, Damian has built considerable expertise in this regard.

Damian and Fergus will have to be in supreme shape physically, mentally and spiritually. Both have proven ability in this regard. Damian as a former professional rugby player and extreme adventurer who has never failed to complete any of his extraordinary planned ambitious endeavours and Fergus who was told he would never walk again in October 2018 but one year later walked 206km from one side of Ireland to the other and in the process raised €70,000 for the Irish National Rehabilitation Clinic.

There will be commercial and logistical challenges and while it is impossible to predict the future, it is important to ensure that our intentions inform our realities. In this regard MacDara has served as commercial director for the 2012 Volvo Ocean Race Grand Finale, has created significant events in Ireland including Galway Skates and Malahide  Skates and as Past President of Junior Chamber Ireland has a significant network of national and international political, social and commercial entrepreneurs who are only to happy to share their expertise to ensure that Project EMPOWER overcomes any commercial or logistical challenges it may encounter. Critically Project EMPOWER is a "planned" ambitious endeavour and every effort is being made to guarantee that the plan prepared when executed will deliver the outcomes desired.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that times are tough. The World has been rocked by a pandemic, the scale of which is unprecedented and we fully understand that your resources may not allow you to contribute at this time and this is perfectly fine. However, if you like our project and feel that there are ways you can help please let us know how through our website or social media pages. Also if you could share our  indiegogo link with your contacts we'd really appreciate it.
story_txt:
Who We Are and What is Project EMPOWER?
We are three guys from Galway, Ireland. The sport of rugby brought us together almost 20 years ago when Damian and Fergus played for the Galwegians RFC senior team that MacDara managed. Damian and Fergus are in their very early forties and MacDara is at least a decade older than both of them! All three of us are self employed, Damian as an extreme adventurer and speaker, Fergus owns and operates a small bus company and MacDara is a business consultant specialising in the tourism, leisure and hospitality sectors. In our lives we enjoy and endure the same struggles, challenges and opportunities as most people but what sets us apart is our dogged determination, our never, ever give up attitude  and our absolute belief in the power of "me". We believe that digging deep enables us to climb high and we need you to help us prove just how high digging deep can take us and to help us share that learning with the World. These beliefs have helped Damian win European Cups, row the Atlantic solo and climb the worlds highest mountains, have helped Fergus to walk again after suffering a life threatening spinal injury in 2018  and helped MacDara survive the global financial crisis in 2008.
Project EMPOWER has grown out of Damian's ambition to row the Atlantic from New York to Galway, Fergus's ambition to show the World that suffering a life threatening debilitating injury does not mean that life can no longer be lived and MacDara's desire to help us to be our very best selves in every second of every minute of every hour of every day that we're gifted.

In 2017 Damian successfully delivered a project that saw him overcome many significant obstacles and successfully row solo from Tenerife in the Canaries to Antigua in the Caribbean. Weather mapping and route planning will be hugely important and as an established Ocean Rower, Damian has built considerable expertise in this regard.

Damian as a former professional rugby player and extreme adventurer who has never failed to complete any of his extraordinary planned ambitious endeavours and Fergus who was told he would never walk again in October 2018 but one year later walked 206km from one side of Ireland to the other and in the process raised €70,000 for the Irish National Rehabilitation Clinic.

However, if you like our project and feel that there are ways you can help please let us know how through our website or social media pages. Also if you could share our  indiegogo link with your contacts we'd really appreciate it.

story:
sheltaPod has reinvented the campervan & vehicle awning.

The half dome tent can concertina up to a simple sun canopy. This allows for unrestricted views of the beautiful countryside. But when the weather turns bad, we can quickly unhook the tiebacks clips and fold the tent down again.

INSTANT shelter from the wind and rain....WITHIN SECONDS! 

When sheltaPod is folded down it creates a sheltered area for cooking and dining. When it's time for bed, a separate inner tent with integrated groundsheet can be clipped into the rainfly. 

sheltaPod is the ONLY awning that can actually adapt to changing weather

 

     

 

APRIL 2018 UPDATE

We have now sold out of the blue colour and expect to be completely out of stock by the end of May 2018. The lead time with our factory is four months so it's too late to order another batch for this European/USA summer. However sheltaPod is proving very popular and so we want to offer even more stock and colours for spring 2019.  Please help us by pre-ordering now for the blue colour and get us to our stretch funding goal of

$180,000

Once reached, we'll be able to place an even bigger order with our factory and expand our colour range. THANK YOU

2018 customer Tony enjoying his sheltaPod on a recent trip to Spain. Pic courtesy of EndingUpAnywhere.com

 

Also included is an Inner Tent with integrated groundsheet for sleeping (double airbed fits easily inside)

 

            

 

A separate waterproof front panel clips into the Pod entrance and provides secure storage when you don't want to use the inner tent. And there's a central zip for easy access. This is ideal for overnight storage or drive away.

ACCESSORIES

We also include Privacy 'side' Panels and a Rainfly Groundsheet.

The panels will be colour matched to the orange, blue or grey sheltaPod and works just like a windbreaker. It also offers campers a bit more privacy on busy campsites as well as stability to the telescopic poles they attach to.

              

 

             

The rainfly groundsheet is design to be used on rough ground or when campers want to keep their gear dry. It's shaped to fit the rainfly base perfectly and clips easily onto the existing rainfly tent pegs. Ideal for when the user doesn't want to use the inner tent but can be left in place if the inner tent is used...and provides even more ground protection. 

We've also added another mesh panel & curtain into the inner tent for camping in hot climates and if there are lots of bugs around. Now you have extra ventilation on those hot sticky nights without the worry of being bitten to death!

               

 

OUR STORY SO FAR....

In May 2017 we shipped around 320 sheltaPod awnings to our Indiegogo backers. We then started selling the remaining stock of 180 on our website and SOLD OUT in just TWO months. We now have sheltaPod's all over the world from Alaska to Sri Lanka which is just AWESOME!

             

2018

For 2018, we're introduced a more neutral grey colour and useful accessories to our product range. We've also made some improvements to the design based on our customer feedback.  

 

SEE SHELTAPOD ON THE ROAD

           

 

 

               

 

             

 

         Featured in:

               

sheltaPod is a half dome tent combined with a sun canopy which attaches to the side of the vehicle. But unlike many other campervan awnings, there are no side panels to block the light or obscure your views.

                 

The arched pole sections retract back to create a simple sun canopy then fold down again to a tent you can sleep in. 

              

 

                 

ATTACHMENT METHODS

                 

For campervans with an awning rail there is the gutter rail option (A) where a pole slides into the pole sleeve and then clamps securely in place (please note that the pole and clamps are not supplied with sheltaPod). There is also a bending strip that threads into the C channel (B). If you want to drive away then you also need a Kador strip and figure of eight which can been seen in the photo but does not come with sheltaPod. However we do supply 4 x five meter webbing straps for 'over the top' attachment (C) and you will also see three velcro straps that can attach to roof bars/racks. And finally you can use suction clamps (D) (not supplied) that attach to the pole in the pole sleeve. This is suitable for flat roof vehicles.

No campervan. No worries! sheltaPod can attach to almost any vehicle using the adjustable webbing/buckle straps included in the bag.

                  

                  

                  

sheltaPod can also attach to the tailgate of your vehicle if you want better access to the boot space. Perfect for getting changed before and after a days hiking, swimming, cycling, scuba diving, surfing.....you name it! 

                 

 

              

          

 

sheltaPod is a stylish and versatile campervan awning that can adapt to the changing weather. 

Gather up the fabric in each section and clip it to the pole sleeves. Each pole sleeve has several buckles/hoops so they can be clipped against each other. Also on each side of the door there are windbreaker panels which can be tied back when not needed.

If it starts to rain it's easy to extend the canopy and get more cover. Drop down one or two sections if you still want to enjoy the views. Drop down all the sections, peg into the ground and extend the windbreaker panels for complete shelter. 

The Pod section provides space for cooking and dining that's out of the wind and rain. It's also great for extra storage for camping equipment, bicycles, surf/diving wetsuits, etc. Just clip in the front panel and your gear is protected.

 

 

If you want more comfort you can clip in the inner tent. This offers extra sleeping space with a mesh panel that gives a view through to the PVC skylight window on the rainfly. Great for stargazing! But if you want to avoid the harsh daylight of the morning, there's a clip in curtain you can use.

Check out this Guided Tour of sheltaPod by creator Julie Ritson

 

Check out our original crowdfunding backers with their sheltaPod's. Thank you so much guys!

 

DRIVE-AWAY

 Please watch the video below to see how sheltaPod works in Drive-away mode.

Not got any wheels!

sheltaPod can also be used as a Stand Alone Tent. Perfect as a fishing/angling/beach shelter.

 

 

sheltaPod offers a good compromise between size and ease of set up. Just how much space do we really need when we have a campervan next door! Realistically all we need is somewhere to cook and eat outside the van. And the inner tent provides additional sleeping for three adults/two adults & two children which should be enough for family and friends.

 

 

sheltaPod has gone through many redesigns and prototypes. We tried putting a door on the outer rainfly but direct tensioning on the poles made it difficult to zip up once inside the half-dome tent. Eventually we introduced a separate front panel as the best way of protecting gear when not using the inner tent.  We also redesigned the pole connection system for the rainfly, the inner tent connection method and how it attaches to the van. 

Each of our FIVE prototypes were fully field tested and redesigned if necessary. All the photos and video on this campaign page show the final 'fully working' pre-production sheltaPod. It is ready for mass production, which is where you come in. There is a minimum order quantity on each colour and so the minimum order is 700 awnings. This is why we are crowdfunding, we need to raise a minimum of $60,000 to get sheltaPod into it's first production run and onto campsites by spring 2017. 

 

 

"After viewing this at Camper Calling I'm very very impressed, good quality ...one of the best designs I've ever seen, go for it and back it" Jason W

"It really is an amazing piece of kit. So versatile and well thought out and the quality is high. I saw Julie several times at Camper Calling and she has totally developed this project and taken comments on board.  There is nothing else like this on the market!" Tracey K

"Great product, well thought out. I can't wait to be using one early next year"  Chris C

"It was great to see sheltaPod in the flesh after reading so much about it. It looks great, good quality and really versatile. I was impressed with the packed size and how light it is, as this was one thing I wasn't sure about. Although I've already got an awning and a sun canopy, I can see this offers something a bit different, quirky and stylish, but practical"  Deborah G

"Saw sheltaPod at Camper Calling and loved it, we don't like awnings because of losing the easy access of the sliding door area! So use a canopy and a little tent for storage... So for us this couldn't be better!!! Great product and lovely people. Wishing you luck" X   Jo O

 

 

One of the unique features of sheltaPod is the big skylight windows. These let light flood in and are great for stargazing at night. But if it gets too hot and you want some shade, just clip in the separate curtain panels. Each skylight window has it's own curtain so you can choose how much shade you want.

Pre-attached guy lines with velcro tie backs for your convenience.

 

 

  • Rainfly - 75D 190T PU3000mm Polyester, double taped seams
  • Inner tent 190T breathable polyester with mesh window, fabric curtain, mesh and fabric doors and bathtub style PE groundsheet 
  • Intergrated windbreaker side panel
  • Separate front panel for secure storage
  • Separate rainfly groundsheet
  • Two side privacy panels
  • Side ventilation flaps
  • Strong, durable aluminium tent poles
  • Two telescopic upright poles and one adjustable cross bar to support the canopy roof. 
  • Two curtains for skylight windows with buckles for attaching inside and hooks for outside. Attach outside in harsh sunlight to protect the PVC windows from damaging UV rays.
  • Two internal mesh pockets on the rainfly
  • Awning attachment via C channel, pole sleeve for J/gutter rails, webbing and velcro straps for 'over the top' and roof bar/rack attachment and three gaps in the pole sleeve for suction clamps (see below for more details)
  •  15 webbing loops on the pole sleeves for attaching guy lines
  • Tent pegs
  • Reflective guy lines
  • Fits campervans 190 - 240 cm high (can go to 280cm - see 'Will it fit my van height' diagram below)
  • Pack size - 90cm x 30cm x 20cm
  • Pack weight - 11 kgs
  • Solo pitching time - 10-15 minutes

 

 
Solo set up time is 10 - 15mins (rainfly only). Check out our video on how it's done.

 

 

We want sheltaPod to attach to most types of vehicle, not just camper vans with awning rails. This is why we have incorporated FIVE different attachment methods:

C Channel - using 'figure of 8' and Kador strip (not included) into awning rail

J Rail & Pole Sleeve - Insert pole (not included) into the pole sleeve and then place into J/gutter rail. Use two butterfly clips (not included) to clamp in place at each end where the pole sticks out.

FOR ATTACHING TO SUV's/JEEPS/VANS WITH NO AWNING RAIL

Velcro straps - 3 x velcro double straps allow for attachment to roof/roll bars and roof racks. The hoop sided velcro strap is 14cm and the loop side is 14cm...total 28cm. This provides enough velcro to go around a maximum width bar of 24cm.

Webbing straps with release buckles - 4x webbing straps in total, 2x are designed to pull the awning taut over the top of the van, then 2x at the side to tension the awning front and back. This is to reduce sideways movement. We supply separate 5 x 5 metre long adjustable webbing straps. They attach to awning using release buckles then peg into the ground at the other end.

Suction clamp method (not included) - there are 3x semi-circle gaps in the pole sleeve to allow for clamps to attach to the metal of the pole inside. These are then attached to suction clamps which can attach to any part of the vehicle roof.

Will it fit my van height?

sheltaPod is incredibly flexible when it comes to attachment methods. Our customers have attached sheltaPod to a wide range of vehicles from teardrop trailers to Tuktuk's!

Here's sheltaPod attached to a hightop panel van. 

 

sheltaPod can attach to a wide variety of vehicles, caravan's and trailers.

 

 

These will only be added to our crowdfunding campaign once we reach the Stretch Goal for each accessory (see earlier diagram)

BLACKOUT/HEAT REFLECTIVE CANOPY

To help campers sleep better and stay cooler, we have designed this Blackout/Heat Reflective Canopy which clips easily onto the outside of the Pod tent in under 30 seconds.

This can also stop prying eyes looking in at any gear you have stored while you are away. 

 

Disclaimer

We tried this product on an extremely windy day for testing (winds in excess of 25MPH). Although sheltaPod held up well, it does tend to sway from side to side. To reduce this you must use more guy lines and we have provided six pre-attached guy lines and six additional guy lines for your use.

Also in windy conditions the sun canopy can act like a giant sail. This puts extra stress on the material and may cause damage to the sheltaPod. Therefore we strongly recommend that you detach the sun canopy from the vehicle, gather up the fabric and clip above the door of the Pod tent. Make sure you have used all the pre-attached guy lines to make sure that the Pod tent stays upright on it's own. 

In heavy rain, water can pool on the sun canopy and create a leak around the area where the awning attaches to the van. To reduce this problem, lower one of the vertical poles so that the canopy slopes to one side. The water will then easily run off. Also make sure you have placed the horizontal crossbar into the sun canopy between the two telescopic poles. This creates an apex which allows the rain to run off.

sheltaPod like most tents is NOT fire resistant. Therefore do not place hot appliances near the wall, roof or curtains. Please follow the Fire Precautions advice provided.

sheltaPod campervan awning is NOT designed for winter/extreme conditions. It is a spring/summer/autumn product. 

Pricing

Perks are shown in USD. This is because Indiegogo can only accept PayPal payments in other currencies. But they can accept both PayPal AND credit cards if the perks are in USD. We chose USD because we want our backers to have both options.

* Prices will vary depending on the current GBP/USD exchange rate.

Perks

When you back us, not only will you get a sheltaPod campervan awning as a perk. You will be backing the creation of a new company - sheltaCamp Ltd - whose aim will be to bring innovative and stylish products into the campervan awnings/accessories market. We want to offer a wide range of colours and customisations to sheltaPod, as well as useful assessories.

We are offering sheltaPod including the inner tent. The inner tent may become an extra when they eventually go on sale because we recognise that some people want the option to buy just the rainfly (which includes the front panel and curtains). But for our Indiegogo campaign we are including it as part of our perks.

If you feel our perk amounts are not very competitive against similar products currently in the campervan awnings market, we ask that you consider the following:

    •    sheltaPod is a unique, stylish and slightly complex design. It definitely takes a long time to stitch together (I can personally vouch for that!)

    •    However this complex design does offer the user more versatility than most other   campervan awnings currently on the market - it's a sun canopy and tent awning all in one, so no need to buy separate products. 

    •    sheltaPod is currently manufactured and shipped in smaller quantities, so we're not able to compete with the bigger awning companies on price point but we definitely hope to in the future.

Also we currently don't include VAT but at some point we will have to add this when we reach the threshold. At that point the sheltaPod RRP will increase to £295 but this will only reflect the amount we have to pay in VAT.

Returns Policy

We do not offer refunds or returns on sheltaPod campervan awnings that were received as an Indiegogo perk.

Crowdfunding is an amazing tool that allows people to get their ideas off the ground. Indiegogo is not a store and our 'perks' are the way that we say thank you for supporting us (and trust us, we are VERY grateful). All funds received from this campaign will go directly into making the grey sheltaPod and accessories a reality.

Please refer to the Indiegogo policy here

Warranty

We will repair or replace any sheltaPod product but only if it requires repair due to a manufacturing or materials defect which results in water leaks, delimitation, faulty zips, faulty fittings or faulty materials. If one of the poles is faulty we can send you a replacement. We must be notified within 28 days from the receiving date of your awning. 

Exclusions: cosmetic defects i.e: loose threads or gaps in seam tape, wear and tear, condensation, dragging, abuse or misuse, accidents, falling objects, improper set up, burn holes, extreme weather or damage caused by insects, animals or children.

Please remember that this is the early stages of a new product and therefore there will be a few issues that will need to be ironed out. We cannot guarantee that every single awning will be perfect and we ask that you work with us to rectify any issues. We want to identify and improve the product but need your help and understanding to do so. Hence we will recommend repair options as a first course of action.

The Mission

We wanted to shake up the campervan awnings market and in 2017/18, we think we did just that! We sold out of our first production run stock in just two months and sheltaPod's are now attached to campervans all around the world. Now we want to grow further and offer more colours, customisations and stylish accessories. 

But that can only happen with your help. Please back us and become part of this exciting journey.

 

Risks and Challenges

We're buzzing with excitement because we believe we've got a great product and we've had fantastic feedback so far. We're also working with a very experienced manufacturer and have excellent advisors around us. We've been developing sheltaPod for over 20 months. With each prototype, we've field tested the design, identified weak areas and made improvements. With sheltaPod MkII, we believe we've created the best product possible and we know we’re onto a winner.  We can't wait to expand our product range and offer more accessories as quickly as possible. However we also want to make sure that everything goes smoothly and our supply chain is solid. This is why we have limited the quantities within our perks. Our aim is to give our backers the best customer service experience possible and we can only do this if we keep control of the fulfilment volume.

sheltaPod is unique amongst campervan awnings and has gone through many prototype versions. We have spent a long time refining the design and have worked extremely hard to get the product ready for Indiegogo. But there will be risks and challenges along the way:

MANUFACTURING: This is a process where many things can go wrong but we’re confident that our manufacturer can handle large production orders, and we plan to personally oversee all the important stages of the manufacturing process.

PRODUCT ADJUSTMENTS: We may make some minor adjustments to improve the final product but what you see on this campaign page is the minimum of what you’ll get.  Our final prototype as seen on this page and website has already gone through months of improvements but we will continue to take onboard suggestions right up to the start of production. Adjustments will always be for the benefit of you, our customer, and we will let you know exactly how, when and why they are made.

FULFILMENT: Sometimes we’re faced with an unpredictable situation – e.g. a supplier misses a deadline, there’s a breakdown of machinery, or a shipment gets lost. Those things can cause a delay. However I will be personally orchestrating the communication between our suppliers, all the way through to the delivery at your door.

We're working with manufacturers who have years of experience delivering large quantities of excellent-quality products in the outdoor industry. Undoubtedly there will be some surprises along the way, but we’re confident that we can deliver your campervan awning by March/April 2018. Nonetheless, should any delays be expected, we will always keep you in the loop.

WE SHIP ALL OUR PRODUCTS FROM OUR WAREHOUSE IN THE UK

We'd love to be able to cover costs for delivering sheltaPod around the world, but shipping is expensive for packages of this size and varies by location. However, we're doing our best to make shipping as cost-effective as possible for our backers. 

If we get enough orders from your country to organise localised shipping, we'll recalculate the costs and refund you the difference. 

We would love to get localised shipping costs for the US, Canada and Australia as we get a lot of interest from these countries but postage is currently very expensive. We're currently working on offering a more cost efficient delivery service. However in the meantime, if you are from one of these countries, would love a sheltaPod but can’t pay the postage then reach out to us and if we get enough of you then we can significantly lower these costs and refund you the difference.

Help us make www.sheltaPodcampervanawnings.co.uk a success by clicking the ‘Back it’ button at the top of the page. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If your not able to back us then you can still contribute. Please help get the word out about our campaign. You can use the Indiegogo share tools and share our Facebook page/posts, retweet our Twitter posts and make some noise in any way you can.

https://www.facebook.com/sheltaCamp/

https://twitter.com/sheltaCamp

https://www.instagram.com/sheltapod/
story_txt:
sheltaPod has reinvented the campervan & vehicle awning.
The half dome tent can concertina up to a simple sun canopy. This allows for unrestricted views of the beautiful countryside. But when the weather turns bad, we can quickly unhook the tiebacks clips and fold the tent down again.
INSTANT shelter from the wind and rain....WITHIN SECONDS! 

When sheltaPod is folded down it creates a sheltered area for cooking and dining. When it's time for bed, a separate inner tent with integrated groundsheet can be clipped into the rainfly. 
sheltaPod is the ONLY awning that can actually adapt to changing weather
 
     

 
APRIL 2018 UPDATE
We have now sold out of the blue colour and expect to be completely out of stock by the end of May 2018. The lead time with our factory is four months so it's too late to order another batch for this European/USA summer. However sheltaPod is proving very popular and so we want to offer even more stock and colours for spring 2019.  Please help us by pre-ordering now for the blue colour and get us to our stretch funding goal of
$180,000
Once reached, we'll be able to place an even bigger order with our factory and expand our colour range. THANK YOU

2018 customer Tony enjoying his sheltaPod on a recent trip to Spain. Pic courtesy of EndingUpAnywhere.com
 
Also included is an Inner Tent with integrated groundsheet for sleeping (double airbed fits easily inside)
 
            
 

A separate waterproof front panel clips into the Pod entrance and provides secure storage when you don't want to use the inner tent. And there's a central zip for easy access. This is ideal for overnight storage or drive away.

ACCESSORIES
We also include Privacy 'side' Panels and a Rainfly Groundsheet.
The panels will be colour matched to the orange, blue or grey sheltaPod and works just like a windbreaker. It also offers campers a bit more privacy on busy campsites as well as stability to the telescopic poles they attach to.
              
 
             
The rainfly groundsheet is design to be used on rough ground or when campers want to keep their gear dry. It's shaped to fit the rainfly base perfectly and clips easily onto the existing rainfly tent pegs. Ideal for when the user doesn't want to use the inner tent but can be left in place if the inner tent is used...and provides even more ground protection. 

We've also added another mesh panel & curtain into the inner tent for camping in hot climates and if there are lots of bugs around. Now you have extra ventilation on those hot sticky nights without the worry of being bitten to death!
               
 
OUR STORY SO FAR....
In May 2017 we shipped around 320 sheltaPod awnings to our Indiegogo backers. We then started selling the remaining stock of 180 on our website and SOLD OUT in just TWO months. We now have sheltaPod's all over the world from Alaska to Sri Lanka which is just AWESOME!
             
2018
For 2018, we're introduced a more neutral grey colour and useful accessories to our product range. We've also made some improvements to the design based on our customer feedback.  

 
SEE SHELTAPOD ON THE ROAD

           

 

 
               
 
             
 
         Featured in:
               
sheltaPod is a half dome tent combined with a sun canopy which attaches to the side of the vehicle. But unlike many other campervan awnings, there are no side panels to block the light or obscure your views.
                 
The arched pole sections retract back to create a simple sun canopy then fold down again to a tent you can sleep in. 
              

 
                 
ATTACHMENT METHODS
                 
For campervans with an awning rail there is the gutter rail option (A) where a pole slides into the pole sleeve and then clamps securely in place (please note that the pole and clamps are not supplied with sheltaPod). There is also a bending strip that threads into the C channel (B). If you want to drive away then you also need a Kador strip and figure of eight which can been seen in the photo but does not come with sheltaPod. However we do supply 4 x five meter webbing straps for 'over the top' attachment (C) and you will also see three velcro straps that can attach to roof bars/racks. And finally you can use suction clamps (D) (not supplied) that attach to the pole in the pole sleeve. This is suitable for flat roof vehicles.
No campervan. No worries! sheltaPod can attach to almost any vehicle using the adjustable webbing/buckle straps included in the bag.
                  
                  
                  
sheltaPod can also attach to the tailgate of your vehicle if you want better access to the boot space. Perfect for getting changed before and after a days hiking, swimming, cycling, scuba diving, surfing.....you name it! 
                  
 
              
          

 
sheltaPod is a stylish and versatile campervan awning that can adapt to the changing weather. 

Gather up the fabric in each section and clip it to the pole sleeves. Each pole sleeve has several buckles/hoops so they can be clipped against each other. Also on each side of the door there are windbreaker panels which can be tied back when not needed.

If it starts to rain it's easy to extend the canopy and get more cover. Drop down one or two sections if you still want to enjoy the views. Drop down all the sections, peg into the ground and extend the windbreaker panels for complete shelter. 

The Pod section provides space for cooking and dining that's out of the wind and rain. It's also great for extra storage for camping equipment, bicycles, surf/diving wetsuits, etc. Just clip in the front panel and your gear is protected.

 

 

If you want more comfort you can clip in the inner tent. This offers extra sleeping space with a mesh panel that gives a view through to the PVC skylight window on the rainfly. Great for stargazing! But if you want to avoid the harsh daylight of the morning, there's a clip in curtain you can use.


Check out this Guided Tour of sheltaPod by creator Julie Ritson


 
Check out our original crowdfunding backers with their sheltaPod's. Thank you so much guys!

 

DRIVE-AWAY

 Please watch the video below to see how sheltaPod works in Drive-away mode.



Not got any wheels!
sheltaPod can also be used as a Stand Alone Tent. Perfect as a fishing/angling/beach shelter.



 

 
sheltaPod offers a good compromise between size and ease of set up. Just how much space do we really need when we have a campervan next door! Realistically all we need is somewhere to cook and eat outside the van. And the inner tent provides additional sleeping for three adults/two adults & two children which should be enough for family and friends.

 


 
sheltaPod has gone through many redesigns and prototypes. We tried putting a door on the outer rainfly but direct tensioning on the poles made it difficult to zip up once inside the half-dome tent. Eventually we introduced a separate front panel as the best way of protecting gear when not using the inner tent.  We also redesigned the pole connection system for the rainfly, the inner tent connection method and how it attaches to the van. 
Each of our FIVE prototypes were fully field tested and redesigned if necessary. All the photos and video on this campaign page show the final 'fully working' pre-production sheltaPod. It is ready for mass production, which is where you come in. There is a minimum order quantity on each colour and so the minimum order is 700 awnings. This is why we are crowdfunding, we need to raise a minimum of $60,000 to get sheltaPod into it's first production run and onto campsites by spring 2017. 


 

 
"After viewing this at Camper Calling I'm very very impressed, good quality ...one of the best designs I've ever seen, go for it and back it" Jason W
"It really is an amazing piece of kit. So versatile and well thought out and the quality is high. I saw Julie several times at Camper Calling and she has totally developed this project and taken comments on board.  There is nothing else like this on the market!" Tracey K
"Great product, well thought out. I can't wait to be using one early next year"  Chris C
"It was great to see sheltaPod in the flesh after reading so much about it. It looks great, good quality and really versatile. I was impressed with the packed size and how light it is, as this was one thing I wasn't sure about. Although I've already got an awning and a sun canopy, I can see this offers something a bit different, quirky and stylish, but practical"  Deborah G
"Saw sheltaPod at Camper Calling and loved it, we don't like awnings because of losing the easy access of the sliding door area! So use a canopy and a little tent for storage... So for us this couldn't be better!!! Great product and lovely people. Wishing you luck" X   Jo O

 

 
One of the unique features of sheltaPod is the big skylight windows. These let light flood in and are great for stargazing at night. But if it gets too hot and you want some shade, just clip in the separate curtain panels. Each skylight window has it's own curtain so you can choose how much shade you want.

Pre-attached guy lines with velcro tie backs for your convenience.

 

 

Rainfly - 75D 190T PU3000mm Polyester, double taped seams
Inner tent 190T breathable polyester with mesh window, fabric curtain, mesh and fabric doors and bathtub style PE groundsheet 
Intergrated windbreaker side panel
Separate front panel for secure storage
Separate rainfly groundsheet
Two side privacy panels
Side ventilation flaps
Strong, durable aluminium tent poles
Two telescopic upright poles and one adjustable cross bar to support the canopy roof. 
Two curtains for skylight windows with buckles for attaching inside and hooks for outside. Attach outside in harsh sunlight to protect the PVC windows from damaging UV rays.
Two internal mesh pockets on the rainfly
Awning attachment via C channel, pole sleeve for J/gutter rails, webbing and velcro straps for 'over the top' and roof bar/rack attachment and three gaps in the pole sleeve for suction clamps (see below for more details)
 15 webbing loops on the pole sleeves for attaching guy lines
Tent pegs
Reflective guy lines
Fits campervans 190 - 240 cm high (can go to 280cm - see 'Will it fit my van height' diagram below)
Pack size - 90cm x 30cm x 20cm
Pack weight - 11 kgs
Solo pitching time - 10-15 minutes



 

 
Solo set up time is 10 - 15mins (rainfly only). Check out our video on how it's done.


 


 
We want sheltaPod to attach to most types of vehicle, not just camper vans with awning rails. This is why we have incorporated FIVE different attachment methods:
C Channel - using 'figure of 8' and Kador strip (not included) into awning rail
J Rail & Pole Sleeve - Insert pole (not included) into the pole sleeve and then place into J/gutter rail. Use two butterfly clips (not included) to clamp in place at each end where the pole sticks out.
FOR ATTACHING TO SUV's/JEEPS/VANS WITH NO AWNING RAIL
Velcro straps - 3 x velcro double straps allow for attachment to roof/roll bars and roof racks. The hoop sided velcro strap is 14cm and the loop side is 14cm...total 28cm. This provides enough velcro to go around a maximum width bar of 24cm.
Webbing straps with release buckles - 4x webbing straps in total, 2x are designed to pull the awning taut over the top of the van, then 2x at the side to tension the awning front and back. This is to reduce sideways movement. We supply separate 5 x 5 metre long adjustable webbing straps. They attach to awning using release buckles then peg into the ground at the other end.
Suction clamp method (not included) - there are 3x semi-circle gaps in the pole sleeve to allow for clamps to attach to the metal of the pole inside. These are then attached to suction clamps which can attach to any part of the vehicle roof.
Will it fit my van height?
sheltaPod is incredibly flexible when it comes to attachment methods. Our customers have attached sheltaPod to a wide range of vehicles from teardrop trailers to Tuktuk's!
Here's sheltaPod attached to a hightop panel van. 
 
sheltaPod can attach to a wide variety of vehicles, caravan's and trailers.

 

 

These will only be added to our crowdfunding campaign once we reach the Stretch Goal for each accessory (see earlier diagram)
BLACKOUT/HEAT REFLECTIVE CANOPY
To help campers sleep better and stay cooler, we have designed this Blackout/Heat Reflective Canopy which clips easily onto the outside of the Pod tent in under 30 seconds.
This can also stop prying eyes looking in at any gear you have stored while you are away. 

 
Disclaimer
We tried this product on an extremely windy day for testing (winds in excess of 25MPH). Although sheltaPod held up well, it does tend to sway from side to side. To reduce this you must use more guy lines and we have provided six pre-attached guy lines and six additional guy lines for your use.
Also in windy conditions the sun canopy can act like a giant sail. This puts extra stress on the material and may cause damage to the sheltaPod. Therefore we strongly recommend that you detach the sun canopy from the vehicle, gather up the fabric and clip above the door of the Pod tent. Make sure you have used all the pre-attached guy lines to make sure that the Pod tent stays upright on it's own. 
In heavy rain, water can pool on the sun canopy and create a leak around the area where the awning attaches to the van. To reduce this problem, lower one of the vertical poles so that the canopy slopes to one side. The water will then easily run off. Also make sure you have placed the horizontal crossbar into the sun canopy between the two telescopic poles. This creates an apex which allows the rain to run off.
sheltaPod like most tents is NOT fire resistant. Therefore do not place hot appliances near the wall, roof or curtains. Please follow the Fire Precautions advice provided.
sheltaPod campervan awning is NOT designed for winter/extreme conditions. It is a spring/summer/autumn product. 
Pricing
Perks are shown in USD. This is because Indiegogo can only accept PayPal payments in other currencies. But they can accept both PayPal AND credit cards if the perks are in USD. We chose USD because we want our backers to have both options.
* Prices will vary depending on the current GBP/USD exchange rate.
Perks
When you back us, not only will you get a sheltaPod campervan awning as a perk. You will be backing the creation of a new company - sheltaCamp Ltd - whose aim will be to bring innovative and stylish products into the campervan awnings/accessories market. We want to offer a wide range of colours and customisations to sheltaPod, as well as useful assessories.
We are offering sheltaPod including the inner tent. The inner tent may become an extra when they eventually go on sale because we recognise that some people want the option to buy just the rainfly (which includes the front panel and curtains). But for our Indiegogo campaign we are including it as part of our perks.
If you feel our perk amounts are not very competitive against similar products currently in the campervan awnings market, we ask that you consider the following:
    •    sheltaPod is a unique, stylish and slightly complex design. It definitely takes a long time to stitch together (I can personally vouch for that!)
    •    However this complex design does offer the user more versatility than most other   campervan awnings currently on the market - it's a sun canopy and tent awning all in one, so no need to buy separate products. 
    •    sheltaPod is currently manufactured and shipped in smaller quantities, so we're not able to compete with the bigger awning companies on price point but we definitely hope to in the future.
Also we currently don't include VAT but at some point we will have to add this when we reach the threshold. At that point the sheltaPod RRP will increase to £295 but this will only reflect the amount we have to pay in VAT.
Returns Policy
We do not offer refunds or returns on sheltaPod campervan awnings that were received as an Indiegogo perk.
Crowdfunding is an amazing tool that allows people to get their ideas off the ground. Indiegogo is not a store and our 'perks' are the way that we say thank you for supporting us (and trust us, we are VERY grateful). All funds received from this campaign will go directly into making the grey sheltaPod and accessories a reality.
Please refer to the Indiegogo policy here
Warranty
We will repair or replace any sheltaPod product but only if it requires repair due to a manufacturing or materials defect which results in water leaks, delimitation, faulty zips, faulty fittings or faulty materials. If one of the poles is faulty we can send you a replacement. We must be notified within 28 days from the receiving date of your awning. 
Exclusions: cosmetic defects i.e: loose threads or gaps in seam tape, wear and tear, condensation, dragging, abuse or misuse, accidents, falling objects, improper set up, burn holes, extreme weather or damage caused by insects, animals or children.
Please remember that this is the early stages of a new product and therefore there will be a few issues that will need to be ironed out. We cannot guarantee that every single awning will be perfect and we ask that you work with us to rectify any issues. We want to identify and improve the product but need your help and understanding to do so. Hence we will recommend repair options as a first course of action.
The Mission
We wanted to shake up the campervan awnings market and in 2017/18, we think we did just that! We sold out of our first production run stock in just two months and sheltaPod's are now attached to campervans all around the world. Now we want to grow further and offer more colours, customisations and stylish accessories. 
But that can only happen with your help. Please back us and become part of this exciting journey.

 
Risks and Challenges
We're buzzing with excitement because we believe we've got a great product and we've had fantastic feedback so far. We're also working with a very experienced manufacturer and have excellent advisors around us. We've been developing sheltaPod for over 20 months. With each prototype, we've field tested the design, identified weak areas and made improvements. With sheltaPod MkII, we believe we've created the best product possible and we know we’re onto a winner.  We can't wait to expand our product range and offer more accessories as quickly as possible. However we also want to make sure that everything goes smoothly and our supply chain is solid. This is why we have limited the quantities within our perks. Our aim is to give our backers the best customer service experience possible and we can only do this if we keep control of the fulfilment volume.
sheltaPod is unique amongst campervan awnings and has gone through many prototype versions. We have spent a long time refining the design and have worked extremely hard to get the product ready for Indiegogo. But there will be risks and challenges along the way:
MANUFACTURING: This is a process where many things can go wrong but we’re confident that our manufacturer can handle large production orders, and we plan to personally oversee all the important stages of the manufacturing process.
PRODUCT ADJUSTMENTS: We may make some minor adjustments to improve the final product but what you see on this campaign page is the minimum of what you’ll get.  Our final prototype as seen on this page and website has already gone through months of improvements but we will continue to take onboard suggestions right up to the start of production. Adjustments will always be for the benefit of you, our customer, and we will let you know exactly how, when and why they are made.
FULFILMENT: Sometimes we’re faced with an unpredictable situation – e.g. a supplier misses a deadline, there’s a breakdown of machinery, or a shipment gets lost. Those things can cause a delay. However I will be personally orchestrating the communication between our suppliers, all the way through to the delivery at your door.
We're working with manufacturers who have years of experience delivering large quantities of excellent-quality products in the outdoor industry. Undoubtedly there will be some surprises along the way, but we’re confident that we can deliver your campervan awning by March/April 2018. Nonetheless, should any delays be expected, we will always keep you in the loop.
WE SHIP ALL OUR PRODUCTS FROM OUR WAREHOUSE IN THE UK
We'd love to be able to cover costs for delivering sheltaPod around the world, but shipping is expensive for packages of this size and varies by location. However, we're doing our best to make shipping as cost-effective as possible for our backers. 
If we get enough orders from your country to organise localised shipping, we'll recalculate the costs and refund you the difference. 
We would love to get localised shipping costs for the US, Canada and Australia as we get a lot of interest from these countries but postage is currently very expensive. We're currently working on offering a more cost efficient delivery service. However in the meantime, if you are from one of these countries, would love a sheltaPod but can’t pay the postage then reach out to us and if we get enough of you then we can significantly lower these costs and refund you the difference.
Help us make www.sheltaPodcampervanawnings.co.uk a success by clicking the ‘Back it’ button at the top of the page. 
Other Ways You Can Help

If your not able to back us then you can still contribute. Please help get the word out about our campaign. You can use the Indiegogo share tools and share our Facebook page/posts, retweet our Twitter posts and make some noise in any way you can.
https://www.facebook.com/sheltaCamp/
https://twitter.com/sheltaCamp
https://www.instagram.com/sheltapod/

story:
Cold and snow? No problem.

Lumma was tested in serious cold conditions to guarantee you all-year-round usage. Even in Alaska.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 



 

Risks and challenges

We continue to finalize several aspects of the project. We are imporving LUMMA's waterproof feature by making small modifications to the silicone buttons.

Our team welcomes your involvement in the development process. Your feedback will help us provide you a more well-considered product. We will keep you updated about LUMMA's development and share sneak peeks of the product and the app to solicit real-time feedback.

Battery life: 
Our initial tests ran 50-52 hours on a single charge. We are almost happy with this performance. We continue to optimize the electronics to lengthen battery life.

Manufacturing: 
We have agreements in place with most of our manufacturing partners but continue to negotiate agreements for a few remaining components of the device. Our goal is to identify the best partners to meet our quality standards, deliver components on time, and partner for long-term success.

 

Gallery

You managed to get all the way here! Here's a little treat:
